story:
The I.E. Youth Slam team also known as Kxadooosh! was selected to attend this year's HBO's Brave New Voices international poetry slam and we are are excited to represent southern California specifically the Inland Empire.

We have competed for the last 3 years, winning 3 consequitive regional championships as well as ranking 6th internationaly and our youth are making a lot of noise in the poetry community. With 5 new members (ranging in age from 13-19 years old)  dedicate their time intensive writing and performing workshops for 4 months, Say Word is proud to send these amazing individuals to rep for So Cal.

Brave New Voices is a great opportunity for young poets to build community, showcase teamwork and spit their hearts out. Each year the amount of social and personal growth in each team member is astounding!

With limited funding we are asking for your support and donations to help us pay this years registration of $2000. Registration covers our attendance and participation in event, hotel and meals. Only 4 teams were selected from the entire state of California to attend and we are thankful to be one of them.

These young poets make a difference! Your donation helps these young poets more than you can imagine. If you are not able to donate please post, blog, tweet, facebook about this page WE ONLY HAVE 15 DAYS, and alot of money to raise but with your help WE CAN DO IT!!!!

for more information you can also join us on facebook at www.facebook.com/kxadooosh.

 

Thank you for support the IE Youth Team spread their stories, their voice and their hearts.

story:
“Regardless of how you feel inside, always try to look like a winner. Even if you are behind, a sustained look of control and confidence can give you a mental edge that results in victory”.

Arthur Ashe

 

WHO WE ARE

The mission of Dress for Success® Central Virginia is to promote the economic independence of disadvantaged women by providing professional attire, a network of support and the career development tools to help women thrive in work and in life. Dress for Success provides our clients the tools and confidence they need to take charge and achieve success in both their personal and professional lives.

We offer every client a confidence-boosting personal shopping experience and Career Center consultation as she graduate from a local agency or nonprofit’s job readiness program, prepares for her job interviews, and launches her new career.   

THE IMPACT

It’s no secret that today’s job market is rough. Unemployment, job applications, interviews, rejections – these things take a toll on your self-confidence. As every woman knows, what you wear has a huge impact on how you feel, and looking good and feeling good build self-confidence. By providing professional attire and a supportive environment to a woman fighting to regain her footing, Dress for Success Central Virginia helps to restore her self-confidence, which increases her chance of success in a competitive job market. 

The impact is not limited to the direct effect on the clients themselves. Working women have an outstanding impact on the economy as a whole. Many women are the primary care-takers of their family; hence helping a woman achieve economic independence has a ripple effect on the well-being of her children and her community.   

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Dress for Success Central Virginia is opening our new boutique this month. To help us launch this ambitious mission, we ask for your support in suiting our first 30 clients. Just imagine the potential impact if we could suit one woman like Veda every day for one month!  The average cost of one (1) woman’s suit is $100. Your donation, no matter the size, can put us one step closer to writing another wonderful success story.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

As Veda states in the video, working with Dress for Success gave her the ability to make strides toward her goals of becoming independent, employed and actively contributing to society.  Her story illustrates the effectiveness of the Dress for Success program.   In addition to your monetary donation we ask that you also consider donating your precious time, talent and/or treasure to help women like Veda. To learn more about our program visit us at www.dressforsuccess.org/centralvirginia.

story:
Junge Menschen für Lokalpolitik begeistern!

Wir sagen die Zeit ist reif für eine neu-artige Kommunikation zwischen einer Stadt und ihren Bürgern. Deshalb wollen wir die "Bürger App" ins Leben rufen - einen Kommunikationskanal am Puls der Zeit. Ziel ist, viele (junge) Menschen an lokale Politik spielerisch heranzuführen. 

Wie soll das funktionieren?

Städte präsentieren online ihre geplanten lokalen Projekte. Diese sind nur für die Bevölkerung des jeweiligen Ortes sichtbar. Mehr noch: Bie Bürger können mitbestimmen und ihre Meinung einfach per Klick Kund tun.

Jeder Bürger erhält virtuelles Geld, das auf die verschiedenen Projekte verteilt werden kann - sozusagen virtuelles Crowd-Funding!

Jeder Bürger kann schnell und einfach seine Meinung abgeben und den Abstimmungsprozess mitverfolgen - und die Stadt erhält ein laufendes Meinungsbarometer seiner Bürger!

Wir revolutionieren nicht die Politik, sondern die Kommunikation der Politik.
Helfen Sie uns den 1. Schritt zu tun.
 

Lokale Projekte?

Wir wollen Menschen die Möglichkeiten geben, mitzubestimmen zu Themen wie 

  • Natur- und Landschaftspflege einer Stadt (Bau, Ausbau, Umbau)
  • Sportförderung (neue Verteilung, Vorschläge)
  • Kulturförderung
  • Bildungsprojekte
  • Sparmaßnahmen
  • Verkehrsprojekte
  • Infrastrukturfragen
 

Vorteile für Städte

Die Bürger App ermöglicht Politikern
  • zeitgemäße Kommunikation mit der jungen Generation
  • politisches Engagement auf lokalpolitischer Ebene zu fördern
  • ein laufendes Stimmungsbild der Bevölkerung zu erhalten
  • Bürgern die Chance zu geben, einfach und schnell Ihre Meinung abzugeben
  • laufendes Feedback der Bevölkerung zu erhalten
  • mehr Tranparenz zu schaffen
  • sich auf einer modernen Plattform zu präsentieren

Jede Unterstützung zählt!

Wir sind ein Team von jungen Unternehmern in Berlin. Mit dem Funding wollen wir Pilotprojekte auf die Beine stellen. Gemeinsam mit Pilot-Städten in Deutschland und Österreich wollen wir das Konzept finalisieren und umsetzen.

Wir sprechen vor allem Städte und Gemeinden an, die junge Menschen für Politik begeistern wollen. Unsere größten Investoren möchten wir in das Pilot-Projekt involvieren. Allen anderen Gemeinde-Investoren stellen wir das Tool nach Fertigstellung für die "Kennenlern-Monate" kostenlos zu Verfügung.

Aber es zählt nicht nur die Unterstützung von seiten der Politiker. Wenn Ihnen als Bürger diese Idee und das Konzept gefällt, bitten wir um eine kleine Unterstützung - siehe Perks.

______________________________________

English:

Make local politics fun for citizens!

We want to set up a new form of communication between a city and its citizens. Our goal is to involve the young generation in local political decisions.

We want to create "Bürger App", a platform that enables cities to easily present their local projects.

Even more: Citizens can vote and priorities these projects – as well as share their thoughts, know-how or expertise with the community.

How that works?

Cities present future projects online. Each citizen gets access to an App or website and receives virtual money. Citizens can invest that money in the different projects - therefore show their priorities to local politicians.

This is not a political revolution but an upgrade on the communication style.

 

Local Projects?

We want people to participate in projects like

Infrastructure within a city
Funds for Sport
Funds for Culture and Art
Education
Savings initiatives

 

Advantages for cities

We help cities to 

  • get in touch with the young generation
  • get more political involvement on a community level
  • constantly see what their citizens think
  • increase political awarness
  • get feedback on planned projects
  • facilitate decision-making processes
  • present them with a modern medium

 How You Can Help

We are young entrepreneurs located in Berlin. Primarily we want to address communities and cities. With the funding we want to realize pilot-projects in German and Austrian cities.

But every voice/euro counts!

If you like the concept of "Town App" you can support us with 1€ - as a sign to politics that citizens want to participate – not in a complicated time intensive way, but easy – with the Bürger App! Check out our Perks!

story:
Summary

HeadSpace is a writing and art magazine based around the theme of mental health. The idea was born from the experiences of a group of young people who were dealing with mental health difficulties. It was clear for those who had spent time in psychiatric wards that there was a lack of appropriate reading material available there, and few places to express the artwork they had made in the ward following discharge. Others felt stigmatised around mental health which made it difficult to communicate their experiences in times of poor mental health or after an improvement.

The name HeadSpace was motivated by the idea that in culture and society, we are not given the time or capacity to express, create and think as time is money, but all of us feel the need to buy some 'headspace' - you need to be able to afford reflection, and reflection and time are essentials to maintaining positive mental health.

The zine will express and explore all aspects of mental health, positive and negative, in an effort to engage the public with an issue which is often taboo and shied away from. How do you define mental health? How does it relate to society, to family, to history? How is it perceived? What's its relationship to personal responsibility? HeadSpace doesn’t presume it will answer these questions. But it will help us all to think about them.

What We Need & What You Get

We need funds to cover our printing, costs, promotional material and to organise the launch night. 

Over ten euro = A copy of the magazine and heartfelt thank you on our facebook page!

Over twenty-five euro = A copy of the magazine with thank you messages from the editors inside the magazine, invitation to our launch night and sincere heartfelt thank you on our facebook

Over one hundred euro = A copy of the magazine with thank you messages from the editors inside the magazine, invitation to our launch night and sincere heartfelt thank you on our facebook!
A signed and framed print of art work or poetry from inside the magazine!

Over five hundred euro = A copy of the magazine with thank you messages from the editors inside the magazine, invitation to our launch night and sincere heartfelt thank you on our facebook!

Credited for helping us fund the magazine inside the front cover. An original piece from inside the magazine or commissioned piece from artist.

 

The Impact

The zine, which will be launched in May and distributed free in psychiatric wards and a school for pupils with a disability and/or mental health difficultie will act as a forum for expression and creativity based around the theme of mental health as well as showing solidarity and support for people not in the whole of their mental health.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our link where people can order the magazine online: 

http://headspacemagazine.bigcartel.com/product/headspace-issue-1

Please share our facebook: 

https://www.facebook.com/HeadSpaceForAll

Are you a performer of any kind? Would you like to perform at our launch night? 

Are you a crafty artisitic person? Would you like to sell your art and/or crafts at one of our fundraising stalls? 

Please e-mail headspacezine@gmail.com to get involved!

story:
L'aventure à moto

Après plusieurs voyages à travers le monde à moto, j'ai décidé de faire profiter aux autres motards de mon expérience. J'ai commencé la rédaction d'un livre qui montre qu'il n'est pas si difficile de partir pour plusieurs mois sur sa moto, mais que cela nécessite toutefois une bonne préparation.

Pour mon premier voyage je suis parti avec un ami avec comme but la Mongolie, et si possible plus. Finalement je suis arrivé jusqu'en Inde et au Népal en passant par l'Asie centrale et la Chine. Un voyage d'une année et demi, avec de nombreuses galères et des rencontres étonnantes. 

Nourri de cette expérience, je suis reparti, seul, et parfois en couple, pour un tour de l'Afrique, par des itinéraires inédits. Bien que le voyage soit plus difficile, j'étais mieux préparé et j'ai connu relativement peu de problèmes pendant ces 2 ans.

De retour au pays j'étais plus riche de souvenirs et d'expérience, mais plus pauvre matériellement. Cette expérience incroyable m'a donnée envie d'inciter et aider d'autres motards à vivre l'aventure de leur vie. Personne n'aime les guides techniques et austères, donc j'ai mis dans ce livre des tas d'anecdotes drôles et étonnantes qui ont pour but de dédramatiser le voyage dans des pays pas toujours faciles, et surtout de faire rêver.

Le livre contiendra également de nombreuses cartes détaillées sur les itinéraires proposés et de beaucoup de petits trucs pratiques issus de mon expérience du voyage. 

Le projet

J'ai donc laissé reposé ma moto, je me suis atablé devant mon ordinateur (rescapé du précédent voyage) et j'ai commencé à écrire. Après plusieurs mois de travail intensif, le livre est maintenant bien avancé, et vous pouvez d'ailleurs en télécharger un extrait pour vous donner une idée du résultat. Mais j'approche maintenant d'un obstacle majeur : l'édition et la publication de mon ouvrage. Lorsqu'on ne s'appelle pas Michel Houellebecq il est très difficile de retenir l'attention d'un édteur.

L'aventure aurait pu en rester là, ou résulter en un e-book peu agréable à consulter. Je me suis donc tourné vers l'auto-édition, qui est maintenant devenue possible. Avec un peu d'aide je peux m'occuper de la mise en page et de la finition. Toutefois reste l'impression, qui a un coût important et incompressible. Cette campagne de financement participatif a pour but de me permettre de lancer la première impression de mon livre.

Ce qui me manque et ce que vous obtiendrez

La rédaction du texte et la composition des nombreuse cartes sont en bonne voie. Ensuite viendra la mise en page, pour laquelle je me ferai aider. Je me trounerai ensuite vers un imprimeur en France pour préparer une impression offset. Le prix est variable selon le format, le type de papier, et la quantité de planches photos, 7500 € étant le minimum pour démarrer avec un format très simple.

Si la campagne rapporte plus, je pourrai choisir un meilleur papier et ajouter des planches photos en couleurs. 

Si les fonds ne sont pas réunis, je lancerai quand même une impression en numérique, qui permet actuellement des petites séries à un prix plus élevé qu'en offset, mais raisonable si on se passe de planches couleurs. Donc dans tous les cas, vous recevrez un exemplaire du livre si vous y avez souscrit.

Les fonds seront dédiés intégralement à l'impression des livres, quoi qu'il arrive (moins la taxe prise par IndieGogo).

L'auteur - aventurier

En 2005, à 38 ans, Laurent Bendel quitte sa Suisse natale et son métier d’informaticien pour 2 ans de voyage à moto. Il traverse les steppes de Mongolie, les montagnes d’Asie Centrale et de l’Himalaya pour atteindre l’Inde et le Népal. Après plusieurs autres escapades à deux roues sur divers continents, il repart pour 2 ans, parcourt le Moyen Orient et fait le tour intégral de l’Afrique sur 75'000 km.

Le blog du voyage en Asie 2006-2008 et du tour d'Afrique 2010-2012.

Mon album photo.

Comment participer

Toutes les participation sont les bienvenues, c'est l'effet de masse et la solidarité des motards qui permettent à de tels projet d'aboutir. Que vous soyiez intéressé par le livre ou que vous vouliez uniquement soutenir financièrement le projet, l'important est de participer.

Parlez-en autour de vous, partagez cette page par e-mail ou par les réseaux sociaux. 

Merci de votre soutien, et bonne route!

 

This campaign aims at financing the publication of my book on overlanding with a motorbike, which I'm currently writing. The book will be in French, so non-Fench speakers may not be interested by the book, but they still may want to contribute to my project, and that would be much appreciated.

La rédaction du texte et la composition des nombreuse cartes sont en bonne voie. Ensuite viendra la mise en page, pour laquelle je me ferai aider. Je me trounerai ensuite vers un imprimeur en France pour préparer une impression offset. Le prix est variable selon le format, le type de papier, et la quantité de planches photos, 7500 € étant le minimum pour démarrer avec un format très simple.
Si la campagne rapporte plus, je pourrai choisir un meilleur papier et ajouter des planches photos en couleurs. 
Si les fonds ne sont pas réunis, je lancerai quand même une impression en numérique, qui permet actuellement des petites séries à un prix plus élevé qu'en offset, mais raisonable si on se passe de planches couleurs. Donc dans tous les cas, vous recevrez un exemplaire du livre si vous y avez souscrit.
Les fonds seront dédiés intégralement à l'impression des livres, quoi qu'il arrive (moins la taxe prise par IndieGogo).
L'auteur - aventurier



En 2005, à 38 ans, Laurent Bendel quitte sa Suisse natale et son métier d’informaticien pour 2 ans de voyage à moto. Il traverse les steppes de Mongolie, les montagnes d’Asie Centrale et de l’Himalaya pour atteindre l’Inde et le Népal. Après plusieurs autres escapades à deux roues sur divers continents, il repart pour 2 ans, parcourt le Moyen Orient et fait le tour intégral de l’Afrique sur 75'000 km.
Le blog du voyage en Asie 2006-2008 et du tour d'Afrique 2010-2012.
Mon album photo.


Comment participer
Toutes les participation sont les bienvenues, c'est l'effet de masse et la solidarité des motards qui permettent à de tels projet d'aboutir. Que vous soyiez intéressé par le livre ou que vous vouliez uniquement soutenir financièrement le projet, l'important est de participer.
Parlez-en autour de vous, partagez cette page par e-mail ou par les réseaux sociaux. 
Merci de votre soutien, et bonne route!
 
This campaign aims at financing the publication of my book on overlanding with a motorbike, which I'm currently writing. The book will be in French, so non-Fench speakers may not be interested by the book, but they still may want to contribute to my project, and that would be much appreciated.

story:
The Origin of The Untold Narratives

The team at The Untold Narratives is currently made up of Elizabeth Santiago, PhD and Victoria Delvalle, but the origin of this idea started with me, Elizabeth, in childhood.  I had always been reluctant to share that I grew up on government assistance, that my parents didn’t speak English, that I dropped out of high school and that I was the first in my immediate family to go to college. In my experience, these realities can either be held up in educational and work spaces as proof that you can achieve if you have the right determination, or they are looked upon with pity. Both reactions have caused me personal shame because one infers that I have in some inadvertent way proven I am more determined than others, and the other insinuates that my childhood existence was somehow wrong. In reflecting on that shame, I have come to realize that it is rare for many people of color, immigrants, indigenous peoples and other marginalized people to experience in their formal education (whether k-12 or postsecondary) a libera­tory process of learning that engages their full identity and honors their realities without judging experiences or offering alienating solutions.

As I navigated educational spaces, the most authentic way I could share my story was through creative means. Creative writing offered me a way to tell a more nuanced story than just, “I grew up on welfare.” I could share an anecdote about my experience and own the way I wanted it to be presented. For example, I could share that as a child, I learned if you took food stamps (yes the original, paper food stamps) to the corner market in our neighborhood the store owner would change them to quarters. I could then buy a little doll that we couldn’t otherwise afford. Through creative writing, I could paint the picture of the market as welcoming. I could describe the people in the market as friendly and loving. They certainly didn’t have to carry little dolls in their mini-food mart, but they did. I could control the message in order to make it a more holistic depiction of the reality versus allowing someone else the opportunity to make judgements of what being on welfare meant based on what they heard or read.

The more I tell my story the more I understand the nature of power and truth, and the ways in which stories empower and connect. I spent my life working on the goal of cultivating and sharing untold narratives. I became a writing teacher partnering with students who didn't like to write. I studied and researched ways to engage reluctant writers eventually earning a PhD focusing on storytelling in underrepresented or marginalized communities.

What We Need & What You Get

To provide an outlet for the creation and distribution of stories, I conceptualized The Untold Narratives, a web site that anyone can access to learn the craft of writing while building community with others. I enlisted the help of Victoria Delvalle who is a college student, visual artist, and poet to help with the creative design of the site. The funding will support the development of a prototype of the theuntoldnarratives.com. For the prototype, we will be using Wix.com, a user-friendly website builder. This will allow us to work quickly to get a prototype into the hands of users. The majority of the funds will go toward the following:

  • Content development. Specifically, we want to populate the site with stories. We plan to connect to community-based organizations to cultivate stories, put out a call for writers on social media and build a repository of pre-existing stories that feature hidden narratives such as those featuring histories of marginalized communities that are not normally featured or elevated. Funds from this campaign will also go toward paying writers as appropriate.
  • Creative Design. We started building out the creative design of the site, but we need to continue and finalize. 
  • Focus Groups. Once the prototype is complete and we have cultivated content, we will bring the site to users to provide feedback. This will help us refine the design, navigation and content areas for later launch.

Costs associated with Wix.com and securing our domain name have already been covered through individual donations.

If you back this project, you will:

  • Receive early access to new content as it gets developed,
  • Be given the ability to provide feedback on the site's development,
  • Be invited to share content or potential writers,
  • Be credited on the About page on the site, and
  • Receive a monthly newsletter highlighting featured content once the prototype is launched.

If we do not meet our funding goal, we will use what we have raised to build out as much of the content of the site as possible and, hopefully, conduct at least one focus group.

Why Put Your Trust in Us?

I have been a storyteller since I was a child and the site is truly the culmination of my life's work. I worked in publishing building out content for textbooks. I earned a master's degree in education focusing on the role technology plays in the learning process. With that, I was able to build out large-scale technology concepts such as websites to support textbooks and communities of practice. The process we are using to develop this site (i.e., prototype, user feedback, etc.) is a standard development process and a process I am more than comfortable in executing. I most recently earned a PhD focusing on using storytelling to build literacy skills in older students. 

Victoria Delvalle is a junior at New York University Tisch School of the Arts. She is a visual artist and poet who has both the design and content skills to be a founding member of The Untold Narratives. She competed in slam poetry tournaments and has completed freelance art projects in the City of Boston. 

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks and challenges to any endeavor. We anticipate that we will run into hiccups along the way. The most pressing is connecting with potential writers. It's extremely important that stories be authentic and varied, so we need to connect to as many storytellers as possible. How we do that during a global pandemic will pose a challenge. We plan to connect to as many community-based programs as we can and do a call over social media including building out a Facebook community. We also hope that you, as a backer, will offer any connections you have to youth groups, adult learning centers and other community-based organizations to support building a broader community of storytellers

Other Ways You Can Help

If you've read this far, we appreciate you! We know that it's not always possible to give financially, but if you are interested in this project, please share our campaign widely on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network.

story:
MAKE ME RACE

New Degree Press and I are donating to COVID-19 Relief Fund for Meals on Wheels’. If we reach the goal, I will live-stream my first half-marathon

Goal of this Presale

As a first-time author, my publisher will be printing copies of the book in relation to how many books I pre-sell. My target is to pre-sell 1,000 copies of the book which will cover the cost of the Audio, Hardcover version, and 5,000 copies. Every pre-sell helps this project enormously.

When I was little, I used to tell my grandmother that I would someday author a hardcover book. She’s no longer with us, but you can help me get there...
 

Story of My Book

Over the past 5 years, I’ve been traveling the world and writing The Tree of Knowledge — an adventure novel that explores a world in which Pangaea had never split apart, plus a little bit of magic here and there.

My name is Jeremy Streich and I wrote this book because it had consumed my life; from rivers in Amsterdam to the streets of New York City, on horseback in Cuba to the Atlas Mountains in Morocco, I witnessed the power of the world, the interconnection of it, and how impossible it is to control.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover parts of yourself in the characters and the common experience of growth that young people of all colors, shapes, sizes, and universes go through. My ultimate goal is for you to take this book as a tool for understanding yourself, your fascinating life story, and for finding your place in the world.

In this book, you’ll learn about a new and mystical land in a world where children, schooled by the Sage, learn a power like none other:

  • Where skyscrapers are grown and not built...
  • Where humans exist, but not how you imagine...
  • Where diamonds are not the most valuable gem...
  • And where hurricanes have intelligence, and tornados barrel on their sides...

You will love this book if you have an active imagination and get lost in stories like Harry Potter, Game of Thrones, Hunger Games, Eragon, Narnia, and Lord of the Rings.

Really, we’re all just big kids. Though The Tree of Knowledge is a fiction book that speaks to the 12--19 range, it applies just as well to young adults who are exploring themselves, searching for meaning and asking the hard questions of life.
 

The Book - The Tree of Knowledge

The book is written in two parts....

Part 1 takes place on the tropical island of Elevana — an old land for men and women who have lost their place in the world.

Part 2 begins with a sea journey to Oriendo, where the rest of this novel (and book two) will take place. Oriendo’s natural power is immense and is the seat of the great Tree of Knowledge.
 

What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to give you options on how much to contribute, and how involved you want to be in this process.

As a donating member of the ToK Community — everything visual will be decided by you 

  • You’ll get to vote for your favorite cover art
  • You’ll have input on the layout of the book
  • You will get to pick your favorite of a few font choices
  • You’ll vote on potential narrators for the audiobook
  • You’ll help me decide where to go on book tour


You’ll also get some far sexier shwag if you pre-order my book

 

  • Early access to the Introductory Author’s Note and sneak previews of the ENTIRE BOOK, with the opportunity to give early feedback!
  • A handwritten note personalized to your son or daughter
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgements Sectio
  • Submit Book cover-art ideas
  • A SLACK discussion and question group of the ToK community + me
  • A spot in my creative writing workshop seminar series
  • A phone call to you, your son, or daughter
  • The Tree of Knowledge Behind the Scenes Podcast
    • (Where in the world I was writing, and what I was going through)

And more...
 

About the Kid Trapped in an Author’s Body

A modern day explorer, Jeremy has been trotting the globe since his 12th birthday; his post college travels, paired with a heap of neuroscience, ancient philosophy, and a brain-disorder which limits the ability to process small details while heightening the bigger picture, New Degree Press' newest introspective-twenty-something has built a not-so-far-fetched world of his own imagination.

Jeremy Streich is also a startup founder and iTunes Top 100 podcaster having interviewed Author Michael Pollan, Presidential Candidate Andrew Yang, Nobel Prize winner Randy Schekman, Chicago's Treasurer Kurt Summers, and more...


When not writing, Jeremy is probably on a hike or is failing at stand-up comedy, dating, deadlifting, down-dog, and investing.

For more information you can connect with Jeremy at jfs@jeremyfstreich.com and Jeremy.streich on Instagram, Jeremyfstreich on Twitter, and at jeremyfstreich.com
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

I would be so grateful if you would share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Treeofknowledge and tag @jeremy.streich as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

And most importantly please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

This book has gotten me through so much pain and struggle these last five years, my dream is that it can inspire others to do the same.


Appreciate you all, be well, and thank you for the love and support!

Humbly yours,
Jeremy F. Streich

story:
The campaign hasn't ended yet! 

We beat our first goal of $5K to publish in Dec 2020, our second goal at $6K to create a hard cover option, and our third goal of $8K to create an audio book options. If we raise even more, we could also potentially translate the book in Spanish! 

 

Story of My Book

Werk Your Net is a guidebook for a double audience. On one side it is a guidebook to empower young minority students to build their networks, on the other side it also was created help industry leaders solve the question of "Not having enough qualified diverse candidates." 

My name is Yasna Vismale and I am the author of Werk Your Net. I wrote this book because I saw how few of my peers were taking advantage of the resources and opportunities to turn their potential into a reality. I also wanted to reshape the mentality toward recruiting “diverse candidates” because I know there are many brilliant young people who look like me and are not being recruited because they just haven’t tapped into the right networks. Or we are overlooked when we are standing right in front of the people who are looking for us. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to build a meaningful relationship with someone from a different culture, background, and/or experience from your own. I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for what networking outside of your own social circles can do for your mindset and opportunities. Ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you learn how to practice self-awareness, empathy, and compassion, and use these to successfully diversify your own network. 

In this book, you'll learn what “networking” really means and how to have a meaningful interaction with anyone.

In an interview on NPR, Matt Youngquist, the president of Career Horizons, said that "at least 70 percent, if not 80 percent, of jobs are not published. The vast majority of hiring is friends and acquaintances hiring other trusted friends and acquaintances" 

In her article “Closing the network gap”, Meg Garlinghouse, the head of Social Impact at Linkedin, states, “Networks matter a lot. But, like opportunity, they are not distributed equally and are built over time.” She emphasizes that the root of the “network gap” is the reality “that where you grow up, where you go to school, and where you work can give you a 12x advantage in gaining access to opportunity”. 

My friend Robert Lotreck, a professional drummer, challenged my perception of what it means to practice; he said, “It doesn’t matter if you enjoy it every moment”. Even when you are doing something you are passionate or even obsessed about, it won’t always be fun. Sometimes it can be frustrating, and you just need to practice to get better for the long term, not because you like it. Networking is similar: sometimes reaching out to people and having conversations is fun, and sometimes it will be tough and not enjoyable but you do it because it gets you where you want to be. 

Hear stories from different trailblazers in their fields such as Miss America winner Ericka Dunlap, Forbes 30 under 30 Social Entrepreneur Riley Jones, Surrogate Strategist for Kamala Harris' Presidential Campaign Deja Foxx, Artificial Intelligence Ethical Hacker Christian Ng, Associate Director of University of Washington’s Business School's Undergrad Diversity Services: Andrew Marzano, and many more!

You will love this book, especially if you want to learn how to find and establish deep relationships with other people—whether in person or, especially now, online. 

Werk Your Net is a non-fiction book that speaks to goal-minded and achievement-oriented young people from underrepresented populations as well as to industry leaders who want to reach a broader pool of talented candidates, challenge their mindset, and learn beyond the limitations of their own experiences for the first time.

 

The Book - Werk Your Net 

The book is written in four parts....

Part One: Emotional Intelligence + Networking: contains the Introduction and Chapters 1- 3. This section focuses on debunking common myths about networking and explores topics related to growing your emotional intelligence. 

Part Two: Reaching Out: contains Chapters 4 - 6. This section focuses on preparing for a meaningful conversation. This includes how to research a person or an organization effectively and create the most effective and personalized message for the person you want to reach out to. The more you know about a person, what they are passionate about, why they are doing what they are doing, and what they know in terms of professional and personal experiences, the better chance you have of getting through to them. This is where emotional intelligence plays a key role in getting your message across. 

Part Three: The Art of Conversation: contains Chapters 7 - 9. This section explores the art of having an impactful conversation. With the research and information you have gathered about the person or organization, you have all the tools you need to have a successful conversation and make a great impression—and even to overcome the most awkward first interaction. In my life I have had probably thousands of interactions with people, but I have only had about four bad conversations--all because I didn’t prepare for them. 

Part Four: Building your Network: contains Chapter 10 -13. This section ties everything we have learned together and expands on the next steps: continuing your conversation, organizing your contacts, and what resources to look into. It also contains biographies of the people who were interviewed for the book. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

  • You will have the option to be a Beta Reader + Receive additional perks if you donate a certain amount. There is NO specified amount for donating! 
  • This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy and eBook formats)
  • The Copyediting for my Book - to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter
  • When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book, and a signed copy when it is published
  • Your name will appear in a special acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • You will have early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my book cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Yasna Vismale is an undergraduate at Columbia University. She is also a National Coca Cola Scholar, National Questbridge Scholar, recipient of Columbia’s Class of 1939 Undergrad Research Fellowship, past guest artist for the C.U.G. Jazz Orchestra that toured in Japan, and a National Forbes Under 30 Scholar. 

Yasna is passionate about bridging the gap within our empathy and networks. We have so many brilliant minds from so many underrepresented communities, it would be a great disservice not only to them but to ourselves if we do not allow them to get a foot in the door. If you are a minority, you need to stop selling yourself short because you are very qualified and capable as you are. If you are an industry leader and truly care about growth, innovation, and economic development, then you need to take workforce diversity seriously—and with this book, you will learn how. 

Along with her passion in promoting equity within the distribution of our networks, Yasna loves art and anything creative. She plays the trumpet, loves to compose, and professionally models. 

For more information you can connect with Yasna at yasna.v@columbia.edu and follow her on @yazi_nay  and @werkyournet on Instagram and Twitter. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have mitigated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

Of course, there are risks involved in actually publishing the book before I can deliver it to anyone! I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure the publication process stays on track, and we will get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up to date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
story_txt:
The campaign hasn't ended yet! We beat our first goal of $5K to publish in Dec 2020, our second goal at $6K to create a hard cover option, and our third goal of $8K to create an audio book options. If we raise even more, we could also potentially translate the book in Spanish!  Story of My BookWerk Your Net is a guidebook for a double audience. On one side it is a guidebook to empower young minority students to build their networks, on the other side it also was created help industry leaders solve the question of "Not having enough qualified diverse candidates." My name is Yasna Vismale and I am the author of Werk Your Net. I wrote this book because I saw how few of my peers were taking advantage of the resources and opportunities to turn their potential into a reality. I also wanted to reshape the mentality toward recruiting “diverse candidates” because I know there are many brilliant young people who look like me and are not being recruited because they just haven’t tapped into the right networks. Or we are overlooked when we are standing right in front of the people who are looking for us. My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to build a meaningful relationship with someone from a different culture, background, and/or experience from your own. I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for what networking outside of your own social circles can do for your mindset and opportunities. Ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you learn how to practice self-awareness, empathy, and compassion, and use these to successfully diversify your own network. In this book, you'll learn what “networking” really means and how to have a meaningful interaction with anyone.In an interview on NPR, Matt Youngquist, the president of Career Horizons, said that "at least 70 percent, if not 80 percent, of jobs are not published. The vast majority of hiring is friends and acquaintances hiring other trusted friends and acquaintances" In her article “Closing the network gap”, Meg Garlinghouse, the head of Social Impact at Linkedin, states, “Networks matter a lot. But, like opportunity, they are not distributed equally and are built over time.” She emphasizes that the root of the “network gap” is the reality “that where you grow up, where you go to school, and where you work can give you a 12x advantage in gaining access to opportunity”. My friend Robert Lotreck, a professional drummer, challenged my perception of what it means to practice; he said, “It doesn’t matter if you enjoy it every moment”. Even when you are doing something you are passionate or even obsessed about, it won’t always be fun. Sometimes it can be frustrating, and you just need to practice to get better for the long term, not because you like it. Networking is similar: sometimes reaching out to people and having conversations is fun, and sometimes it will be tough and not enjoyable but you do it because it gets you where you want to be. Hear stories from different trailblazers in their fields such as Miss America winner Ericka Dunlap, Forbes 30 under 30 Social Entrepreneur Riley Jones, Surrogate Strategist for Kamala Harris' Presidential Campaign Deja Foxx, Artificial Intelligence Ethical Hacker Christian Ng, Associate Director of University of Washington’s Business School's Undergrad Diversity Services: Andrew Marzano, and many more!You will love this book, especially if you want to learn how to find and establish deep relationships with other people—whether in person or, especially now, online. Werk Your Net is a non-fiction book that speaks to goal-minded and achievement-oriented young people from underrepresented populations as well as to industry leaders who want to reach a broader pool of talented candidates, challenge their mindset, and learn beyond the limitations of their own experiences for the first time. The Book - Werk Your Net The book is written in four parts....Part One: Emotional Intelligence + Networking: contains the Introduction and Chapters 1- 3. This section focuses on debunking common myths about networking and explores topics related to growing your emotional intelligence. Part Two: Reaching Out: contains Chapters 4 - 6. This section focuses on preparing for a meaningful conversation. This includes how to research a person or an organization effectively and create the most effective and personalized message for the person you want to reach out to. The more you know about a person, what they are passionate about, why they are doing what they are doing, and what they know in terms of professional and personal experiences, the better chance you have of getting through to them. This is where emotional intelligence plays a key role in getting your message across. Part Three: The Art of Conversation: contains Chapters 7 - 9. This section explores the art of having an impactful conversation. With the research and information you have gathered about the person or organization, you have all the tools you need to have a successful conversation and make a great impression—and even to overcome the most awkward first interaction. In my life I have had probably thousands of interactions with people, but I have only had about four bad conversations--all because I didn’t prepare for them. Part Four: Building your Network: contains Chapter 10 -13. This section ties everything we have learned together and expands on the next steps: continuing your conversation, organizing your contacts, and what resources to look into. It also contains biographies of the people who were interviewed for the book.  What I Need & What You'll Get

story:
What We Want To Do

Stories have the singular power to bring attention to our common humanity. This is what the world needs now. As the premier site for world literature in translation, Asymptote wants to provide a high-profile platform for writers and artists from the seven countries on Trump's list.

With your support, we will undertake large-scale editorial research and commission new work—and new translations—from Iran, Iraq, Libya, Somalia, Sudan, Syria, and Yemen, specifically work in response to Trump’s executive order. A minimum of two works from each of these countries will be published either in our Spring (April) 2017 edition at our website or at our partner newspaper, The Guardian (here’s an example of what you can look forward to). All contributors to this Feature will be paid.

In addition, one standout article from this extensive showcase will be selected for a multiple-translation project, which will see Asymptote commission 10 to 20 additional translations to propel this project beyond the English-language community (much as we did last year with Pedro Novoa's stunning story in our Summer 2016 Issue). We will also include a special section in the educator’s guide accompanying the Spring 2017 edition, to facilitate the introduction of this Special Feature in classrooms around the world.

 

How Will Our Work Make a Difference?

In a world beset by reactionary politics and hyper-nationalism, literature can build bridges across the chasms that try to divide us.

Asymptote's Special Feature showcasing the work of writers from Iran, Iraq, Libya, Somalia, Sudan, Syria, and Yemen will raise awareness about what life is like for people living in these conflict-ridden countries. At a time when the safety and dignity of their people are being denied, we hope that this Special Feature will serve to amplify their voices.

But publication of this Special Feature alone is not enough to guarantee it a wide audience, even if our showcase will be freely available to anyone with an Internet connection, as with everything we publish. To make sure this work we do makes an impact, we will invest heavily in promoting the Feature through paid ads, online promotion via our eight social media platforms in three languages, and the distribution of 5,000 postcards across six continents. 

For all of this to happen, we need to raise USD30,000.

The more we raise, the more we can do! If we surpass our target and hit USD45,000, we’ll publish a print anthology of the work to be distributed worldwide; if we hit USD60,000, we’ll organize a large-scale event in New York or London, featuring authors from this showcase.

In solidarity with those whose lives have been disrupted by Trump’s travel ban, we pledge 20% of all funds raised to the ACLU and Refugees Welcome. Help us show them that you care.

 

What You Stand to Get

Donate to our campaign and receive specially autographed books by Junot Díaz, Yann Martel and George Szirtes, among others! Apart from the wide selection of books below, we'll also give away, among our wide range of Asymptote memorabilia, a newly designed AsympTOTE—featuring artwork by the guest artist of our current issue, Dianna Xu. If you're a loyal Asymptote supporter, you'll certainly want to add this AsympTOTE to your collection!

 

Who We Are

We are Asymptote, a free online journal dedicated to showcasing the best of world literature. A truly global journal, our 80-strong team is made up of volunteers across six continents, seeking to unearth writing from around the world. We are proud to have published new work from 109 countries and 90 languages by writers and translators such as J. M. Coetzee, Patrick Modiano, Herta Müller, Can Xue, Junot Díaz, Ismail Kadare, and Haruki Murakami. Our efforts to promote international writing were recognised in 2015 when we received the London Book Fair Award for International Literary Translation Initiative.

In addition to our massive quarterly issues, each featuring work from more than 25 countries, we offer a daily blog, a fortnightly newsletter, and a podcast. Our editor-in-chief, who served as one of the judges of the 2016 PEN International New Voices Award, also curates our weekly Translation Tuesday showcase at The Guardian—arguably the most high-profile platform for literary translation today.

 

Q&As

Q: I want to support your magazine! How can I help?

A: The best way to help us right now is support us with a donation! We also welcome help in many other ways as well:

Share this page with your family and friends, including a personal message describing why the campaign is important to you!

Submit pictures to our Twitter or Facebook that show why you #SupportAsymptote. 

Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Tumblr, and use the #SupportAsymptote hashtag to spread the word about our campaign!
 

Q: What if I want to donate but don't want a perk?

A: We appreciate your support for our campaign and we welcome your donation even if you do not wish to pick a perk. That just means 100% of your donation will go directly to Asymptote! 
 

Q: Can I donate via check?

A: Yes! If you're in the US, please make your check out to "Fractured Atlas," so that your gift will be tax deductible. In the memo line of your check, please write "Asymptote Journal" so that Fractured Atlas will direct your money to our campaign. Our address in the US is:

Asymptote Journal
517 N. Tioga St. Apt. 2
Ithaca, NY 14850
NY, USA

If you're based outside of the US, please make out your check to "Asymptote Journal Pte. Ltd.", and send it to our editor-in-chief at

Asymptote Journal,
21, Newton Road,
#07-01, 
Singapore 307954
SINGAPORE

Thank you!

story:
Dear Readers, Writers, Editors, and Friends of Ninebark Press,

We are very happy to announce our newest project, [It] Incandescent, by Amy Pence. 

[It] Incandescent puts us on the path near Emily Dickinson’s home in a timeless Amherst where we embark on a multi-layered journey: poems written by a fictional narrator are interceded by details from Dickinson’s life as well as the tragic story that propels the narrator to a stunning, yet indeterminate, conclusion. What was Dickinson’s “secret” and how does the experience of trauma both obscure and reveal? In this truly sui generis book, poetry, fiction, and fact blend, reminding us of the complex tissue of narratives and psychologies whenever we try to uncover the truth of someone’s life, especially Emily Dickinson’s.

Amy Pence has authored the poetry collections Armor, Amour (Ninebark Press), The Decadent Lovely (Main Street Rag), and the chapbook, Skin’s Dark Night (2River Press). She has been honored with the Claire Keyes Poetry Award and has published in a variety of journals, including The Antioch Review, The Oxford American, and Juked. In addition to publishing short fiction, book reviews, and interviews, Pence’s critical essay on Dickinson: “Many White Dresses: Emily Dickinson & Her Biographers” was featured in The Writer’s Chronicle. She received her M.F.A. in Creative Writing from the University of Arizona, and grew up in New Orleans and Las Vegas. She now lives in Pine Lake, Georgia.

The $3,000.00 to be raised here will support [It] Incandescent's design and printing. 

This is our third crowd-funding campaign — our most recent helped us publish Patrik Sampler's timely and surreal novel The Ocean Container. We are so thankful for your support and enthusiasm, and can't wait to see more of it for Amy Pence's fantastic new book! 

Risks and challenges

For any small literary press, distribution is a challenge. You can help us get the word out about [It] Incandescent and Ninebark Press; all Ninebark books are available from our website, Barnes & Noble, and Amazon.

 

Ninebark Press

Ninebark Press is committed to publishing literature that crosses boundaries of genre, culture, and aesthetic, literature which is both intelligent and empathetic, as engaged in the art of language as it is concerned with human circumstance and the larger natural world, and particularly work which displays an international element. We are thrilled to have the opportunity to further our mission by introducing Amy Pence's remarkable poetry collection to readers, and grateful for your help in accomplishing this.

Thank you for your support!

Sandra Meek, Michael Mejia, and Mindy Wilson,
Ninebark Press Co-Founding Editors

Ninebark Press Advisory Board:

Sven Birkerts
Rikki Ducornet
Alice Friman
Albert Goldbarth
Tayari Jones
Laurence Lieberman
Michael Martone
Reginald McKnight
Larissa Szporluk

 

Why “ninebark”? 

The press takes its name from a genus of flowering bushes, Ninebark, itself named for the way its bark peels away in many layers. Ninebark occurs naturally both within and without the United States in many diverse and varied species. Both as natural object and as word, Ninebark suggests that complexity is not antithetical to beauty, but necessary to its creation. 

 

Other Ninebark Press Publications

The Ocean Container by Patrik Sampler
In Patrik Sampler's surreal and lyric novel The Ocean Container, an environmentalist accused by a North American petro-state of “economic terrorism” takes refuge in a compound for vagrants. Surrounded by a variety of social and political outcasts—dubious charity providers, a spiritual healer, a man with two right eyes, contraband exotic species, and a theatrical company that may be a front for prostitution—the “terrorist” gradually embraces the exile of his improvised home, a shipping container, where the division between imagination and external reality will irrevocably blur. 

Stela by Anca Cristofovici
Anca Cristofovici's Stela is the haunting record of the troubled dreamlife and developing creative spirit of a young dancer, Cora, struggling to dispel decades of speculation, half-truths, and informational gaps surrounding the official story of her mother's mysterious disappearance from the streets of an unnamed city in an unnamed country governed by a faceless repressive regime. Thoughtful, inventive, and beautifully lyric, the novel masterfully challenges the persistent, corrupting, too-intimate obfuscations of state terror, its obscure motivations and rolls of the disappeared, with the liberating and illuminating transformations of art. Anca Cristofovici is a Romanian writer currently living in Paris.

Armor, Amour by Amy Pence
"Amy Pence's second collection thrives on both contradiction and expansion. Her short works, comprising two-thirds of the poems in the book, fulfill Blake's call for 'Eternity in a grain of sand,' while the longer pieces—rangy, kinetic, meticulously shaped—follow Mallarme's throw of the dice into new and eye-opening frontiers. Pence's poetic world is simultaneously a 'Tender, small universe' and a 'red sac torn open,' and Armor, Amour forcefully captures these conversant facets of her imagination."

         —Gregory Fraser, author of Answering the Ruins

Elegy for a Fabulous World by Alta Ifland
The surreal and darkly humorous stories of Elegy for a Fabulous World describe an eccentric family and their polyglot friends and neighbors—Ukrainians, Hungarians, Germans, Romanians, Gypsies, Jews, Russians—surviving together in a land where fable, reality, and State-issued lies are impossible to untangle. In the book's second section, the narratives emigrate to the United States, where the skepticism learned in fabulous youth infects and frustrates American attitudes and institutions. Real fictions of strange lands, Ifland's stories demonstrate a deep sympathy with the visionary outsider and a vital and provocative international point of view. Alta Ifland grew up in Eastern Europe and emigrated to the United States in 1991. Elegy for a Fabulous World was selected, from an extremely competitive field, as a finalist for the 2010 Northern California Book Awards.

Deep Travel: Contemporary American Poets Abroad edited by Sandra Meek
Deep Travel, winner of a 2008 Independent Publisher Book Award Gold Medal, brings together thirty-four contemporary American poets whose work has been significantly informed by international travel or by living abroad. The book includes poems by Pulitzer Prize-winners as well as mid-career and emerging writers. Participating poets also contributed original prose statements on how travel has deepened their work, their understanding of poetry's aesthetic and human value, and their sense of self and "Other."

Other Ninebark Press Publications
The Ocean Container by Patrik SamplerIn Patrik Sampler's surreal and lyric novel The Ocean Container, an environmentalist accused by a North American petro-state of “economic terrorism” takes refuge in a compound for vagrants. Surrounded by a variety of social and political outcasts—dubious charity providers, a spiritual healer, a man with two right eyes, contraband exotic species, and a theatrical company that may be a front for prostitution—the “terrorist” gradually embraces the exile of his improvised home, a shipping container, where the division between imagination and external reality will irrevocably blur. 
Stela by Anca CristofoviciAnca Cristofovici's Stela is the haunting record of the troubled dreamlife and developing creative spirit of a young dancer, Cora, struggling to dispel decades of speculation, half-truths, and informational gaps surrounding the official story of her mother's mysterious disappearance from the streets of an unnamed city in an unnamed country governed by a faceless repressive regime. Thoughtful, inventive, and beautifully lyric, the novel masterfully challenges the persistent, corrupting, too-intimate obfuscations of state terror, its obscure motivations and rolls of the disappeared, with the liberating and illuminating transformations of art. Anca Cristofovici is a Romanian writer currently living in Paris.
Armor, Amour by Amy Pence"Amy Pence's second collection thrives on both contradiction and expansion. Her short works, comprising two-thirds of the poems in the book, fulfill Blake's call for 'Eternity in a grain of sand,' while the longer pieces—rangy, kinetic, meticulously shaped—follow Mallarme's throw of the dice into new and eye-opening frontiers. Pence's poetic world is simultaneously a 'Tender, small universe' and a 'red sac torn open,' and Armor, Amour forcefully captures these conversant facets of her imagination."
         —Gregory Fraser, author of Answering the Ruins
Elegy for a Fabulous World by Alta IflandThe surreal and darkly humorous stories of Elegy for a Fabulous World describe an eccentric family and their polyglot friends and neighbors—Ukrainians, Hungarians, Germans, Romanians, Gypsies, Jews, Russians—surviving together in a land where fable, reality, and State-issued lies are impossible to untangle. In the book's second section, the narratives emigrate to the United States, where the skepticism learned in fabulous youth infects and frustrates American attitudes and institutions. Real fictions of strange lands, Ifland's stories demonstrate a deep sympathy with the visionary outsider and a vital and provocative international point of view. Alta Ifland grew up in Eastern Europe and emigrated to the United States in 1991. Elegy for a Fabulous World was selected, from an extremely competitive field, as a finalist for the 2010 Northern California Book Awards.
Deep Travel: Contemporary American Poets Abroad edited by Sandra MeekDeep Travel, winner of a 2008 Independent Publisher Book Award Gold Medal, brings together thirty-four contemporary American poets whose work has been significantly informed by international travel or by living abroad. The book includes poems by Pulitzer Prize-winners as well as mid-career and emerging writers. Participating poets also contributed original prose statements on how travel has deepened their work, their understanding of poetry's aesthetic and human value, and their sense of self and "Other."

story:
My TABLET - Self-published children story.

Before I'll tell you what's this book is all about, I would like you to see a couple of articles I grabbed from the internet. (3 of ∞...):

  • Children spend six hours or more a day on screens (BBC NEWS / Technology, By Jane Wakefield, 27 March 2015)
  • Screen Addiction Is Taking a Toll on Children (The New York Times / PERSONAL HEALTH, By JANE E. BRODY, JULY 6, 2015)
  • As you’ve probably noticed, we spend a lot of time looking at screens. (You’re doing it right now.) (Forbes / Educational, by John Dodig, SEP 23, 2015)

Hi, I'm TomerMash, the author of "My TABLET".

My book describes in an entertaining manner the world of kids as you may know it, evolving around their tablet. As time goes by they come to realize that there is another world outside the virtual one that is not less interesting and challenging as the one that is revealed to them through the screen. This book is suitable for children at the age of 4-9 and has a VERY IMPORTANT MORAL LESSON.

The Impact

With your contributions I will be able to get the book out and into the world:

I would like to Quote one of my reader feedback:

"I really liked this book, it's very simple, cute, nicely illustrated but more than that I think it speaks a message of life outside the screen.
Every time I read this book to my 5 year old daughter I'm happy with the strong message she gets and how it affects her." 

And it says everything to me :)

The goals is simple:

  • $10,000 - covers the Artist & all the publishing package.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can support and help in spreading the word by sharing this campaign on your personal social.

TNX :).

story:
Five Years and Going Strong!

Three passionate University of Florida journalism students started The Fine Print five years ago with a strong belief in the importance of local, independent journalism.  We wanted to provide Gainesville with an independent publication that shed light on environmental, social and political issues here at home -- and we wanted to communicate with readers through good old-fashioned story telling. We also sought to establish an outlet where students could learn skills that weren't being taught in school and put them into practice.

In the past five years, our staff has grown from a handful of students to a thriving volunteer staff. The Fine Print is a labor of love for each of us.  It costs a lot to print our seasonal issues, as well as pay for our working/meeting space and keep our website up and running every day. That's where you can help us keep quality, student journalism alive!

The Power of Local Journalism

Journalism used to be the voice of the people. In its heyday it was a tool to expose injustices in communities and provide routes to correct them. But we're losing our voice in a day when we see more and more big media that tout the mission of big business and government and less local media that speak up for the average person. It's not only a loss to citizens, but it's also a loss to students who aim to become journalists. To preserve our rights, we must preserve local journalism based on its founding principles. And to do that, we must train new journalists who believe in being a voice for the people and provide an outlet that is a true example of just that. In the past five years, The Fine Print has seen real change effected in our community through stories about worker's rights, environmental degradation, unfair policies toward the homeless and more. We've also helped show readers through lifestyle pieces how to live more sustainable lives. You can read all of our past stories on our website at www.thefineprintuf.org.

What We Need & What You Get

The Fine Print is asking for your financial support to maintain and expand what we can offer our community as well as to the future of journalism at large. We're focusing on three specific goals right now:

1. To keep our working space open over the summer so we can hold workshops to teach new students the skills they need to be successful reporters, writers, graphic designers, editors and community activists.
    - Our working space costs us $371/month plus $43/month for insurance  
      and $30/month for Internet. For the summer months, that equals
      $2,220.

2. The last month of the summer will be dedicated to putting into practice all the skills taught throughout the workshops. The new students will put together a special edition of The Fine Print that they'll distribute to students during the first few weeks of school.
     - The length of the special issue will depend on how much money we 
       have for printing. It will likely cost between $700 and $900.

3. We initially started this campaign hoping that we would be able to raise enough money to finally submit our paperwork to become a 501c3 non-profit. This would have cost about $450. After a lot of thought and consideration and advice from good people in our community, we have decided not to become a 501c3. We even almost completed the extensive paperwork, but because of the IRS requirements, becoming a non-profit would have limited what we can print and do for the community. It would have increased our yearly requirements and paperwork greatly. And in the end, it could have actually increased our chances of failing as an organization down the road. So, because we love our community, our readers, all of the students who we work with and what we are able to provide for everyone, we have decided not to do this. Instead, we will use the final bit of the money we raise to print a bigger fall issue, and what's left, we will save for the upcoming school year and put to work for you then. 

For your fabulous support, check out the perks on the right of this page! And please help us spread the word!

Want more information? Check out our website or e-mail us at editors@thefineprintuf.org.

story:
Senior Christian Writer Takes on Modern Christendom and cries, "Foul!"

I appreciate this opportunity to share my passion with the public! You see, I have a book that is ready to hit the market, and I am certain that this book’s message is vitally needed. I wrote it with a real burden.

Have you ever wondered what's wrong with Christianity today? Have you read of the Apostles and their success in "turning their world upside down" and wondered why today's disciples don't seem to have any real power or any effective impact on society, which is unravelling at an alarming rate? Though something just doesn't seem right, are you afraid to voice your feelings lest you be found to be speaking against God? Well, in Old Testament times and New, whenever God's people fell short of rightly representing Him, He was the first to speak up. He told the prophets to cry aloud and spare not, and to tell His people of their failure to do His will.

I have long been troubled over this "lack of Christ in Christianity." Then, a couple of years ago I read some statistics, on the Barna Research web site, that left me stunned, and I felt I just had to try to help. Those statistics showed that only 19 percent of modern Christendom’s elite—those who claim to be born-again—actually have a Christian worldview! And, even worse, only 9 percent of the people in general believe in the principles that make up a Christian worldview.

Friend, when only 9 percent of the “world” that Jesus sent His disciples out to enlighten believe the fundamental truths of the Gospel, something is radically wrong with what is called Christianity today. But, seriously, how can the “world” believe when less than 2 out of every 10 who claim to be born-again believe their own “message”? Unfortunately, these statistics show that many “believers” are trusting in the wrong thing!

I became so burdened about this dilemma that I could no longer hold my peace! I decided to jump right in the middle of the chaos and cry, "Hold everything, folks! It's time to stop playing charades under the cloak of Christianity! It's time to tell the world the real Gospel message!"

My book was written to do just that! It examines how far modern “Christianity” has gotten off the Scriptural blueprint and what believers can do to get back on track.

My credentials for being able to write this book are that I’ve been a Christian for most of my life, and I’ve observed the decline in Christendom first hand. I've also been a Bible scholar for over half a century. and I’ve written and published three Bible-based books prior to this one. I’ve had a lot of articles and poems published, and I have written and edited for The Gospel Trumpeter, a holiness magazine. Additionally, I was once asked to serve on a committee for the writing of Sunday School material. Lastly, although I have not attended a seminary, I have a 4.0 college GPA and have tested “ministerial level” in my Bible knowledge. For all of this, I give God the glory!

My book is entitled, Is Your Jesus the Bible Jesus? It is being published by WestBow Press, a division of the world-renowned religious publisher, Thomas Nelson. It should be released any day now.

My reason for appealing to you for funding is that much of my writing/editing  work has been on a volunteer/unpaid basis for the Kingdom of God's sake. Since I am a senior citizen now, and on a fixed income, I had to borrow the money to produce this book. I still owe on that loan. Additionally, I have stepped out on faith and purchased a basic publicity package through my publisher. You see, I want to spread the word about this book far and wide, because I truly believe its message is vitally needed by our world today.

 I need $4,500 to cover the cost of this publicity package, and nothing can be done with it until this is paid in full. If we--you and I--can exceed my goal, it will enable me to broaden my publicity efforts even further and reach many more people with this book’s vital message—as well as to pay off my loan.

Even if you cannot contribute financially, you can help by telling others about this page. Thank you in advance for your time and interest, and for any contributions you can make--monetary or otherwise--to help me fulfill my  passion for “spreading the Word”!

Description :

Vincent Godin est un jeune homme de Trois-Rivières âgé de 19 ans. Ce dernier est atteint de dysphasie (un trouble primaire du langage qui peut affecter la construction des phrases, la formation des mots, la production des sons et la façon de communiquer).

Vincent nage depuis l’âge de cinq ans. Pour faire connaître la dysphasie, il entreprendra une traversée de la Nouvelle-Écosse aux Îles-de-la-Madeleine à la nage. (86 km de nage en eau libre)

Le but de son périple est de sensibiliser les gens à sa cause. « Je veux qu'on nous donne la chance de nous exprimer, qu'on nous écoute et qu'on nous comprenne pour mieux nous aider.»


Utilisation des dons : 

L'argent reçu permettra de promouvoir le défi ainsi que la cause.

En donnant, vous…

- Aidez Vincent à réaliser son défi

- Encouragez la cause de la Dysphasie

- Permettez la réalisation et la diffusion d'une vidéo promotionnelle                            

- Encouragez les jeunes à réaliser leurs rêves

- Aidez à la promotion du défi

Un merci sincère de la part de Vincent !

« Ensemble, faisons une différence »

story:
Short Summary

On September 18th 2014 Scotland held a referendum to decide whether to remain in a 307 year old political union with England.  The people of Scotland were asked a simple question; Should Scotland be an independent country?

The result, announced on the morning of Friday September 19th, showed a majority had rejected the proposition by 55% to 45%.

The outcome of the vote was clear and ensured Scotland continued to be governed from Westminster.  But was it fair?

There is overwhelming evidence to suggest that the British Broadcasting Corporation played a significant role in persuading just enough people to reject independence.  However to date, there has been no appetite from those within our traditional media or political classes to expose what amounted to state sponsored corruption of the democratic process.

This book - How The BBC Stole The Referendum - will reveal how the BBC, both north and south of the border, was used in order to influence the outcome of the independence referendum.  It will chronicle the BBC's behaviour during the final two weeks of the campaign as well as it's role throughout the period from the moment a referendum was guaranteed. 

The two weeks prior to the referendum witnessed the BBC conduct a campaign of deception that was aimed at persuading Scottish voters into believing Devo Max was on offer should No prevail in the referendum debate.  The corporation provided unprecedented access to its airwaves and online news facilities, to a backbench Labour MP called Gordon Brown.  The move would be key in turning a lead for the Yes campaign into a referendum win for No.

On the day this appeal went live, Saturday November 29th, the BBC was again broadcasting a pro-Union speech by Gordon Brown.

The story of the BBC's manifestation into a de-facto pro-Union political party is a story that needs to be told, but one that won't unless we tell it ourselves.

The book will track the deterioration of the BBC from the weeks leading up to the SNP's dramatic win in the 2007 Scottish Parliamentary Elections up until the days following the referendum.

This appeal seeks to raise funds in order to ensure that the book can be published and promoted.  The initial target is modest, but will guarantee a small print run.  Should that print run be a success then profits will be used in order to extend the run.

A publisher will be sought, but due to the controversial subject matter one may not be found.  Thus, the fundraiser will be key to ensuring the book becomes a reality.  The book will articluate the views of the hundreds of thousands of people angry, frustrated yet unheard as traditional media outlets ignore them.

The book will be written by GA Ponsonby who was part of the Newsnet Scotland team of writers.  GA played a key role in highlighting some of the more questionable practices employed by the BBC in its coverage of Scottish politics.

This crowdfunding appeal offered only one perk to those donating.  Chapters one and two to be sent via email to anyone donating a minimum of five pounds. 

With the appeal having reached ninety per cent of its goal it has been decided to publish both chapters on the companion site http://ponsonbypost.com.

Should the crowdfunding appeal prove successful then by the time the book is complete, there will be funding to allow it to be published, even without the backing of a recognised publisher.

The funding will also help to pay for the upkeep of the book's  companion site.  The book will reference audio and video content and there will be a specific area of the companion site which will hold these clips for easy access.

The site will not be restricted to book related content and through time will carry news, views and off-beat commentary on Scottish issues.

With the UK general election set to take place in May next year, the aim is to have the book ready to publish by the beginning of April 2015.
