With the appeal having reached ninety per cent of its goal it has been decided to publish both chapters on the companion site  http://ponsonbypost.com.
Should the crowdfunding appeal prove successful then by the time the book is complete, there will be funding to allow it to be published, even without the backing of a recognised publisher.
The funding will also help to pay for the upkeep of the book's  companion site.  The book will reference audio and video content and there will be a specific area of the companion site which will hold these clips for easy access.
The site will not be restricted to book related content and through time will carry news, views and off-beat commentary on Scottish issues.With the UK general election set to take place in May next year, the aim is to have the book ready to publish by the beginning of April 2015.

story:
Returning News Reporting to Old School Roots

A group of former newspaper reporters and government Intel agents formed True Pundit before the 2016 presidential election as a viable alternative to the tainted news coming from the corrupted mainstream media. In its first year, True Pundit has broken dozens of national scandals and big stories all working on a shoe string budget -- employing old and beat up PCs and computer servers seemingly held together with duct tape. 

Time and time again True Pundit has scooped Big Media on national stories weeks and months before the crooked corporate media.

Now it is time to help give the True Pundit news start up the proper footing and funding required to help it become even bigger and better. If you are already a reader and believer in True Pundit's Old School approach to Making Journalism Great Again, we ask for your sponsorship. 

Unlike other Right media, True Pundit enjoys award-winning journalists on staff and true pros conducting political recon and gathering Intel. Accolades include a Gerald Loeb Award,  Deadline Awards and Pulitzer Prize nominations.

To continue to produce this throw-back journalism, we need your help. Great journalism needs great readers who are ready to support the type of journalism folks just can't find anywhere else.

Our Credo

Our Credo is extracted from unparalleled Intel experience and award-winning journalism experience: 

  • We produce timely and high quality news and intelligence for our readers.
  • We believe our people and sources are our most important resources.
  • We shelve our desire for public recognition & instead choose the need for confidentiality.
  • We measure our success by our contribution to the protection of American values.

We Calculated Our Initial Goal

Let's Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Our campaign goal is a minimum amount. We aim to earn more than what we have stated. But this listed goal is a good place to start. Don't forget that the apparel will cost funds to fill your sponsorship levels. 
  • Our plans on how to distribute the funds -- after the apparel is purchased and shipped -- are detailed below in six primary categories that promise to enhance your news reading and watching experience. 



With your financial support, we will be able to expand our server capacity & overall website speed. This means that you can get your news faster than ever, even during overloads & breaking news situations.



With your financial support, we will introduce a reader powered blog section. Any reader with a unique perspective can apply & submit stories and submit numerous more posts once approved. This is a place for contributors to share ideas & opinions. 



With your financial support, we will expand our cutting-edge breaking news system to report events before our competitors. Below are examples of our breaking news scoops, reporting news First, before the MSM & others.

True Pundit crushes the MSM on breaking news by an average of 52 minutes in the following case studies, including Scooping the Big Networks by over 2 hours on the Las Vegas Massacre shooting. We beat Drudge by 5+ hours as well on the Vegas breaking news:








With your financial support, we will expand our content offerings in 2018. Our daily content covers national & world political news but we plan to expand to local/state news, sports, entertainment, tech & science. 



With your financial support, we will revamp our web design for optimum use on any mobile device or desktop computer. This infinite scroll design will allow you to read all your daily news on one page, without clicking through multiple links. 



With your financial support, we will launch our brand new VidSum system. These short videos summarize each article & read the contents aloud to you. Readers will also be able to set up playlists & listen to news stories during your commute, workout or wherever. 

Here is one example of our popular VidSum vids:


Your Sponsorship's Impact

The mainstream media is no longer trusted by Americans. The traditional models of journalism have been dying a slow death since the mid-1990s. Alternatively, much of conservative media is even worse. It is filled with provocateurs & shock jocks looking for fame or a quick buck. We are in the midst of a Media Revolution. That includes you.

People have turned to True Pundit, a news source that keeps their nose to the ground & continues to print truths absent the drama. 

We understand some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You can always help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Simply use the Indiegogo share tools to forward this to your social media contacts.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The book analyzes biases surrounding mentality in sports and the stat obsessed aspect that dominates athlete valuations. I wrote it because I have always known mentality has a role in sports but wanted to delve deeper into how mentality is considered when big contracts are considered. My book will publish in July, 2019.

Story of My Book

Mind Over Data; commodified athletes and overlooking mental power. My book analyzes the post Moneyball sports ideology that has fans, GMs, and players focusing almost entirely on statistics. It also explores the consequences of the tendency we have to forget about the mental aspect of sports.

My name is Luca Romeo, I am the author of Mind Over Data; commodified athletes and overlooking mental power. I wrote this book because I have always known mentality has a role in sports but wanted to delve deeper into how mentality is considered when big contracts are considered.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your own biases around mentality, and begin to accept the concrete importance of mentality despite its abstract nature. In this book. I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement I have for mentality in athletics in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you understand why some of the best players fail and how underdogs surprise everyone.

In this book, you'll learn about mentality and the unseen biases that leave the mental part out of sports, namely:

  1. The direct impact that the mind has on the body
  2. How players get valued through statistical models
  3. The impacts of our society's biases around mentality and the pressure athletes face
You will love this book if you are a fan of any sport and have interest in how players are valued.
Mind Over Data; commodified athletes and overlooking mental power is a non-fiction book that speaks to athletes and sports fans who are looking at how players are valued in sports and how society views the mental aspect of the game.

The Book - Mind Over Data; commodified athletes and overlooking mental power

The Book is Written in Three Parts....


Part [1] contains the introduction + additional chapters that explore the power of mentality and its presence (both positive and negative) in sports. This part explores Martin Seligman's theory of positive psychology as well as looking at successes and failures of athletes and teams.

Part [2] contains Chapters 6 and 7. This part dives into statistical models that players are ranked by - namely Nate Silver's contribution to valuation, as well as looks at the troubles of quantifying such abstract concepts as emotional intelligence and team chemistry.

Part [3] contains Chapters 8 - 10. These chapters look to the mental stigmas surrounding sports. It explores the high expectations players are held to and the ways pro athletes have dealt with mental obstacles.

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2019

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook.
When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book

And more...

 

About the Author


Luca Romeo is a student at Georgetown University in the McDonough School of Business studying finance, marketing, and sociology. He also tutors creative writing at a local jail.

Luca has always had an interest in positive psychology and the power of the mind. Coupled with his love of sports he went on this crazy journey of understanding the role of mentality in athletics.

Luca's passion for sports is rivaled by his love of nature and BBC animal documentaries.

For more information you can contact New Degree Press through https://www.newdegreepress.com/contact-us

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #[MindOverData] and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Luca Romeo

story:
I am so grateful to have already raised $1569 toward the $4000 publishing costs for my book. Only $2431 to go! And with your help I know we can do it!

 

Mirrors and Windows explores the importance of role models and mentors in our lives, as well as the power of envisioning and how it can be used successfully to achieve our goals. It features the stories of empowering women who are living their dream jobs, exploring how they achieved them, and what advice they would give to others.

My name is Rosie Baker, and I am the author of Mirrors and Windows. I wrote this book because I am curious about the power of vision and the impact of mentors and role models. What’s more, I wanted to learn about career paths and gather advice from empowering women in various fields of work.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a new way to envision your success as well as learn from the stories and advice of the women featured in it. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for envisioning with mentors and role models in you. Ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you achieve your goals whether career-oriented or personal.

In this book, you'll learn:

The powering of vision - how it is has helped many achieve their goals, as well as help cancer patients recover.

How dreams can become a reality such as Dr. G, a STEM high school professor. She dreamed of being an astronaut and is now training to go to space next year despite the odds being against her.

Being a women does not limit your choice in careers and what to do in life - learn from others that you can achieve whatever you put your mind to.

You will love this book if you want to change the way you think to achieve your goals.

Mirrors and Windows is a non-fiction book that speaks to those in high school or college, those who are planning a career change and are looking at what they want in the future, and those who are setting new goals.

 

The Book - Mirrors and Windows

The book is written in 3 Parts...

Part 1 contains the Introduction + Chapter 1.
This section explores the subjects of change and stepping outside of comfort zones. If we want to achieve our goals we must first acknowledge that we need to embrace changes and challenges. 

Part 2 contains Chapters 2-9.
In this section, the principles of the mirror are explored and stories of empowering women are shared. Dr. G introduces the reader to the concept of Mirrors and Windows while sharing her inspiring story. We learn from Sheryl Sandberg the COO of Facebook on why there are fewer women in the workplace along with interviews from Susan O'Day the CIO of Disney, award-winning journalist Gay Cook, Jackie Spencer Beetle’s tour guide, plus many more. These women open new insights and share their advice from the knowledge they have gained.

Part 3 contains Chapters 10-13.
This section of the book is about exploring various ways to practice envisioning and how you can manifest your dreams into a reality. Each chapter we learn from an empowering woman how they practiced the power of envisioning.  

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

 

About the Author

I am Rosie Baker, and I first became interested in the power of vision and learning from empowering women as a college student in Southern California pursuing a BA degree in Communication with an emphasis in Advertising and Public Relations.

I wrote this book to answer questions that I have and that I am sure many others have too. I wanted to see if there was a way to make goals achievable and ease the process which can sometimes seem overwhelming, especially if you are beginning your career. I believe that I have found a new way to envision success. This book will assure you that there are many others who did not know if their goals would be achievable, but they were, and they did achieve them.

When I’m not writing, I love spending time with my family and friends, especially at the beach or enjoying California sunny days. In 2015 I moved from a small town in England to the hustle and chaos of Los Angeles, where I now live.  I have grown up in two different cultures and love both of them in different ways, although sometimes I may forget the American word for something or someone may not understand me! 

For more information you can connect with me at rosiebaker07@gmail.com and https://www.linkedin.com/in/rosie-baker/

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes it. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #MirrorsAndWindows and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Rosie Baker

We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes it. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

story:
The Story of My Book

The Business Behind Beauty is a book that explores the intersections of entrepreneurship, the beauty industry, and consumerism. Through a narrative style of writing, I share stories from the perspective of visionary founders who have built companies that deeply resonate with Generation Z and Millennial consumers.

I wrote this book because I believe that there is so much that we can learn from studying beauty entrepreneurs. These founders are navigating a constantly evolving landscape that is increasingly permeating the daily lives of young people. As a veteran lover of the beauty industry, I have witnessed how social media has united millions of Generation Z and Millennial beauty enthusiasts. Digital platforms have enabled young consumers to communicate directly with companies, voice their shared desires, and push the industry toward a fundamental transformation.

In the midst of this evolution of beauty, entrepreneurs have found success by embracing the dynamism of these youths. They have heard the calls for change and have responded by building startup companies that prioritize inclusivity, environmental sustainability, transparency, ethical values, and innovative branding. As a result, these founders are tapping into the hearts and wallets of young consumers and setting a new standard for the future.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the power that consumers and entrepreneurs have to revolutionize industries. I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for innovative startups in the beauty space. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you better understand shifting desires of consumers, the efforts of entrepreneurs to respond to them, and how startups are challenging traditional conglomerates that are struggling to keep up.

In this book, you'll learn about trailblazing companies such as:

  • Fenty Beauty
  • The Ordinary
  • Kylie Cosmetics
  • Glossier
  • And many more...

 

You will love this book if you are:

  • A consumer who wants to understand the behind-the-scenes business methods behind your favorite companies
  • An entrepreneur who desires to learn lessons from successful startups navigating uncharted territory
  • A marketer who needs advice on how to create the kind of reciprocal relationship that young consumers seek
  • A corporate executive who wants an insider’s perspective of what is important to Generation Z and Millennials

 

The Business of Beauty is for everybody who is curious about the joint effort between two generations to revolutionize a behemoth industry.

 

The Structure of The Business Behind Beauty

The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains background knowledge of the beauty industry and how it has drastically evolved in the past decade. You will garner an understanding of the current landscape of beauty and how Generation Z and Millennial consumers are interacting with each other and with companies.

Part 2 analyzes the selection of startup companies that I believe are paving the way for the future. You will read narrative-based stories about the inception of each company, how each founder has devised specific strategies that appeal to young people, and the effects that each venture has had on the industry. This part is absolutely rich in content and in thought-provoking material from interviews.

Part 3 discusses my projections for the future of the beauty industry. You will learn about the ultimate mistake that startups must avoid, various challenges to consumerism that are developing, and where beauty innovation is headed.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book.

The money that I raise will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer

 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish a softcover and an e-book. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • You will receive a handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to parts of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Laura Serban is an alumna of Georgetown University who majored in Government and minored in French. She will be attending law school next fall, where she hopes to further explore her interests of social innovation, public interest, and entrepreneurship.

Laura wrote this book because she is fascinated by avant-garde ideas that positively impact individual lives and drive society toward progress. She has long been a member of the digital beauty community, which enables her to feels connected to fellow enthusiasts and creative minds. Leveraging her years of knowledge about the beauty industry and its dramatically changing landscape, she started writing The Business Behind Beauty in an attempt to discover exactly how new generations are altering the world around them. By transmitting her extensive research through easily understood stories, Laura hopes to provide you with engaging narratives about pioneering companies and their ingenious founders.

Laura loves learning about the world and connecting with others. She can often be found sharing memes with her friends, perusing Google Flights, conducting Internet deep-dives on obscure topics, and volunteering at an animal shelter.

For more information, you can connect with Laura at lms335@georgetown.edu, on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/in/laura-serban-23a98a..., and on Twitter at @AuthorSerban.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure that we get the earliest possible shipping date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes; you will know when the copies that you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean that they can't help:

  • Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #thebusinessofbeauty and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of this page.
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.


Thank you so much for all of your love and support! I’ve spent so many months pouring my heart into this book with all of you in the back of my mind, and your interest means the world to me.

Love,
Laura Serban

story:
"In the water and in the air, there are witches, witches everywhere."

Last Year as part of the Inktober online event, Felix Eddy created one pen and ink drawing for every day of the month of October, using two word prompts to direct the subject of her work. A few months later David McLain wrote a poem for each of Felix's drawings. The result is Witches Witches Everywhere: a book of poetry and art covering the areas of witchcraft, magic, death and rebirth.  We're excited to bring this book to you and are sure that you'll find it both beautiful and captivating. 

Felix Eddy is a fine artist and creator in Upstate New York. She has illustrated a number of children's books, including Bark's Mulberry Socks, The Doll Collection, The Big Red Purse, and the Bestiary Alphabet, which she also wrote. She works in many mediums, from big scale oil paintings and small pen and ink drawings to designing embroidery and creating screen-prints and quilting. She regularly shows her work and sewn creations at art shows, galleries, and all over the USA. 

David McLain is the author of three novels: The Life of a Thief, Dragonbait, and the Time Traveller's Resort and Museum. His short stories and poems have been printed in over two dozen magazines. Witches Witches Everywhere is his first book of poetry. He lives in Upstate New York.

story:
Pre-Order Scala Cinema 1978-1993 direct from the publisher FAB Press at www.fabpress.com

 

“The Scala had magic. It was like joining a club – a very secret club, like a biker gang or something … they could show films uncut because they had memberships, well that’s insane! It’s like they were a country club for criminals and lunatics and people that were high … which is a good way to see movies.” 

~ John Waters

A Message from the Author

My name is Jane Giles, and I’m the author of this book. Many of you already know me as the programmer of the Scala cinema between 1988-1992. Since then I’ve been a film exhibitor, distributor, teacher, journalist and have written several non-fiction film publications. But The Scala is my most ambitious book to date, and the one dearest to my heart.

Since the Scala closed in 1993 I’ve wanted to tell its story in depth, but particularly since having met many of today’s most interesting filmmakers who’ve told me how important the Scala programme was to them. One of the most famous directors in the world today still carries his last Scala membership card in his wallet. Looking at the Scala’s history is more than a nostalgia trip, it helps us understand the backstory of British film and what else was happening during those years and therefore a bit more about who we are today.

Because of the very large page format and the number of images that need to be prepared for printing, this is a very expensive book to produce. No ordinary publisher would touch it with a bargepole because they think it’s a risky niche subject with not enough profit for them. But the Scala was never about making a profit, and I know there are enough people out there who really got it and can help make this dream of a book a reality.

Please share this link and help us get the word out... www.fabpress.com

Jane Giles (right) in the Scala office, 1991

 

"The Scala was perverse in every sense of the word. It made sleaze romantic. That cinema was a refuge from suburbia. It made me feel as if I wasn’t the only misfit in the world." 

~ Peter Strickland


Above, comp slip with notes about materials for a Nelly Kaplan season.

 

What You Can Get

The Scala Book - Basic Edition - Thrills but no frills, just the book itself with printed cover. This edition is for people on a budget who are interested in the content, but don’t want or need to have the Collector's Edition or any extras.

The Scala Book - Collector's Edition - The Collector's Edition of the book, gold embossed on a black cloth cover in a stunning heavy duty protective slipcase designed by renowned movie poster artist Graham Humphreys. This slip-cased special edition of the Scala Cinema book will never be re-issued and will be a collector's item superior to the Basic Edition.

The Scala Book Angels Package - The King Kong! - The big philanthropic option. This special level for generous super-fans of the Scala gives you your name printed on the dedicated Angels page at the front of the book, alongside the famous film folk who've already kindly agreed to contribute to the book production costs PLUS a framed certificate confirming your Divine status in the history of the Scala, and more...

Items included in the Angels Package:

•  Collector's Edition of the book in slipcase

•  Your Name on the Angels Page

•  Scala Angels Certificate

•  Your Book Signed by the Author

•  Signed & Numbered Limited Edition Graham Humphreys Art Print

•  Scala Cinema Enamel Badge

•  Scala Membership Card and Holder

•  Scala Cinema Tote Bag

•  Scala Cinema logo T-shirt

•  2019 Scala Wall Calendar

•  An Original Genuine Scala Programme

•  PDF eBook version of the book

•  Four Tickets to the Scala Book Launch at the Scala, King's Cross London on 23 September 2018

 

SLIPCASE COVER ARTIST CONFIRMED!

We’re delighted to announce that superstar movie poster artist Graham Humphreys will be producing an original painting to illustrate the slipcase cover for the Collector's Edition of the Scala book, featuring a host of iconic film characters bursting out of the Scala’s famous King’s Cross cinema! Graham’s association with the Scala dates back to his illustration of The Evil Dead poster in 1982 and he was a regular member of the Scala audience.

Signed & Numbered Limited Edition Graham Humphreys Art Prints are also being included in the philanthropic Angels Package. Graham Humphreys has graciously agreed to donate limited edition art prints of his Scala painting to the Scala Book Angels Package. Each print will be presented in a card frame, which will be individually numbered and signed by Graham himself.

 

 

 

A Legacy Publication to Treasure

No one has ever attempted to reproduce an entire set of a single cinema venue's programmes until now, so it’s hard to find anything comparable to this book. But the text has already been written and we have a complete collection of programmes waiting to be scanned along with other rare materials.

For people who knew and loved the Scala, the book will be a great treasure. And it will go into the libraries of colleges and universities to be studied by generations to come.

This book is possible because of Jane’s in-depth knowledge of the subject, her research skills and her personal access to the key protagonists. Meanwhile, as both designer and publisher of the book, Harvey has also worked for free on the project. We believe that our experience as an author and designer/publisher combined with an expert editor and indexer will guarantee the highest quality publication.

We believe that the networks of people who went to the Scala - whether it was for Shock Around the Clock, Nightmare Movies, the Jackie Chan Fan Club/Eastern Heroes Sunday matinees, Psychotronic Saturdays, All-Nighters, the Laurel & Hardy Festivals, the Animation days, Eraserhead, John Waters’ films, Pink Narcissus, punk gigs, club nights or a combination of ALL of these – we believe that you are the ones who will find this an essential purchase. But cult movie fans of all ages and in all countries will surely enjoy the story of the Scala, and the unparalleled visual resource of all 178 Scala programmes.

 

Book Size Comparison

The Scala book will be the largest ever published by FAB Press

To demonstrate the scope of our ambition, the graphic below compares the Scala book cover next to a big box VHS tape cover and a DVD. At least 400 pages long, the finished book in its slipcase will weigh over 5KG!

 

"The Scala was the dark womb that nurtured our forbidden dreams, the dingy dixie cup strewn transit lounge on the borderlands of the unconscious ... I left some part of me behind there, the ghost of my misspent adolescence huddled in a rude nest of programme notes and sweet papers, lost forever in some all-nighter of the soul where it's always 3am and where there's always another reel to show." 

~ Richard Stanley.

 

 

Please Spread the Word!

Important Notice: We have reached our goal, and this book is definitely going into production, but we want to make sure no one misses out. So please, if you can think of anyone who might also be interested, don't forget to let them know! Please share this link right away and help us make sure as many people as possible know about it... www.fabpress.com

Above, Roy the Scala cafe cat

 

Advantages of buying this book here and directly supporting FAB Press

•  Your book will be fully protected inside a custom designed shipping box; not just thrown inside a generic cardboard box and sent out into the world on a wing and a prayer. We know the importance of receiving a great condition item, and no one else takes as much care as FAB Press to ensure that is exactly what you get.

•  The opportunity to upgrade to the ultimate collector's package, featuring a host of special extras.

•  FREE SHIPPING for all UK-based backers.

 

“The Scala was a place for people who genuinely didn’t fit in anywhere, no longer expected to, and weren’t fussed about it. There was a real ecology to the mix of earnest cinephiles, late-night hedonists, local flotsam and non-specific weirdos.” 

~ Danny Leigh

 

Risks, Challenges, Schedule and Exclusivity

FAB Press is a long established company. We've been publishing books for more than 20 years, self-financing almost every publication. In 2017 FAB Press undertook its first Indiegogo crowdfunding project, successfully delivering on all campaign promises within six months of the campaign end date. Now, for the second time, FAB Press has been presented with a publishing opportunity that is too good to turn down, but is again faced with costs that are far too high to cover independently.

We've asked our printers to quote production costs for the largest page dimensions their bindery can physically cope with so that we can reproduce the Scala programmes in print at the largest realistic feasible dimensions. As we are asking our printers to push their capabilities to their absolute limits, this inevitably means the Scala book is a very expensive production. We need your help so we can perfectly fulfil our vision for this very special once in a lifetime book. Be assured the text of the book is finished and we're going into full production already. Now that we have reached our goal we will do all in our power to make sure the product itself will ship in September this year.

 

How You Can Help

Please help spread the word! Your generosity and enthusiasm in sharing our link with friends, groups, forums and websites, and telling everyone you meet who has an interest in cult movies in general, or the Scala cinema in particular, will make a huge difference. We need each person who may be interested in the history of the Scala Cinema to know about the Collector's Edition in plenty of time so they don't miss out. 

Please also remember that you are directly helping to support independent cult movie publishing so we can go on to make more books about the subjects you love in the future; every time you buy a standard trade edition of a FAB Press book from a bookstore or any of the large online retailers instead of direct from FAB Press, you are actually giving your money to them — we get very little in return from such sales, leaving less income for authors and making it very much harder for us to finance future publications. In fact the mark-ups demanded by the major online stores are now at a level that means the only way we can continue to stay in business and keep publishing books at all is due to the kindness of our valued customers who directly support FAB Press by either buying from our website (www.fabpress.com) or by backing campaigns such as this one.

A massive thank you if you do pledge and join us in making this historically important book about the iconic Scala cinema a reality in the most spectacular high-specification format imaginable.

Harvey & Jane

FAB Press, England

 

Please remember... we want to make sure no one misses out!

Once more, to clarify... This campaign is going to continue for some time now that we have cracked our initial target. If you have backed our campaign and you can think of anyone else who might also be interested, do them a favour and let them know all about it! Please share this link and help us get the word out to as many people as we can... www.fabpress.com

•  Four Tickets to the Scala Book Launch at the Scala, King's Cross London on 23 September 2018
 
SLIPCASE COVER ARTIST CONFIRMED!
We’re delighted to announce that superstar movie poster artist Graham Humphreys will be producing an original painting to illustrate the slipcase cover for the Collector's Edition of the Scala book, featuring a host of iconic film characters bursting out of the Scala’s famous King’s Cross cinema! Graham’s association with the Scala dates back to his illustration of The Evil Dead poster in 1982 and he was a regular member of the Scala audience.
Signed & Numbered Limited Edition Graham Humphreys Art Prints are also being included in the philanthropic Angels Package. Graham Humphreys has graciously agreed to donate limited edition art prints of his Scala painting to the Scala Book Angels Package. Each print will be presented in a card frame, which will be individually numbered and signed by Graham himself.

  
 
A Legacy Publication to Treasure
No one has ever attempted to reproduce an entire set of a single cinema venue's programmes until now, so it’s hard to find anything comparable to this book. But the text has already been written and we have a complete collection of programmes waiting to be scanned along with other rare materials.
For people who knew and loved the Scala, the book will be a great treasure. And it will go into the libraries of colleges and universities to be studied by generations to come.
This book is possible because of Jane’s in-depth knowledge of the subject, her research skills and her personal access to the key protagonists. Meanwhile, as both designer and publisher of the book, Harvey has also worked for free on the project. We believe that our experience as an author and designer/publisher combined with an expert editor and indexer will guarantee the highest quality publication.We believe that the networks of people who went to the Scala - whether it was for Shock Around the Clock, Nightmare Movies, the Jackie Chan Fan Club/Eastern Heroes Sunday matinees, Psychotronic Saturdays, All-Nighters, the Laurel & Hardy Festivals, the Animation days, Eraserhead, John Waters’ films, Pink Narcissus, punk gigs, club nights or a combination of ALL of these – we believe that you are the ones who will find this an essential purchase. But cult movie fans of all ages and in all countries will surely enjoy the story of the Scala, and the unparalleled visual resource of all 178 Scala programmes. 
Book Size Comparison
The Scala book will be the largest ever published by FAB Press
To demonstrate the scope of our ambition, the graphic below compares the Scala book cover next to a big box VHS tape cover and a DVD. At least 400 pages long, the finished book in its slipcase will weigh over 5KG!


 
"The Scala was the dark womb that nurtured our forbidden dreams, the dingy dixie cup strewn transit lounge on the borderlands of the unconscious ... I left some part of me behind there, the ghost of my misspent adolescence huddled in a rude nest of programme notes and sweet papers, lost forever in some all-nighter of the soul where it's always 3am and where there's always another reel to show." 
~ Richard Stanley.
 

 

Please Spread the Word!
Important Notice: We have reached our goal, and this book is definitely going into production, but we want to make sure no one misses out. So please, if you can think of anyone who might also be interested, don't forget to let them know! Please share this link right away and help us make sure as many people as possible know about it... www.fabpress.com

Above, Roy the Scala cafe cat
 
Advantages of buying this book here and directly supporting FAB Press

•  Your book will be fully protected inside a custom designed shipping box; not just thrown inside a generic cardboard box and sent out into the world on a wing and a prayer. We know the importance of receiving a great condition item, and no one else takes as much care as FAB Press to ensure that is exactly what you get.
•  The opportunity to upgrade to the ultimate collector's package, featuring a host of special extras.
•  FREE SHIPPING for all UK-based backers.
 

“The Scala was a place for people who genuinely didn’t fit in anywhere, no longer expected to, and weren’t fussed about it. There was a real ecology to the mix of earnest cinephiles, late-night hedonists, local flotsam and non-specific weirdos.” 
~ Danny Leigh


 
Risks, Challenges, Schedule and Exclusivity
FAB Press is a long established company. We've been publishing books for more than 20 years, self-financing almost every publication. In 2017 FAB Press undertook its first Indiegogo crowdfunding project, successfully delivering on all campaign promises within six months of the campaign end date. Now, for the second time, FAB Press has been presented with a publishing opportunity that is too good to turn down, but is again faced with costs that are far too high to cover independently.
We've asked our printers to quote production costs for the largest page dimensions their bindery can physically cope with so that we can reproduce the Scala programmes in print at the largest realistic feasible dimensions. As we are asking our printers to push their capabilities to their absolute limits, this inevitably means the Scala book is a very expensive production. We need your help so we can perfectly fulfil our vision for this very special once in a lifetime book. Be assured the text of the book is finished and we're going into full production already. Now that we have reached our goal we will do all in our power to make sure the product itself will ship in September this year.
 

How You Can Help
Please help spread the word! Your generosity and enthusiasm in sharing our link with friends, groups, forums and websites, and telling everyone you meet who has an interest in cult movies in general, or the Scala cinema in particular, will make a huge difference. We need each person who may be interested in the history of the Scala Cinema to know about the Collector's Edition in plenty of time so they don't miss out. 
Please also remember that you are directly helping to support independent cult movie publishing so we can go on to make more books about the subjects you love in the future; every time you buy a standard trade edition of a FAB Press book from a bookstore or any of the large online retailers instead of direct from FAB Press, you are actually giving your money to them — we get very little in return from such sales, leaving less income for authors and making it very much harder for us to finance future publications. In fact the mark-ups demanded by the major online stores are now at a level that means the only way we can continue to stay in business and keep publishing books at all is due to the kindness of our valued customers who directly support FAB Press by either buying from our website (www.fabpress.com) or by backing campaigns such as this one.
A massive thank you if you do pledge and join us in making this historically important book about the iconic Scala cinema a reality in the most spectacular high-specification format imaginable.
Harvey & Jane
FAB Press, England

 

Please remember... we want to make sure no one misses out!
Once more, to clarify... This campaign is going to continue for some time now that we have cracked our initial target. If you have backed our campaign and you can think of anyone else who might also be interested, do them a favour and let them know all about it! Please share this link and help us get the word out to as many people as we can... www.fabpress.com

story: The Literary Arts Program at Ann Arbor's Teen Center The Neutral Zone works with over 200 young people a year to help them enhance their skills as thinkers, writers and communicators. Through weekly workshops in poetry, fiction and publishing, as well as poetry slams, readings, guest author visits, field trips and a week-long summer camps, the Literary Arts Programs at The Neutral Zone help young people to develop their voices as writers, thinkers snd communicators of influence and consequence. We want to build a community where young people lead richer and fuller lives due to a passionate attachment to both the written and spoken word. We believe the power of human language is the greatest power on earth and your contribution will help us help young people to harness that power to build their own futures.

story:
The Q Card is a simple and easy-to-use tool for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer/questioning (LGBTQ) youth and their healthcare providers. The goal of the project is to empower youth to become active participants in their healthcare, and to educate providers about how to be better advocates and allies for young LGBTQ patients. Ultimately, we hope that this will lead to increased self-efficacy among youth, better health outcomes for LGBTQ people, and improved sensitivity among healthcare providers.

The Q Card is a tri-fold business card that allows youth to fill in their preferred name and pronouns, sexual and gender identities, and any questions or concerns.  The bottom panel is a tear-off with tips for providers on how to be more sensitive when working with queer youth.  The Card guides youth through a conversation on privacy and confidentiality, and encourages them to come out to their healthcare providers.  

Here's what you need to know about this project:

  • Based on the results of a feasibility study conducted in 2013, we know that the Seattle community is excited about this project.  
  • Five focus groups with LGBTQ youth and 23 interviews with medical and service providers demonstrated that people not only liked the idea, but also wanted to see it operationalized in a pilot. 
  • We propose printing 50,000 copies of the Q Card, and distributing them across Seattle and King County. 
  • We need to raise at least $10,500 to run a full pilot, which includes design, printing, web development, distribution, and trainings with queer youth.  
  • If we don't reach our goal, printing and web development will be our priorities. These two pieces will cost about $6,000.
  • We've got a bunch of great perks to offer anyone who supports the project, from a bowtie tutorial to your name/logo featured on the Q Card! Whether you chip in $10 or $1000, we want to make it worth your while! 
  • We will update this page throughout the project with photos, videos, and exciting developments, so visit the gallery and check back often! 

If you're unable to donate at this time, please forward this page to your friends, colleagues, neighbors, and anyone who might be interested!  

Thank you for your support!

-Genya and the Q Card Team

story:
What is Amor and Exile?

"Beautifully told love stories that illuminate the many ways in which immigration can enrich our lives.”

—Helen Thorpe, author of Just Like Us: The True Story of Four Mexican Girls Coming of Age in America

Resumen en español abajo.

Across the United States, American citizens are forced underground, exiled abroad and separated from their spouses for a surprising reason. Amor and Exile is the story of American citizens—including Veronica, Ben, J.W., and Nicole—who fall in love with undocumented immigrants only to find themselves trapped in a legal labyrinth, stymied by their country’s de facto exclusion of their partners.

Journalist Nathaniel Hoffman visited both sides of the border to document the lives of these couples caught in the crossfire of America’s high stakes political fight over immigration. In his disarming and precise style, Hoffman also traces the historical relationship between immigration, love and marriage. Lending an authentic voice to Amor and Exile, coauthor Nicole Salgado delivers a searing first-person account of life in the U.S. with her husband while he was undocumented, her tortured decision to leave the country with him, and their seven years of exile and starting over together in Mexico.

Amor and Exile tells of love that transcends borders—a story shared by hundreds of thousands of U.S. citizens—cutting through the immigration debate rhetoric and providing a courageous perspective for one of the most vexing policy problems of our time.

“The plight of same-sex bi-national couples is one of the nation's most significant untold stories. This moving, gripping and very timely book, brings to life the serious injustice and struggle that discriminatory laws impose. As someone who is part of such a couple, I'm grateful that there's finally a book examining all aspects of this issue—and an outstanding book at that.”
—Glenn Greenwald, Guardian columnist, former constitutional lawyer and author of How Would a Patriot Act, A Tragic Legacy and With Liberty and Justice for Some

Who are Nicole and Nathaniel?

Amor and Exile represents a unique collaboration between Nathaniel Hoffman, an experienced journalist, and Nicole Salgado, an American biologist living in exile in Mexico since 2006. Nicole and Nathaniel attended Cornell University together in the late 1990s. After a decade on the immigration beat, Nathaniel began work on Amor and Exile in June 2010. He contacted Nicole and her husband, Margarito Resendiz, to serve as primary sources for his reporting. It soon became clear that Salgado had conceived a vision to tell a story of her migration soon after leaving the U.S. Naturally, the two writers decided to join forces.

The authorship of Amor and Exile combines the best of journalism with the type of testimonial writing that drives so much authentic discourse in this day and age. In both form and function, Amor and Exile is a work of extreme currency.

You can read more about Amor and Exile on our website, http://amorandexile.com,  join our Facebook page and follow us on Twitter.

What You Can Do:

We are launching Amor and Exile at a critical moment in history: Congress is considering a major overhaul of immigration law. The legislation under consideration could include provisions to help families like Nicole's and provide a path to citizenship for some of the 12 million undocumented immigrants in the U.S., but the proposals are subject to amendments that could actually make it harder for mixed-status couples to return to the U.S. legally together. As the first book to explain the true impact of immigration law on American citizens with undocumented spouses, including same-sex, binational couples—combining deep journalism and first-person narrative—Amor and Exile is uniquely poised to bring new light to a frequently dehumanizing political debate.

Congress needs to hear the stories in Amor and Exile. We are raising funds on Indiegogo to send a copy of Amor and Exile to every member of Congress. With a $20 contribution, we will send a copy of the book to one senator or member of Congress and a personal note about your hopes for immigration reform to any member of Congress you choose. Visit http://amorandexile.com to find your senators and representatives.

We need to raise $11,000 by the end of May in order to deliver these books to Washington in a timely manner.

Reaching our campaign goal will provide us with sufficient funds to print an initial run of Amor and Exile and send 535 copies of the book to Congress along with your personal notes. Any additional funds will help offset the costs we've already incurred in producing this book including:

  • Nathaniel's monthlong reporting trip to Mexico and trips to Colorado and Texas.
  • Professional cover design and copy editing.
  • Self-publishing costs including setting up our new imprint, Cordillera West Books.
  •  An efficient, low-cost plan to promote and market the book across the United States and Central Mexico.

A portion of future proceeds beyond our campaign goal will be donated to immigration advocacy groups.

What Else You Can Do: 

We believe it is essential to get this book in the hands of our elected representatives right now. But we also know that many of you are eager to get your hands on a copy as well. So for a $50 contribution we will not only send a copy to Congress, but also send you a pre-release signed copy of Amor and Exile. You can review all of the options for supporting the publication of Amor and Exile in the sidebar to the right.*

Whether or not you are able to contribute right now, please share this campaign with your friends and family. It is important that we reach supporters nationwide and internationally, so please let your Facebook and Twitter friends in every state and worldwide know about Amor and Exile!

More Critical Acclaim for Amor and Exile

"A mesmerizing, important look at some of the most overlooked people in the immigration debate—U.S. citizens who follow their deported loved ones into an agonizing exile... Amor and Exile deserves a wide readership."

—Ellin Jimmerson, Ph.D., historian, theologian and writer/director of “The Second Cooler,” an award-winning migrant justice documentary, narrated by Martin Sheen

“Amor and Exile is a highly gripping, personal and accurate account of the tragedies of our current immigration system, especially as they impact American families. It is particularly timely given Congress’ current focus on immigration reform.”

—Michael Davis, immigration attorney, Chair of USCIS International Operations Liaison Committee and Co-Editor, The Consular Practice Handbook

*Note:

Contributors who choose anonymous visibility will not be thanked publicly on our social media pages.

Both paypal and direct credit card payments are processed immediately. However, paypal contributions will be received immediately whereas direct credit card payments will not be received until 15 days after campaign end.

Resumen en español

Amig@s: Desde 1996, nuestros legisladores han aprobado leyes migratorios mas y mas estrictas, para excluir a la gente de pocos recursos. A pesar de estos leyes, el ingreso de migrantes no ha cesado, resulta que la cantidad de gente indocumentada se ha disparado. Esto, sorprendentemente, incluye a personas con esposos Americanos. Amor and Exile es un libro por Nathaniel Hoffman, periodista, y Nicole Salgado, una mujer Americana que tuvo que salir de su propio país para quedar con su esposo Mexicano, quien, debido a leyes proveniente de la época de los 1990’s, no pudo estar legalmente en los Estados Unidos.

Amor and Exile intenta informar al publico y al gobierno Estadounidense de este problema y ofrecer una nueva perspectiva para llegar a una solución. En su campaña inicial de la auto publicación de su libro, buscan mandar 535 copias del libro a Washington, D.C.—una copia para cada miembro de las dos Cámaras de Representantes y Senadores. Es un momento crítica en la historia de los EEUU porque en hoy día los legisladores en Washington están debatiendo la posibilidad de la reforma migratoria. Tenemos una oportunidad de influir la política gubernamental hacia mas reunificación familiar y una política migratoria mas justa, en vez de mas leyes que criminalizan los migrantes. Tu contribución, sin importar la cantidad, nos apoyaría hacer nuestra visión una realidad y ayudaría lograr una mejor calidad de vida para futuros migrantes. También agradeceríamos su ayuda en compartir nuestra campaña con sus amig@s a través de Facebook, Twitter, y otros medios!

story:
***UPDATE*** Anyone who donates or has donated $25 or more will also receive ebook copies of all of Nightscape Press's current and future titles! Just the current titles alone are a deal at this price let alone future titles and the other perks included.

 

Great Cutting Edge Vampire SF for Charity!

I'm Robert S. Wilson, author of the Empire of Blood dystopian vampire books and one of three editors from the Horror for Good Charitable Anthology series. I've been planning on editing an anthology on my own for a while now. In fact, the first idea that came to mind was a cutting edge dark vampire anthology.

In the time since my fiction has been on the market, I've found a lot of friends online. One of these friends has a daughter with Cystic Fibrosis. This friend has been one of the biggest supporters of my fiction and I would like to repay her by giving to the very foundation that is helping her daughter in so many great ways: The Cystic Fibrosis Trust, a UK-based charity that assists those suffering with CF.

Imagine, if you will, a collection of stories that represent the most cutting edge science fiction-based vampire fiction. Think SF-based vampire fiction like I Am Legend and Necroscope and how they affected the vampire genre when first released. Dark Vampire SF that goes where the genre hasn't before. That is what I want to aspire to for this anthology.

Submissions will open October 1st and close at midnight Pacific Time October 31st, Halloween night. Unpublished stories only. Full fledged horror is welcome but each story must have a strong science fiction element at its core. 1,500 to 10,000 words with a preference in the 1,500 to 5,000 range. Payment upon publication will be an author copy and at least a token payment. Final author payment will be based on how much money is raised from this Indiegogo project. So please consider donating to help me pay the authors for their hard work.

 

Authors Contributing to Blood Type:

This list will be updated as new authors are confirmed:

 

  • Mike Resnick

  • Laird Barron

  • Tim Waggoner

  • Peter Watts (has agreed to contribute a story)

  • Stephen Graham Jones

  • Michael Collings

  • Peter Giglio

  • H.E. Roulo

  • Jason Duke

  • Amelia Mangan

  • Brian Fatah Steele 

 

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Donations will go to pay the authors whose stories are accepted for thier fine work. The funding goal is based on paying authors a pro rate of $0.05 a word with a projected book length of 60 to 80,000 words and to cover the cost of all perks. Often charity anthologies are not able to pay anything and I felt it would be great to be able to do a high quality anthology for charity that is still able to pay its authors.
  • Everyone who donates will recieve an ebook copy of the final anthology. Those who give bigger donations will also receive some of the following perks: a listing in the acknowledgements, a character in one of the stories named after you, a special thanks in the dedication, a paperback copy signed by the editor including bookmarks signed by the individual authors, and more.

If I don't meet my goal for funding, the money raised will still go to pay the authors and whatever perks that have been donated toward. So, either way, the author gets paid. It's up to you to help me pay them well.

The Impact

Not only will you help to pay authors but you will also help to make possible a constant donation to The Cystic Fibrosis Trust:

  • Every time this book is purchased it will donate funds to The Cystic Fibrosis Trust.
  • As one of the editors for Horror for Good: A Charitable Anthology Volume 1, I have some very good experience in making a great anthology for charity. Horror for Good has raised a significant amount of money for amfAR The Foundation for AIDS Research, and will continue to do so for as long as it is on the market.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

***UPDATE*** Anyone who donates or has donated $25 or more will also receive ebook copies of all of Nightscape Press's current and future titles! Just the current titles alone are a deal at this price let alone future titles and the other perks included.
 
Great Cutting Edge Vampire SF for Charity!
I'm Robert S. Wilson, author of the Empire of Blood dystopian vampire books and one of three editors from the Horror for Good Charitable Anthology series. I've been planning on editing an anthology on my own for a while now. In fact, the first idea that came to mind was a cutting edge dark vampire anthology. 
In the time since my fiction has been on the market, I've found a lot of friends online. One of these friends has a daughter with Cystic Fibrosis. This friend has been one of the biggest supporters of my fiction and I would like to repay her by giving to the very foundation that is helping her daughter in so many great ways: The Cystic Fibrosis Trust, a UK-based charity that assists those suffering with CF.
Imagine, if you will, a collection of stories that represent the most cutting edge science fiction-based vampire fiction. Think SF-based vampire fiction like I Am Legend and Necroscope and how they affected the vampire genre when first released. Dark Vampire SF that goes where the genre hasn't before. That is what I want to aspire to for this anthology.
Submissions will open October 1st and close at midnight Pacific Time October 31st, Halloween night. Unpublished stories only. Full fledged horror is welcome but each story must have a strong science fiction element at its core. 1,500 to 10,000 words with a preference in the 1,500 to 5,000 range. Payment upon publication will be an author copy and at least a token payment. Final author payment will be based on how much money is raised from this Indiegogo project. So please consider donating to help me pay the authors for their hard work.
 


Authors Contributing to Blood Type:
This list will be updated as new authors are confirmed:
 


Mike Resnick


Laird Barron




Tim Waggoner


Peter Watts (has agreed to contribute a story)


Stephen Graham Jones


Michael Collings


Peter Giglio


H.E. Roulo




Jason Duke


Amelia Mangan




Brian Fatah Steele 


 
 
 
 
What We Need & What You Get

Donations will go to pay the authors whose stories are accepted for thier fine work. The funding goal is based on paying authors a pro rate of $0.05 a word with a projected book length of 60 to 80,000 words and to cover the cost of all perks. Often charity anthologies are not able to pay anything and I felt it would be great to be able to do a high quality anthology for charity that is still able to pay its authors.
Everyone who donates will recieve an ebook copy of the final anthology. Those who give bigger donations will also receive some of the following perks: a listing in the acknowledgements, a character in one of the stories named after you, a special thanks in the dedication, a paperback copy signed by the editor including bookmarks signed by the individual authors, and more.

If I don't meet my goal for funding, the money raised will still go to pay the authors and whatever perks that have been donated toward. So, either way, the author gets paid. It's up to you to help me pay them well.


The Impact
Not only will you help to pay authors but you will also help to make possible a constant donation to The Cystic Fibrosis Trust:

Every time this book is purchased it will donate funds to The Cystic Fibrosis Trust.

Short Summary

My name is Vanessa Bright.  I am the Founder of Financial Futures Now, an organization dedicated to educating America's youth on the basic principles of financial literacy and providing them with the skills to become financially free and fiscally responsible adults.

What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking the Indiegogo community support to raise funds to edit the text, design the cover, self-publish and market the book.  In return, based on your donation level, you will receive a specially designed book marker, magnet with final book cover design, piggy bank design kit and/or signed copy of the book.

The Impact

Today college graduates under the age of 25 are faced with daunting statistics, 9.4% of them are unemployed and another 19.1% are in jobs for which they are overqualified.

T. Rowe Price recently published its fourth annual ‘Parents, Kids and Money Survey’ which revealed parents’ financial regrets: not saving enough, being in debt, and starting to save too late.  Teaching kids to save more, start early and control debt will help them avoid their parents’ mistakes. 

Studies have shown that parents have the greatest influence on their children’s financial habits.  However, taking the primary role in educating their children about healthy money management can be a daunting task, especially when they feel ill-prepared to teach the subject.

I remember my parents telling me to study hard, go to college and get a good job - that was the key to success. They were self-employed, but they wanted an easier path for me.  They owned an insurance and real estate agency, but they never talked about mortgages or the value of insurance.  They told me to save money, but made no mention of how, why or what to do with it. The emphasis in my household was on studying hard and going to college as preparation for a good life.

Preparation is key.  Although an “A” student in high school, I set off to college on a scholarship without a real plan or any goals regarding what I wanted to accomplish.  I managed to graduate with a business degree and slightly above average GPA, without really applying myself.  While in college, I didn’t take advantage of the career placement opportunities and I left school with no real plan or idea of what type of career I wanted. 

For most of my adult working life, I wanted to be an entrepreneur like my parents.  I researched countless business opportunities, but out of fear, waited until I was almost 40 with a new baby and a substantial mortgage to leave a well-paying job to use all my resources to start my own insurance agency.  I entered this venture with no real plan or established goals except that of not working for someone else.  I was 6 months into the business when I realized I would go broke trying to make the business pay for itself as well as my financial obligations. 

My parents, James and Jean, gave solid advice, but it was only a part of the story.  We need to teach our kids more about finances and the various career options that are available, including self-employment and entrepreneurship.  Learning about money early in life is critical to financial success as an adult. 

Thus, I have made it my mission to help my son, and other kids avoid the pitfalls of lack of planning, nonexistent goal setting, and poor financial management.  Last year, I established Financial Futures Now, an organization dedicated to educating America’s kids on the basic principles of financial literacy and providing them with the skills to become fiscally responsible adults. In order to reach more parents and children, I have written this book.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that everyone can't make a financial contribution.  However, I am asking you to share the information about this campaign with as many people as you can.  Don't forget to take advantage of the Indiegogo share tools.  Also, please buy the book when it comes out.  It will be available on Amazon.com.  Information can be found on my website, facebook and twitter pages.

Thank you for helping me change the paradigm of how children view, think about and handle their finances.  Let’s end a national epidemic of:  overwhelming debt; stressed-out adults and children with misplaced priorities.

story:
Make Every School & Workplace in Canada a Bully Free Zone

Having suffered years of abuse and torment by bullies at school as a teen – to the point where she wanted to take her own life – Joanne Greenwood knows all about the devastating emotional damage that bullying can have. Joanne has since realized that a few committed individuals CAN become a very powerful force for positive change. In 2011, Joanne co-founded BFZ – Bully Free Zone Canada.

Bully Free Zone Canada's mission is straightforward: to make EVERY school and workplace in Canada a Bully Free Zone.

It's time for ALL of us to take a stand. What will YOU do to end bullying?

Donate NOW to Bully Free Zone Canada

Help us reach our next $5,000 goal by contributing online via indiegogo.com. A $25 donation gets you one of our (stylish!) BFZ – Bully Free Zone Canada t-shirts.

All monies raised will go directly to delivering BFZ's Anti-Bullying Resource Kits to classroom teachers in the BC Lower Mainland, and to developing additional programs and resources to combat bullying in schools, organizations, and workplaces. Learn more about BFZ's programs.

Contribute Now ▶

Teachers – Access Our Anti-Bullying Resource Kits

Bully Free Zone Canada produces anti-bullying resource kits for classroom teachers.

Like Us on Facebook

Like us on Facebook and get involved in our online conversation about bullying.

Follow Us on Twitter

Follow us on Twitter for the latest BFZ and anti-bullying news.

story:
This fiction novel is a based on an ancient theory of aliens being a part of the creation of the human race. The manuscript is now finished and is in the second stage of editing. It has received very good reviews from beta readers so far. Author Jason P. Stadtlander is known for writing creative, innovative, compelling stories. Jason's stories have received wonderful reviews on Amazon.com (Ruins of the Mind on Amazon), Barnes and Noble and GoodReads.com

Without revealing too much of the plot, the story is about an alien race that created humans thousands of years ago but chose to remain concealed. Only now there is an impending threat that could destroy the human species, and the alien race wants to help humans fight off this threat. So for the first time the aliens are making themselves known to humanity. Not all people are willing to accept the aliens at face value, however, which causes serious conflict. The result is a spell-binding story filled with mystery, science fiction, suspense and surprises at every turn.

Although Jason has been writing for more than twenty years, he only recently launched his publishing career. He currently has one book in print (Ruins of the Mind), another finished, and is working on three additional novels, one of which, “The Ter’roc,” is a continuance of a short story from Ruins of the Mind. 

 

FUNDING BREAKDOWN

The following must be raised for the book to go to print:

  • Editing Costs: $3,300
  • Cover Design: $1,000
  • Marketing Internationally: $4,950

Raising the following additional amount for a first-print run would be an ideal scenario:

  • First Run Hard Cover Printing Costs (1000 books): $8,555

Any funds raised above the first-print run costs will go toward the Children's Literacy and Publishing Program explained below.

If printings costs can also be covered, that will be icing on the cake, but the primary goal is to cover the editing, cover design and marketing costs as these are essential to make the book a best seller.

 

 

WHAT YOU GET

 

Digital Human Level ($5.00): digital wallpaper of the cover once it is finished and a thank-you on Jason's author website

Digital Alien Level ($15.00):  everything from Digital Human plus a digital copy of

The Ter'roc: Evolution (Kindle format)

Species Leader ($30.00): everything in the previous levels as well as a signed thank-you letter from Jason

Humanity Leader ($100.00): everything in Species Leader as well as an autographed Hard Cover copy of The Ter'roc: Evolution

Species Hero ($250.00): everything from Humanity Leader level as well as a custom T-Shirt and bookmark

Humanity's Hero ($500.00): everything from Species Hero plus being listed on the thank-you list printed in the book and a poster of the book

Planetary Hero ($1000.00): everything from Humanity's Hero plus five additional signed books by the author, editor and illustrator and a video Skype conference with Jason, personally thanking you. (If you are located within 200 miles of Boston, Jason will meet with you for lunch instead of the Skype conference)

Solar System Hero: ($2500.00): everything from Planetary Hero plus your name being used as a character in the next book and a personal invitation to Jason's book release party to be held on a beach in Swampscott, Massachusetts, in the summer/fall of 2013. Jason will also come to your town (if in the United States) and do a personal signing at your local library.

 

Children's Publishing Program

(a personal note from the author)

 

I have been training parents and children on the safe usage of computers and the internet for over a decade. I have also worked with law enforcement and the foster parent program of Massachusetts and am a strong advocate of literacy, not only in the United States but also world-wide. My plan—and heart’s desire—is to begin a literacy program for children here in the United States, eventually going global, that encourages children to write. My goal is to create a program to engage children in writing their own books and assist them in publishing them, paving a path for them to realize their own potential through writing.

 

Any funds collected above and beyond the full campaign goals will be put toward this goal for the children.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

I realize that not everyone is in a position to contribute. I would be eternally grateful, however, if you would pass on the news of this campaign via twitter, Facebook, email or any other methods possible.

 

I appreciate and thank you for your support—in whatever way you choose to help.

story:
Hello my name is Jason and I have stage 4 lymphadema with stacious ulcers and do to my insurance not covering most of my needs i am forced to suffer and or try to raise funds by selling stuff to just make it each month. My bills both regular household and medical have piled up as I cant work right now and live on 576.00 in ssi per month.

Out of my ssi I have to help with rent, groceries, house hold needs and some basic bills and try to get my medical needs including supplies and medicines.
Do to the severe nature of the wounds on leg and the heavy drainage I need to wrap my leg with dressings 1-2 times a day depending on how hard of a drain I have. I need to get a min. 60 - 80 abd pads, same as kurlex roll gauze, 100 rubber gloves and min. 12 rolls of paper tape as seen in the pics and for 2 months i was given that then the insurance stopped saying that they could no longer do that and would only allow 30 abd pads, 30 roll gauze, 30 gloves and 4 rolls of tape.

As can be seen by the photos I use 2-3 of everything for the dressing on my leg with only 30 I am out before the month is up which is an extremely unhealthy and dangerous situation for me do to higher risk level of infection I am tired of fighting the insurance to get my needs.

Because of the insurance issues and the fact this is a life long illness I can use any and all help and hope you can find it in your hearts.

Thank you Sincerely Jason
