story:
This is my first book.  I invite you to share the fun.

Recharge your brain vitality!  At any age, we can grow more brain cells and improve their function. This was proven by science in 1998, when Dr. Fred Gage, professor at the Salk Institute, confirmed it in the lab. Physical exercise encourages new brain cell growth and vitality (also proven by Gage).

What's in the book?  Three sections: The Exercise Program, Lifestyles for Happy Brains, and Resources. About 30 percent of the exercises involve crossing your midline, to trigger left/right brain communication. (Get an explanation of how “crossover exercise” works, below.)  Many of them can be done in a chair. The remainder are breathing exercises, balancing postures (holding a support is optional), finger exercises and eye movements. Tons of photos are included with explanations. Readers choose from a variety of exercises, to suit their needs. A few "quick tune-ups" and suggested 10-15 minute workouts are provided.

The Lifestyles for Happy Brains section includes brain benefits of aerobic exercise, nutrition, smiling / laughing, breathing well, relaxation, sleep, and drinking enough water. Harmful effects of cortisol (the stress hormone) on your brain are mentioned, with notes on keeping stress at bay. How to practice breath awareness for meditation is shared.

The 3rd section, Resources, shows you where to find related information, neuroscience news, and brain fitness activities near you.

Who needs it ? Anyone wanting to "switch the brain on" to refresh energy and alertness, improve memory and focus. Some of the exercises bring calmness, a sense of balance and stress relief. "Balance" refers to both your mental state AND physical ability to balance, a helpful thing for older persons concerned about falling. 

Why me, why now? After 30 years of writing/ teaching on health and fitness, I started Brain Vitality seminars last year, and they've been well received. Participants encouraged me to make a book or DVD of the exercises. I decided to start with a book, and it's 70 percent done. For more about me, read my profile by clicking on my name, below.

Sharing the tools.  Your contribution will bring Brain Vitality information to many people.  The exercises help reduce stress, enhance energy and focus. For children with attention disorders, and for athletes, they've improved concentration. (Documented in “Smart Moves” by Carla Hannaford, Ph.D.)

I am scheduled to give some free seminars and books to Veterans clinics and a mental health center, for the counselors, as well as clients. With the rise of PTSD and suicides in the military, and my personal experiences with anxiety and depression, I want to share this useful tool. If the campaign is over-funded, I will provide more free books and seminars to human service providers and their clients. Seminars will be noted on the website, www.mybrainvitality.com

Your investment goes toward:

- Photography

- Printing the books

- Cost for the perks: books, postage, gas

- Fees collected by Indiegogo and Paypal (an optional payment method; credit card is fine, too)

- Free seminars and books for counseling centers

- My full-time-plus work for the next two months, finding the best scientific info to support each topic covered, and more quotes from professional sources, such as David Perlmutter, M.D., author of The Better Brain Book

- Brain Vitality website with neuroscience and brain fitness news

Please share this campaign page with friends who may be interested.    Thank you!

About “crossover” exercises:  These movements cross your body’s midline with arms or legs, like touching left knee with right hand, then right knee with left hand, several times. Repeated crossover moves activate large areas of both sides of your brain, simultaneously. This involves the corpus callosum, a bundle of nerve fibers connecting left and right brain hemispheres. The corpus callosum processes information and is active in problem solving and creativity. Regular practice of crossing midline causes more nerve cells and networks to form in the corpus callosum. This makes communication between sides of the brain faster and more integrated for high-level reasoning, writes Carla Hannaford, Ph.D., in Smart Moves.

Thanks for the Project Video:

- Shelby Woodsmith, Photographer / Videographer

- Erika Cooper, Yoga Deva Model, owner, Elements Yoga in Bonita Springs

- Participants: Barbara, Pete, Angela, Sandy, Tom, Delores

Filmed at Bonita Shores Club and Riverside Park, Bonita Springs, Florida

Website:  http://mybrainvitality.com

http://www.livestrong.com/article/429055-how-to-lose-weight-for-last-time/

Why me, why now? After 30 years of writing/ teaching on health and fitness, I started Brain Vitality seminars last year, and they've been well received. Participants encouraged me to make a book or DVD of the exercises. I decided to start with a book, and it's 70 percent done. For more about me, read my profile by clicking on my name, below.
Sharing the tools.  Your contribution will bring Brain Vitality information to many people.  The exercises help reduce stress, enhance energy and focus. For children with attention disorders, and for athletes, they've improved concentration. (Documented in “Smart Moves” by Carla Hannaford, Ph.D.)
I am scheduled to give some free seminars and books to Veterans clinics and a mental health center, for the counselors, as well as clients. With the rise of PTSD and suicides in the military, and my personal experiences with anxiety and depression, I want to share this useful tool. If the campaign is over-funded, I will provide more free books and seminars to human service providers and their clients. Seminars will be noted on the website, www.mybrainvitality.com
Your investment goes toward: 
- Photography
- Printing the books
- Cost for the perks: books, postage, gas
- Fees collected by Indiegogo and Paypal (an optional payment method; credit card is fine, too)
- Free seminars and books for counseling centers
- My full-time-plus work for the next two months, finding the best scientific info to support each topic covered, and more quotes from professional sources, such as David Perlmutter, M.D., author of The Better Brain Book
- Brain Vitality website with neuroscience and brain fitness news
Please share this campaign page with friends who may be interested.    Thank you!
About “crossover” exercises:  These movements cross your body’s midline with arms or legs, like touching left knee with right hand, then right knee with left hand, several times. Repeated crossover moves activate large areas of both sides of your brain, simultaneously. This involves the corpus callosum, a bundle of nerve fibers connecting left and right brain hemispheres. The corpus callosum processes information and is active in problem solving and creativity. Regular practice of crossing midline causes more nerve cells and networks to form in the corpus callosum. This makes communication between sides of the brain faster and more integrated for high-level reasoning, writes Carla Hannaford, Ph.D., in Smart Moves.Thanks for the Project Video:
- Shelby Woodsmith, Photographer / Videographer
- Erika Cooper, Yoga Deva Model, owner, Elements Yoga in Bonita Springs
- Participants: Barbara, Pete, Angela, Sandy, Tom, Delores
Filmed at Bonita Shores Club and Riverside Park, Bonita Springs, Florida

story:
My Story

My name is Sherri McLain and I've written my first novel called When Red Is Blue. It's a fictionalized account of events that happened during my childhood and early twenties. My mother was diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia several years before I was born, and my father was an alcoholic. The book explores our relationship as a family, and how that relationship was affected by their illnesses. I wanted to paint an honest picture of the trauma and self-esteem issues that a child faces growing up in such an environment. I hope I did the story justice.

Besides believing that my experiences would make a compelling story, I also felt that writing a book would help me to better understand how my past experiences have affected the person I've become. This is the main reason I wrote an autobiographical novel instead of a memoir - so I could step outside the memories and write a more objective story. If you are interested in reading an unedited version of Chapter 3, click on the Gallery tab.

 

The Impact

There are tens of millions of people with close family members who are alcoholics or mentally ill. I want to share my experiences with them in the hope that they might gain a bit of understanding and encouragement.


There are many online support groups that, had the internet been around when I was growing up, would have been a great source of emotional support.


Support Forums

The National Network of Adult and Adolescent Children who have a Mentally ill parent/s (NNAAMI)
World Association of Young People and Others Who have a Mentally ill parent  (WAYMI)
Internet site    http://nnaami.org/


The Proposal

After I finished the novel, I thought about setting out to get an agent and someone to publish it, but decided against it. The inevitable result of asking various people to market your book for you is that your work then becomes a collaboration. I felt, at least for this book, I would be happier if it remained my own. What I really wanted was for my book to be read by as many people as possible.

 

A few weeks ago I came across an article about two authors, one who was unpublished and one who was already a successful novelist. Both writers decided to self-publish some of their works through Kindle and sell them for a nominal amount. This turned out to be a great success for both authors, in that lots and lots of people purchased and read their books. And I thought to myself: Here it is – I’ve found my solution.

 

I’m asking for $6,000 so I can get my (currently 350 page) book professionally edited, get a cover designed and put my book up for sale on Kindle in both the US and UK. I’d also like to get a basic website built so I can respond to people’s questions and comments. Finally, I'd like to get a small number of printed copies made. Those of you who donate a certain amount (see the perks section) will receive a signed copy.

 
If I don't reach my goal, I will get to the stage that funds will allow (e.g., the first $2,000 will go to my editor, etc.) and come up with a Plan B or C to get the rest of the funds. I've come so far that the project has to happen. It will just take me longer.


If I exceed my goal, the extra money will go toward promotion and/or costs associated with other distribution methods.      

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my project with anyone you think might be interested.

story:
Jiyan'ın Sesi Olmaya, Barışa Ses Vermeye Devam!

Jiyan.org: İsyana Ses Ver - Give Revolt a Voice isimli son kampanyamız 21 Aralık 2015 tarihinde sona erdi.
Kampanya sürecinde Türk devleti sitemizi bahanelere sığınıp kapattı, yaptığımız itiraz başvurusunu reddetti. Yaman Akdeniz ve avukatlarımız aracılığıyla meseleyi şu an Anayasa Mahkemesi'ne taşıdık; ama yayına http://www.jiyan.us adresinden devam ediyoruz. Size verilmiş bir sözümüz var. Dönelim ilk kampanyamızın sonuçlarına... 
2000$'lık hedefimizin 990$'ına ulaşabildiğimiz kampanyanın gelirinin elimize geçişinin ardından Şubat ve Mart aylarında mobil uygulamalarımızı hayata geçirmeyi umuyoruz. Ancak görüldüğü üzere bir önceki kampanyamızda 1010$ gerisinde kaldık hedefimizin.  Ve ilk aşamada elde ettiğimiz 990$'la yalnızca aşağıdaki hedeflerimizi yerine getirebileceğiz:
  1. Jiyan.us Android ve iOS uygulamalarının geliştirilmesi.
  2. Jiyan.us yıllık hosting ve domain masraflarının karşılanması.
  3. Jiyan.us tasarım ve görsel üretim masraflarının karşılanması.
Bu hedeflerimizi yerine getirmemize yardımcı olan herkese teşekkürler. Sayenizde Jiyan'ın dış görünüşünü ve görsel tasarımını şimdiden yeniledik  - bkz. http://www.jiyan.us - mobil uygulamalar için ise en iyisini yapmak için görüşmeler sürüyor.

Jiyan Muhabirleri İçin Daha İyi Teknik İmkanlar

Peki yapamadıklarımız? Bir önceki süreçten kalan hedeflerimizi bir filtreden geçirdik ve önceliklerimizi belirledik:
  1. P2P haber iletimi teknolojisi oluşturmak ve sansürü etkisiz kılmak. (300 TL civarı maliyet tahminimiz var)
  2. Kadrolu muhabirlerimiz için alandan canlı yayın yapmaya müsait iki adet  Samsung Galaxy GC100 16 MP 21x  ve muhabirlerin yıllık simkart masraflarını karşılayabilmek. (1500 TL civarında maliyet tahminimiz var)
  3. Alan muhabirlerimiz için 4 adet gaz maskesi. (400 TL civarında maliyet tahminimiz var)
  4. 3 adet ses kayıt cihazı: Sony ICD-PX440 4GB Ses Kayıt Cihazı (570 TL toplam maliyet)
Görüldüğü üzere şu anki toplam ihtiyacımız 2800 TL civarında. 
Buna bağlı olarak vergileri ve kesintileri de hesap ederek 1100$'lık bir ihtiyaç belirledik ve desteklerinizi bekliyoruz.

story:
Yellow Chair turns one next month!  We started in May 2015 as a fledgling monthly literary arts journal.  We had no clue what to expect.  Our growth and community support has been tremendous!  We offered our first chapbook contest in late 2015 and kicked off 2016 by publishing the winner of that contest, Matthew Borczon's A Clock of Human Bones.  Since then we've released two anthologies and Caseyrenee Lopez's chapbook QueerSexWords.  Our list of chapbooks and anthologies is ever growing!  In 2016 we have books forthcoming from Joe Nicholas, Jenuine Poetess, Elizabeth Kirkpatrick Vrenios, Cassandra Lopez and  Heath Brougher.  

In one years time we've released 9 digital issues of Yellow Chair Review, two chapbooks and two anthologies.  We also run the weekly Rock The Chair Poetry challenge that now pays out $5 to the weekly winner.  We've added a strong staff of book reviewers to insure that we not only put out great work but also discuss great work. 

This is our journey and our dream.  To release into the world as much talent as we can.  We seek to act as a safe space for both readers and writers from marginalized groups. We are particularly interested to see work from POC and the LGBTQ community. We are striving to make sure that Yellow Chair remains a place that is diverse and aware. 

Where we need help is with funds.  The costs of running a website, submittable, author copies and potential contributor payments is hefty.   Especially for a young, small, indie press.  We aren't making money and we aren't looking to make money.  We are looking to make books!   

If at all possible help us with this dream.


What Your Donation Will Be Funding:

  • Author copies of books! (anthologies, chapbooks etc)
  • Submittable Costs
  • Webhosting Costs
  • Rock the Chair winnings

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • You can share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter or whatever social media monster you're currently surfing.
  • Support other Indie Presses.  The more support we give to small presses the better!
  • Submit work.  Help us continue to grow!
  • Expand your reading.  Check out books by groups you don't normally flock to.  Find out who is up and coming in the LGBTQ, POC and feminist poetry scenes.  Support publications that are doing all they can to make sure that marginalized voices are being given space.  
  • Vote in your local and general elections!

story:
I have been given the opportunity to travel to Belfast, Northern Ireland and attend a workshop being run by some of the finest living poets, most notably Ciaran Carson.  How to explain the importance of this… let’s say you’re a Yankee’s fan.  This is like getting a chance to learn from Derek Jeter.  My aim is to use this workshop to hone my craft and, when it’s all over, to write some essays based on the experience as well as several new poems.  I plan to create a downloadable self-published short book (in PDF format) when all this is done. 

The money will offset costs and donors can expect returns based on their own desires.  If you want a poem written for or even about you, there's a perk for that.  If you want to kick some extra cash for a signed copy of my already published book in addition to the original poems, there's a perk for that as well.  Higher end donors can meet with me for a drink and tour of my favorite Chicago haunts. 

This is a pretty laid back campaign.  Give what you can, but perks come with specific amounts, and in the end I will hopefully have something to offer that is worthwhile, assuming you are interested in poetry and my wayward writings.

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone, welcome to my Indiegogo campaign to help introduce a new Pirate book to the world of our children, Two Brothers and Their Pirate Tale was written and illustrated by myself, Derek J. Kenmuir, but my two boys helped create the story in the point of view of a child and their imagination. It is a childrens picture book, 24 pages in total and one heck of a Pirate adventure

I am a aspiring children's author that would love the chance to share my stories with the world, I have been writing poetry since I was 16 years old. I truly believe putting poetry back in the stories we tell our children would help spark their imagination ten times over.

This book/project is important to me because we need to encourage our children to use their imaginations again and pretend that they're a pirate, a space explorer, a dinosaur hunter and many more things. Let's get them away from the tablets and share this story with them, it has a rhythmic flow and written in perfect rhyme format to engage the reader or the listener throughout the whole thing.

With all your support, I would love to get this book into the hands of as many libraries and schools around the nation. The Magnitude of your contributions will help do that, and remember you have the ability to change the way our children view the world.

What We Need & What You Get

To make this project a success to enable to get at minimum of 150 books across to 150 locations, including schools and local libraries and in your hands of course we need to raise $2500.

With your contributions you can come away with a signed book by myself, a custom bookmark and a extra copy to give or donate on your behalf to anyone anywhere. This also enables this project/book more exposure around the world, which helps our children explore their imaginations again.

When this campaign is a Success and I know with your help it can be, the funds will go right into what I described above, a non-stop hustle to get this book everywhere possible.

    Risks & Challenges

    After the campaign is completed I will need a few weeks to organize all contributions, as much as this isn't a risk, I just wanted to put this out there so everyone knows. Videos will be updated on my youtube Channel to show updates and on here as well.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      I understand if you're not able to contribute, but I would if you know someone with a child or simply just love what you read above, please share it on any and all social media platforms.

      You Guys Are AWESOME!!!

      Cheers

      Derek J. Kenmuir

story:
the problem

All Haitians speak Creole. Yet government, business, the courts and other formal institutions have traditionally operated in the prestige language—French. This is changing, but there is still a belief that you have to learn French to succeed in Haitian society. Education, therefore, has historically been offered strictly in French. Yet much research shows that teaching children the fundamentals of literacy and numeracy in their first language is far more effective practice. Attempts to teach students to read and write, while at the same time teaching them a foreign language, has long contributed to high dropout rates and low literacy rates. Consequently, since 1979 there has been a growing push to teach Haitian students, at least in the early grades, in their mother tongue. Progress has been slow. The national literacy rate is still only around 50 percent.


Part of the problem is the lack of motivation to learn to read Haitian Creole, and then to exercise emergent literacy skills. When speakers of English and French learn to read, it gives them access a boundless world of knowledge and adventure. They can ride down the river with Huckleberry Finn, explore the galaxy with Le Petit Prince, or battle evil wizards with Harry Potter. At the same time, without even noticing, they are fostering their own cognitive development. Creole literacy, on the other hand, only offers access to a limited sample of the world’s great literature, as only a handful of works have been translated. Why would anyone bother learning to read when there is no immediate payoff? Kids don't care that reading will improve their cognitive function, vocabulary, memory, analytical abilities, capacity for empathy, and ability to express themselves. Kids want adventures. 

the solution

C.S. Lewis’ Chronicles of Narnia are known and loved around the world. The stories have been translated into more than fifty languages, from Afrikaans to Vietnamese. The second book of the series, The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, is considered a seminal work of children’s literature. It is full of thrilling adventure, moral dilemmas, whimsy and wit. When kids finish reading a story like this, the seed is already planted for them to want to keep reading.

Furthermore, The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe is highly applicable to the Haitian context. You might wonder if the witch's curse ("always winter and never Christmas") will have any meaning on a tropical island. It will, undoubtedly, strike a different chord in Haiti than it did to me when I read it as a young Canadian. But the story contains many elements which will resonate with a Haitian cultural consciousness. There is a tyrannical ruler, complete with her own secret police, who is overthrown by a revolution (quite in keeping with Haitian history); there are talking animals and magic spells (both common in Haitian folklore); and yes, there is religion. Lewis was a Christian apologist, who nevertheless drew liberally from Greek and Roman mythology in his writing. Narnia is constructed around a Christian paradigm, but at the same time is rife with fauns, naiads, dryads and other semi-divine spirits of the ancient world. Both Christianity and animism have an important place in the Haitian culture. As such, the world and imagery of Narnia will resonate with the Haitian reader. 

With its gripping story, sympathetic characters and cultural relevance, Lyon an, Lougawou a, ak Amwa majik la will be a valuable addition to the corpus of Creole literature, and a useful contribution to the fight against illiteracy.

how you can help

We've already signed contracts with a publisher. Educa Vision is Florida-based publisher of Creole educational materials and one of the few publishers of world literature in Haitian Creole translation. All that's left is the translation rights. HarperCollins UK oversees rights acquisitions for the Chronicles of Narnia, and they have agreed to sell us the Haitian Creole translation rights. The people at HarperCollins are sympathetic to the particular "emergent literature" situation of the Haitian Creole language, and have kindly offered us a fair price to buy the rights. But it's still more than we can afford to pay out of our pockets. The money we raise in this campaign will foot the bill for the translation rights. If we exceed our goal, the remainder will be donated to an NGO which supports education in Haiti. Likewise, royalties on sales will be reinvested into Haitian literacy. As a bonus, if you donate more than $50, we'll send you a copy of Romulus, Matt's English translation of a 1908 Haitian novella. 

who we are

Hans Michel Fortunat is a Haitian natif natal, and a resident of Port-au-Prince. He has studied French and Haitian literature, and has worked as a teacher of both French and English. He currently works as a Creole-English translator and a business trainer for a Non-Governmental Organization which works closely with several Haitian schools. 

Matt Robertshaw is a grad student at studying Haitian history, language and literature. His research focuses on the language question in Haitian society, and the political and social value of literature. He previously published an English translation of a 1908 Haitian novel. He has training in translation and has worked as a translator and interpreter for the University of Guelph.

Josh Rivers, a talented local artist, has graciously offered to design the cover.

Yo te al viv lakay yon gran pwofèse ki abite nan mitan peyi a, a ven kilomèt soti gran chimen an. Pwofèse sa pa t gen yon madanm, e li viv nan yon gwo kay avèk yon menajè ki rele Madan Makredi, epi twa domestik. (Yo rele Ivet, Mari ak Beti, men pesonaj sa yo pa tre enpòtan pou istwa sa). Li menm se te yon moun ki te granmoun anpil tout cheve li yo te blan avèk li te gen anpil lòt ki te boujonnen prèske toupatou nan figi ak tèt li. Timoun yo renmen li prèske touswit; poutan, premyè jou swa a, lè misye te soti lakay li pou l te akeyi yo nan papòt la, li te tèlman gen yon move visaj ke Lwiz (ki te pi jenn lan) te pe li, e Edmond (ki te dezyèm pi jenn lan) te tèlman anvi ri li te oblije fè komsi l ap mouche nen li pou li te kache ri a.

the problem






All Haitians speak Creole. Yet government, business, the courts and other formal institutions have traditionally operated in the prestige language—French. This is changing, but there is still a belief that you have to learn French to succeed in Haitian society. Education, therefore, has historically been offered strictly in French. Yet much research
shows that teaching children the fundamentals of literacy and numeracy in their first
language is far more effective practice. Attempts to teach students to read and write, while at the same time teaching them a foreign language, has long contributed to high
dropout rates and low literacy rates. Consequently, since 1979 there has been a growing
push to teach Haitian students, at least in the early grades, in their mother tongue.
Progress has been slow. The national literacy rate is still only around 50 percent.



Part of the problem is the lack of motivation to learn to read Haitian Creole, and then to
exercise emergent literacy skills. When speakers of English and French learn
to read, it gives them access a boundless world of knowledge and
adventure. They can ride down the river with Huckleberry Finn, explore the galaxy with
Le Petit Prince, or battle evil wizards with Harry Potter. At the same time, without even noticing, they are fostering their own cognitive development. Creole literacy, on the other hand, only offers access to a limited sample of the world’s great literature, as only a handful of works have been translated. Why would anyone bother learning to read when there is no immediate payoff? Kids don't care that reading will improve their cognitive function, vocabulary, memory, analytical abilities, capacity for empathy, and ability to express themselves. Kids want adventures. 

the solution
C.S. Lewis’ Chronicles of Narnia are known and loved around the world. The stories have been translated into more than fifty
languages, from Afrikaans to Vietnamese. The second book of the series, The Lion, the
Witch and the Wardrobe, is considered a seminal work of children’s literature. It is full of thrilling adventure, moral dilemmas, whimsy and wit. When kids finish reading
a story like this, the seed is already planted for them to want to keep reading.
Furthermore, The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe is highly applicable to the Haitian context. You might wonder if the witch's curse ("always winter and never Christmas") will have any meaning on a tropical island. It will, undoubtedly, strike a different chord in Haiti than it did to me when I read it as a young Canadian. But the story contains many elements which will resonate with a Haitian cultural consciousness. There is a tyrannical ruler, complete with her own secret police, who is overthrown by a revolution (quite in keeping with Haitian history); there are talking animals and magic spells (both common in Haitian folklore); and yes, there is religion. Lewis was a Christian apologist, who nevertheless drew liberally from Greek and Roman mythology in his writing. Narnia is constructed around a Christian paradigm, but at the same time is rife with fauns, naiads, dryads and other semi-divine spirits of the ancient world. Both Christianity and animism have an important place in the Haitian culture. As such, the world and imagery of Narnia will resonate with the Haitian reader. 
With its gripping story, sympathetic characters and cultural relevance, Lyon an, Lougawou a, ak Amwa majik la will be a valuable addition to the corpus of Creole literature, and a useful contribution to the fight against illiteracy.

The people at HarperCollins are sympathetic to the particular "emergent literature" situation of the Haitian Creole language, and have kindly offered us a fair price to buy the rights. But it's still more than we can afford to pay out of our pockets. The money we raise in this campaign will foot the bill for the translation rights. If we exceed our goal, the remainder will be donated to an NGO which supports education in Haiti. Likewise, royalties on sales will be reinvested into Haitian literacy. As a bonus, if you donate more than $50, we'll send you a copy of Romulus, Matt's English translation of a 1908 Haitian novella.

Text Also Available in English

¿Que es Labyrinth Project?

Se trata de una historia de ciencia ficción contada en dos versiones dentro del libro.

Una empresa trabaja en la clandestinidad con un objetivo que ni siquiera todos sus empleados conocen... Viajar en el tiempo, pero en el sueño de alguien mas. El protagonista es un diseñador de sueños, quien se verá envuelto en un experimento que podrá en riesgo su vida.

El libro se distribuirá en formato PDF en la librería digital española Bubok y en formato físico. Tendrá enlaces a vídeos en Youtube, que vienen a ser una extensión de la obra. A si mismo, constituye el contexto donde inicia un videojuego llamado "Labyrinth Project" que desarrolla el mismo estudio.

What's Labyrinth Project?

It's a science fiction story told in two versions.

A company working clandestinely with a goal that all employees not even know ... Time travel, but in someone else's dream. The protagonist is a designer of dreams, who will be involved in an experiment that may risk his life.

The book will be distributed in PDF format in Spanish Bookstore digital and physical format. Have links to videos on Youtube, which are like an extension of the work. A itself, is the context in which begins a video game called "Labyrinth Project" developed by Sparza Multimedia.

story:
My name is Kathryn Roberts. I earned my BFA from Goddard College, where I also served as the managing editor for the literary journal Guideword. My fiction, creative nonfiction, and poetry has appeared in various journals, both online and in print. I've worked as a freelance writer and pastry chef for the better part of the past decade. While at Goddard, I wrote the first draft of a short novel, Companion Plants. The book will be published by Fomite Press, a small independent publisher, this spring.

Companion Plants started as a short story about a young woman figuring out her sexuality in contrast to her religion. But, the piece skirted around what I really wanted--needed--to say. Quite frankly, I was too scared to put anything down on paper that I thought my family wouldn't want to read. That is, until my mentor (and Goddard advisor), the great Ryan Boudinot, told me exactly what I needed to hear:

"Right now there’s a thirteen year-old girl who desperately needs to read what you have to say. She needs to read about sex and religion in precisely the way you’re writing about these subjects in order for her to be happy. The discomfort of those close to you is far outweighed by the needs of those people you’ll never know, who’ll only know you by your words. You’re writing to express something that they themselves cannot express."

I took Ryan's words as my mantra and expanded Companion Plants. After years of writing, wringing my hands, and revising, I finished the novel. In the book, a young woman blames her religious upbringing for a friend's suicide and sets out to discover who she is beyond the strict rules of doctrine. Reinventing herself in a new town, she struggles with breaking the taboos of her mother's faith and navigating the lines between friend and lover, child and adult. As she learns new details about events back home, she is forced to reevaluate the childhood she thought she knew. An excerpt from the novel was published and can be read here: Slush Pile Magazine.

Now: this Indiegogo campaign. I am thrilled by the upcoming publication of my novel, both on a personal achievement level and because I will finally be able to reach other people with the story. But, as my book is coming out through an independent press, and with the publishing industry the way it is today, I am entirely responsible for promotion with no financial help from the publisher. This promotion includes a website, advertising (such as a book trailer and promotional bookmarks), supplying the cover art and author photo, and touring/giving readings.

As a writer who worked a variety of full-time (and then some) jobs to put myself through school and complete my novel, publication with a small press is the chance of a lifetime. The opportunity to get my name out there and potentially get work picked up by a major publishing house later on. But to maximize this opportunity, I need your help!

What I Need & What You Get

All of the money I raise will be put toward promoting my novel. This includes:

  • Payment for the cover art (photograph of Trinidad cliffs by Krista Sappington);
  • An author/book website;
  • A book trailer (my inability to make a video for Indiegogo is an indicator of my need for a professional!);
  • Promotional bookmarks, to be distributed through libraries, stores, and an online bookseller;
  • Travel across the east coast and, with enough raised funds, the rest of the country to give readings and promote the book, focusing on independent bookstores.

Any money raised beyond the initial goal will allow me to host readings in more cities across the U.S. and reach a wider audience with my novel.

Your support will make my dream of being a successful novelist a very real possibility by allowing me to make the most of this opportunity. Plus, you'll support independent publishers and bookstores in the process. You'll be keeping alive a centuries-old tradition of art patronage. Just call yourself Medici.

In return, you will receive:

  • For $5: a personal, hand-written thank you card and a supporter credit on the Companion Plants website;
  • For $10: a personal, hand-written thank you card, a supporter credit on the website, and a Companion Plants bookmark;
  • For $35: a personal, hand-written thank you card, a supporter credit on the website, a Companion Plants bookmark, PLUS a copy of the novel;
  • For $50: a personal, hand-written thank you card, a supporter credit on the website, a Companion Plants bookmark, PLUS a signed copy of the novel inscribed to whomever you choose;
  • For $100: a personal, hand-written thank you card, a supporter credit on the website, a Companion Plants bookmark, a copy of the novel, PLUS a box of homemade cookies (made by me from one of the recipes I developed while working as a pastry chef) and a copy of the recipe;
  • For $250: a personal, hand-written thank you card, a supporter credit on the website, a Companion Plants bookmark, a copy of the novel, PLUS a limited edition print of an ink drawing depicting a scene or character from the novel;
  • For $500: a personal, hand-written thank you card, a supporter credit on the website, a Companion Plants bookmark, a copy of the novel, PLUS Reconciliation: Recipes to Rebuild Your Relationship, the Companion Plants cookbook featuring recipes developed by me during my time as a pastry chef and cook, and notes on beverage pairings contributed by sommelier Dominic Miller;
  • For $750: a personal, hand-written thank you card, a supporter credit on the website, a Companion Plants bookmark, a copy of the novel and the cookbook, PLUS the original block from one of the limited edition prints depicting a scene or character from the novel; or
  • For $1,000: a personal, hand-written thank you card, a supporter credit on the website, a Companion Plants bookmark, a copy of the novel and the cookbook, PLUS 10 copies of Companion Plants signed and donated in your name to the recipients of your choosing.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to contribute but are unable to do so financially, please consider spreading the word about my campaign and my novel. Link to Facebook, say something on Twitter, you know the drill. Indiegogo makes it easy with those little share buttons. I will be endlessly appreciative!

Thank you so much for your help!

PRESENTACIÓN

Mi nombre es Álex de Sande y soy profesor de un instituto de secundaria. Al fallecer mis padres tuve la necesidad de hacer el Camino de Santiago para encontrarme a mí mismo. Al llegar a Finisterre, al Fin del Mundo, fui consciente de que aquel final era un inicio. Así empecé una búsqueda interior que me llevó a vivir muchas experiencias espirituales y a regresar inconscientemente a mis orígenes, el lugar donde nací: un pueblo del Alto Aragón, en la provincia de Huesca, concretamente Graus. A las afueras de la población, escondido en El Valle de La Fueva, en medio de unos bosques mágicos y atemporales descubrí el Monasterio Budista de Dag Shang Kagyü. Allí realicé diferentes cursos de meditación budista y compartí dichas experiencias con personas corrientes, que aprovechando las vacaciones realizaban un retiro espiritual para encontrarse así mismas. Algunas de ellas, tras despertar la conciencia, iniciaban un proceso de trasformación de sus vidas, una metamorfosis interior y exterior. 

  Fascinado por la experiencia humana vivida allí, pude ser testigo de una cautivadora historia de amor que decidí novelar, en la que los personajes irán redescubriendo un pasado lleno de aventuras por medio mundo. Y así se suceden las peripecias de un artista ciego que pinta sueños, monjes que parecen levitar, un cartomántico invidente que ve el futuro, un tatuador de lotos azules invisibles y un oftalmólogo profesor de yoga que intenta enseñar a ver con los ojos del corazón.

El relato destila mucha luz, poesía y espiritualidad. Sin embargo, en bastantes capítulos la ironía y el humor han conseguido arrancar carcajadas contagiosas a los amigos que ya la han leído. Eso me complace, porque sé que la risa lleva a la alegría, y esta a gozar de instantes de felicidad.

PROYECTO

  El objetivo de este proyecto es financiar la publicación de la obra, que consta de 555 páginas DIN A-4, la página web y la promoción a través de las redes sociales.

  Me gustaría compartir la mitad de los beneficios de esta obra con las organizaciones que menciono en la misma y que siempre me han servido de ejemplo e inspiración: la Fundación Dag Shang Kagyü, Cáritas España, Stop Ceguera, Creciendo en Nepal y Fundación Vicente Ferrer.

  Las recompensas irán desde figurar en los agradecimientos de la página web a aparecer en la propia obra en el capítulo del “Invernadero de ideas”, donde se anima a jóvenes a iniciarse como emprendedores y hacer realidad sus sueños buscando financiación en las plataformas de Crowdfunding.

INICIO DE LA OBRA:        QUIERO TOMAR REFUGIO EN TU CORAZÓN

Capítulo - 1 

De repente, ella se despertó con la angustia de ahogarse en un mar de sueños frustrados. Con la respiración acelerada se dio cuenta de que estaba hiperventilando. Empezó a aplicar las técnicas de relajación que había aprendido en las sesiones preparatorias al parto. Apenas había descansado unas horas por el disgusto de saber que la academia en la que trabajaba había cerrado sin previo aviso. Llevaba meses sin cobrar, pero tenía la esperanza de que algo le ingresaran. Esa ansiedad la empujaba a ir al cajero automático del banco hasta diez veces en un día. Al reclamar, siempre le daban nuevas excusas y le pedían más paciencia. Tenía la sensación de estar hundiéndose en la adversidad sin ninguna esperanza.

El divorcio fue una liberación. No iba a consentir nunca más las humillaciones ni los maltratos físicos ni psicológicos de ningún hombre. Con dignidad iba a criar a su hija sin tener que arrastrarse ante nadie. Por eso, debía sacar fuerzas de flaqueza para resistir y continuar luchando sin desfallecer.

Las paredes de la habitación y del resto del piso estaban pintadas de color gris a gusto de su exmarido. Ahora le parecían tan asfixiantes como los muros de una cárcel y quizá lo eran, porque se sentía prisionera de una realidad agobiante que no le dejaba salir. Por eso, había empezado a empapelarlas con folios en blanco, como si fueran ventanitas en las que escribía frases que le ayudaban a levantar el ánimo y a desahogarse, porque sabía que el rencor y el odio que se acumula dentro, acaba carcomiendo el alma. Volvió a leer sus palabras con el coraje, el dolor y la rabia de las mujeres que nunca se rinden antes de la batalla:

“Hay personas que empiezan a morir en vida. Otras están muertas y aún no lo saben.  La putrefacción es sutil y rauda. Algunos, al sentir el olor a cadaverina, se embalsaman, pero ya es tarde, pues empiezan a pudrirse por dentro, siendo el corazón lo primero que devoran los gusanos”.

CAPÍTULO- 51

Como era muy tarde, Max invitó a Lucía a su casa. Y le dijo: — Ahora si subes despertarás a todos. Es mejor que vengas a mi refugio secreto. Nunca nadie ha estado antes. Has visto que excusa tan buena tengo para llevarte al bosque donde los lobos se comen a las caperucitas azules como tú.

— ¡Qué malo que eres...! ¡Jajajaja...! ¡Sí, me has convencido! — encendieron las linternas y emprendieron el camino de Ejep. Apenas recorrieron medio kilómetro de pista de gravilla, que se internaron por un sendero de pinos y maleza. Hasta que él la detuvo y sobre un tronco ladeado la besó, y le dijo que esperasen hasta habituar los ojos a la oscuridad, pues era preferible continuar iluminados con la luz de la luna. Díez minutos más tarde, tras atravesar una espesa cortina de árboles, de repente apareció una casita de cuento de hadas. Ella no pudo resistir la fascinación que le produjo y exclamó: — ¡Es mágica...! ¡Está envuelta en una nube de luz azul fosforescente!

  Al acercarse, él le explicó que la barraca estaba apoyada sobre una pared de roca en forma de concha, que daba acceso a una gruta donde habitaban miles de coleópteros. Cogidos de la mano, la guio adentrándose en la cueva. Los ojos se fueron adaptando a la oscuridad a medida que la rodobsina estimulaba el nervio óptico. Ambos se detuvieron en el silencio. Entre ellos solo se intuían por la respiración. El nictálope de Max animó a Lucía a que levantase la vista. Entonces, ambos contemplaron fascinados un espectáculo maravilloso: la cúpula del techo de la caverna se había convertido en la inmensa bóveda del cielo, donde un enjambre de millones de estrellas no paraba de parpadear. Él, entre bisbiseos, le explicó: “Lo que estás viendo es una colonia de luciérnagas, la mayoría son larvas y hembras, que no utilizan la bioluminiscencia de reclamo sexual, sino como cebo. El espectro de luz que emiten, cada seis a ocho segundos, va de un débil a un intenso azul y les sirve para atraer en este caso a las presas. Hacen igual que las arañas: tejen redes invisibles y hebras pegajosas que despliegan desde el techo como si fuese un caladero, con las mismas técnicas de los viejos pescadores nocturnos; a continuación, encienden sus linternas biológicas y emiten destellos intermitentes que atrae a los incautos insectos, los cuales se acercan encandilados por el mágico brillo y el titilante reclamo, hasta que caen enredados en la trampa, igual que muchos mortales ante la belleza. Las víctimas atrapadas intentan escapar, se revuelven y la vibración de las terminaciones nerviosas de la tela avisa a las depredadoras de que alguna alelada polilla o mosquito ha vuelto a caer; es el momento en que izan con cuidado las mallas y los aparejos, algunos de palangre, recogen las capturas y se las comen. Por eso, alguien, en un rapto de inspiración poética, las bautizó con el singular nombre de “Las estrellas de la muerte.”

Durante veinte minutos observaron extasiados aquel centelleo hipnótico. Estaban ante un espectáculo único. Lucía, con suma curiosidad, le preguntó en un susurro: — ¿Y cómo sus cuerpos consiguen generar ese resplandor?

La respuesta de Max no se hizo esperar y le musitó al oído: — La bioluminiscencia es un proceso químico de oxidación del sustrato de la proteína denominada luciferina, catalizada por la enzima luciferasa. A ellas se les ilumina el abdomen, y como su piel está recubierta con una especie de lentes conocidas con el nombre de cristales de urato, intensifican y multiplican el reflejo de la luz.

A ella se le ocurrió quitarse la camiseta y dejar al descubierto su espalda, y sobre la piel desnuda empezó a iluminarse el dibujo tatuado del loto azul invisible. Max le recorrió a besos el tallo de la flor hasta llegar a los pétalos detrás de la nuca, mientras sus dedos le masajeaban cada uno de sus siete chacras. La abrazó por detrás y le hizo el amor en silencio. El eco de un profundo gemido de placer recorrió los huecos de roca de la bóveda celeste, e hizo temblar las estrellas de aquel inmenso cielo interior.

Salieron con lentitud de aquel viaje onírico. Max la llevó de la mano hasta su refugio. Entraron a oscuras. Ella se dio cuenta de que el tejado tenía dos amplías ventanas en el techo, de tal manera que la luz de la luna iluminaba el interior de la estancia. Subieron por una escalerilla a un altillo en donde estaba la cama. Agacharon la cabeza para no darse con las vigas de madera y se metieron entre las sábanas. En la penumbra, él pudo vislumbrar por el brillo de sus pupilas el centelleo estelar de la cueva. Se abrazaron y se llenaron la piel de besos y caricias hasta quedarse dormidos el uno en el otro.

A medianoche, ella vio como Max se ladeaba, cogía una libreta y completamente inspirado escribía algo. Estuvo un buen rato alumbrado por el resplandor lunar. Todavía hipnotizada, observó el movimiento de su mano atrapada en la caligrafía. Había sido un día inolvidable y una noche llena de magia y de fantasía.

  Antes de desvanecerse la oscuridad, Lucía se desveló y vio tumbado a los pies el cuaderno en que él había anotado algo. En la portada, de tapa dura, destacaba el título: “Diario del Alma”. De la solapa colgaba la pluma que le regaló. No pudo vencer su vehemente curiosidad y con sigilo se movió para intentar coger el cuaderno sin que se diera cuenta. Debía deslizarse entre las sábanas con lentitud para no despertarle. Tampoco podía demorarse demasiado, porque no debía faltar mucho para que amaneciera. Con cuidado fue alargando el brazo hasta cogerlo con el temor que no se le resbalase de golpe. Cautelosa lo abrió y vio que las páginas estaban en blanco. Enseguida, se dio cuenta de que habían sido escritas con su pluma de tinta invisible. Sacó de su bolso una linternita de luz ultravioleta, que solía utilizar para revisar las palabras ocultas que utilizaba para atrapar los deseos que ella antes anotaba, y leyó de la última hoja, el párrafo final:

  “La visita con ella a la gruta fue perturbadora, pues nunca había estado dentro con alguien. Fue como ir por primera vez. Hacía años que no entraba. A nadie le había revelado aquel lugar secreto. Me ha evocado lejanos recuerdos de la infancia, cuando me escapaba de aventuras por las cuevas de la Virgen de La Peña en Graus. A medida que avanzábamos hacia la oscuridad, esta se hacía más densa, tangible y misteriosa. Nos detuvimos en la enorme bóveda y tuve la sensación de estar en el interior de un útero excavado en las entrañas de la tierra, donde una luminosidad extraña, biológica, emitida principalmente por los cuerpos de miles de luciérnagas hembras, apareadas en época de reproducción y que albergaban en sus entrañas docenas de huevos de nuevas crías, inundaban la atmósfera de una lucífera metamorfosis. Por las paredes del techo del cielo, corría la savia azul de las estrellas, tan embrionaria y emergente que se colaba por las venas pétreas de la caverna hasta hacerla latir en una continua gestación, a la espera de que las miles de vidas que llevaban las rocas dentro, despertasen de su sueño mineral, igual que nosotros.”

PRESENTACIÓN
Mi nombre es Álex de Sande y soy
profesor de un instituto de secundaria. Al fallecer mis padres tuve la
necesidad de hacer el Camino de Santiago para encontrarme a mí mismo. Al llegar
a Finisterre, al Fin del Mundo, fui consciente de que aquel final era un
inicio. Así empecé una búsqueda interior que me llevó a vivir muchas
experiencias espirituales y a regresar inconscientemente a mis orígenes, el
lugar donde nací: un pueblo del Alto Aragón, en la provincia de Huesca,
concretamente Graus. A las afueras de
la población, escondido en El Valle de La Fueva, en medio de unos bosques mágicos
y atemporales descubrí el Monasterio Budista de Dag Shang Kagyü. Allí realicé
diferentes cursos de meditación budista y compartí dichas experiencias con personas
corrientes, que aprovechando las vacaciones realizaban un retiro espiritual
para encontrarse así mismas. Algunas de ellas, tras despertar la conciencia,
iniciaban un proceso de trasformación de sus vidas, una metamorfosis interior y
exterior. 
  Fascinado por la experiencia humana vivida
allí, pude ser testigo de una cautivadora historia de amor que decidí novelar,
en la que los personajes irán redescubriendo un pasado lleno de aventuras por
medio mundo. Y así se suceden las peripecias de un artista ciego que pinta
sueños, monjes que parecen levitar, un cartomántico invidente que ve el futuro,
un tatuador de lotos azules invisibles y un oftalmólogo profesor de yoga que
intenta enseñar a ver con los ojos del corazón. 
El relato destila mucha luz, poesía
y espiritualidad. Sin embargo, en bastantes capítulos la ironía y el humor han
conseguido arrancar carcajadas contagiosas a los amigos que ya la han leído. Eso
me complace, porque sé que la risa lleva a la alegría, y esta a gozar de
instantes de felicidad. 
PROYECTO
  El objetivo de este proyecto es
financiar la publicación de la obra, que consta de 555 páginas DIN A-4, la
página web y la promoción a través de las redes sociales. 
  Me gustaría compartir la mitad de
los beneficios de esta obra con las organizaciones que menciono en la misma y
que siempre me han servido de ejemplo e inspiración: la Fundación Dag Shang
Kagyü, Cáritas España, Stop Ceguera, Creciendo en Nepal y Fundación Vicente
Ferrer.
  Las recompensas irán desde figurar
en los agradecimientos de la página web a aparecer en la propia obra en el
capítulo del “Invernadero de ideas”, donde se anima a jóvenes a iniciarse como emprendedores
y hacer realidad sus sueños buscando financiación en las plataformas de
Crowdfunding. 
INICIO DE LA OBRA:        QUIERO TOMAR REFUGIO EN TU CORAZÓN
Capítulo
- 1  
De repente, ella se despertó con la angustia de
ahogarse en un mar de sueños frustrados. Con la respiración acelerada se dio
cuenta de que estaba hiperventilando. Empezó a aplicar las técnicas de
relajación que había aprendido en las sesiones preparatorias al parto. Apenas había
descansado unas horas por el disgusto de saber que la academia en la que
trabajaba había cerrado sin previo aviso. Llevaba meses sin cobrar, pero tenía
la esperanza de que algo le ingresaran. Esa ansiedad la empujaba a ir al cajero

hundiéndose en la adversidad sin ninguna esperanza.

story:
Short Summary

Hi my name is Dela, a single mother to Narkie. I am student in my final year of a social science degree. I am also a part-time photographer.

I believe in dreams and I have had this dream since 2010. I wasn't sure what to write about until my daughter started kindergarten. In her first week, she told me all about her experience and the fun she had. The story unfolded itself to me and I began to write it based on what she told me.

The best part is that when we at bedtime, I read our story to her, she loves it and wants to add more of her experience to it. It's a picture book telling a story of how a little girl overcame her shyness and had fun on her first day of school.

This is a fun way for kids to learn all about going to kindergarten. It's a book about children for children by a child and her mother!

A n interactive book every child will love

What We Need & What You Get

Money raised through this campaign will allow: 

  • Creating 20 Illustrations/Graphic Design
  • printing and publishing
  • Marketing
  • Distributing

The Impact

It only takes a dream and a belief. You will be impacting little kids life in so many positive ways.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please Help spread the word and share with your family and friends. Thank you!!

You Rock!!

story:
A short, illustrated version of "Reinventing Organizations"

Hello, I’m Frederic and I’m the author of 'Reinventing Organizations', a book that came out last year and has turned into a sort of phenomenon. It’s both a very rigorous and, I believe, very uplifting book that shares in practical terms how we can run organizations in a whole new way. 

Many people seem truly inspired to hear about the emergence of a whole new type of organization, but it’s not everyone’s idea of fun to read a 360-page management book about it! 

One reader suggested I add illustrations to my book and she introduced me to Etienne Appert, a wonderfully gifted illustrator who has become a friend. That’s when the idea emerged not just to add a few illustrations to the existing book... but to create an entirely new one, that bring the ideas to life in a whole new way.  

A 150-page version of the book, in color, with just the right amount of text, lots of white space and powerful illustrations. A book you can read in almost one sitting. I’m very excited about it, because I believe this will allow the ideas of the book to spread to a much wider audience still.


What We Need & What You Get

I’d love your support, financially (every page is laid out individually, and the graphic design to get this all perfect will be expensive) and even more important: emotionally. We’ve just finished a first draft, and now comes the thankless period for me of rewriting and rewriting the text some more. 

Knowing that there is a community of you out there waiting for the book will help me a great deal to get it over the finish line. It will feel like it’s not just my book, but ours! You’ll have helped this book come to life.

By participating, you’ll help finance the cost of the illustrations and the graphic design. You’ll give me extra energy for the final weeks. And… you’ll receive a copy ahead of everyone else, with no shipping costs!

If you have time to invest too, I’d like to receive feedback from a few of you on draft pages of the book. Co-creation to make a really powerful book!



The Impact

You’ll help these ideas spread to even more people, possibly bringing more Teal businesses, nonprofits, schools and hospitals to life! 

Just think about places like schools or hospitals, where few people read traditional management books. Or imagine a CEO that wants to transform her organization: this book can easily be shared with all her colleagues to get the ball rolling. And for just about everyone, it is a book that is easy to recommend to friends and colleagues who long for more meaning and purpose at work.
story_txt:
A short, illustrated version of "Reinventing Organizations" 
Hello, I’m Frederic and I’m the author of 'Reinventing Organizations', a book that came
out last year and has turned into a sort of phenomenon. It’s both a very
rigorous and, I believe, very uplifting book that shares in practical terms how
we can run organizations in a whole new way. 
Many people seem truly inspired to hear about the emergence of
a whole new type of organization, but it’s not everyone’s idea of fun to read a
360-page management book about it! 


One reader suggested I add illustrations to my book and she introduced me to Etienne Appert, a wonderfully gifted illustrator who has become a friend. That’s when the idea emerged not just to add a few illustrations to the existing book... but to create an entirely new one, that bring the ideas to life in a whole new way.  
A 150-page version of the
book, in color, with just the right amount of text, lots of white space and powerful illustrations. A book you can read in almost one sitting. I’m very
excited about it, because I believe this will allow the ideas of the book to
spread to a much wider audience still.



   What We Need & What You Get 
I’d love your support, financially (every page is laid out
individually, and the graphic design to get this all perfect will be expensive)
and even more important: emotionally. We’ve just finished a first draft, and
now comes the thankless period for me of rewriting and rewriting the text some
more. 
Knowing that there is a community of you out there waiting for the book
will help me a great deal to get it over the finish line. It will feel like
it’s not just my book, but ours! You’ll have helped this book come to life. 
By participating, you’ll help finance the cost of the
illustrations and the graphic design. You’ll give me extra energy for the final
weeks. And… you’ll receive a copy ahead of everyone else, with no shipping
costs! 
If you have time to invest too, I’d like to receive feedback from a few of you on draft pages of the book. Co-creation to make a really powerful book!






The Impact
 
You’ll help these ideas spread to even more people, possibly
bringing more Teal businesses, nonprofits, schools and hospitals to life! 
Just think about places like schools or hospitals, where few people read traditional management books. Or imagine a CEO that wants to transform her organization: this book can easily be shared with all her colleagues to get the ball rolling. And for just about everyone, it is a book that is easy to recommend to friends and colleagues who long for more meaning and purpose at work.

story:
Story of My Book

Married To MOM is a memoir with elements of self-help to assist readers recognize hidden red-flags in a relationship with a mother enmeshed covert narcissist.

My name is Michaela Bressel and I am the author of Married To MOM. I was inspired to write a book about realizing the perfect image I held of the husband who I thought was my soulmate was just an illusion -- a masterpiece of silent manipulation. I saw the need to raise awareness of a growing relationship issue that is camouflaged by love and kindness.

My hope is that in reading this book you will be able to identify if you are with a person who simply, loves his or her parent, or if you are with a person who is emotionally enmeshed. With this book I wish for readers to discover the power within to identify and overcome problems in a relationship with a covert narcissist, differentiate between healthy and unhealthy behavior, and find answers that would then allow you to begin an emotionally healthy new chapter in your life.

In this book, you'll learn about the difference between overt versus covert narcissism and recognize the issues of parent enmeshment. You'll find stories such as...
  • Narcissus, son of the river god Cephissus and an introduction to Narcissism
  • The story of a couple that dealt with the effect of having been raised by a narcissistic parent
  • An excerpt of my personal journal written during some of the darkest days of my marriage
  • Red-Flags to look prevent you from falling victim to a covert narcissist and encouraging words for new beginnings
You will love this book if you are currently feeling lost in your relationship because you're having to deal with a parent that interferes with your love life. Married to MOM could be pivotal in discovering whether you're rightfully concerned or just overreacting.

By the time you flip the last page of this book you'll be able to tell whether you have a healthy relationship with your partner or if your relationship has been poisoned by your partner's parental enmeshment.
While the story in my book relates to a rather traditional setting of characters, the issues discussed are definitely relevant to non-heterosexual relationships as well..
 

The Book - Married To MOM

The book is written in three parts.

Part 1 “Lesson Learned” contains the introduction + chapters 1-9.
In this part of the book we will take a closer look at the subject of Narcissism as well as Parent Enmeshment. The information provided will be parallel to some examples as they could be in real life to help you relate on a personal level to this book.

Part 2 “Our Love Story” contains chapters 10-16.
Here you will dive into the story of my relationship and ride the emotional rollercoaster of some very draining times in my life. My story will make clear to you why some seemingly "normal" relationship issues are not so normal after all.

Part 3 “New Beginnings” contains chapter 17.
After having learned about the more technical terms and definitions as well as the damage that parent enmeshed covert narcissist can cause in their partner, the book will in its last chapter provide a clear list of red-flags to look for as well as words of hope and encouragement on finding healing from emotional abuse as well as moving on to a happy and emotionally stable future.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 120 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.
When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.
When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Michaela Bressel is the mother of four young adults whom she raised into very independent individuals with a healthy level of self-esteem, but she’s also been an engineering technician, the owner of a Graphic Design and Print Shop. Michaela has a passion for nutrition and living a healthy active lifestyle. She's moved clear across the country before and has been known to ride her motorcycle all across the U.S.

Michaela loves to do a wide variety of crafts like knitting, wood burning, macramé, and other DIY projects. Many of her crafts can be found in her home or giftwrapped for friends or family. With her ever-growing desire to overcome life’s obstacles she has inspired thousands to become spiritually and emotionally stronger. She teaches by her philosophy of “Live who you will become, and you will become who you want to be.”

Her desire to write a book initially started many years ago with the idea to write about “new beginnings” to help people remove the fear of starting over in life. But then, after a life-changing experience, she chose to address the issue of narcissism. Since she had to personally overcome this issue in her own relationship her desire to help others in similar situations chose her topic for her.

For more information, you can connect with Michaela Bressel at michaela.b.bressel@gmail.com. You can find Michaela’s social media links at InstaBio.cc/michaelabressel
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please fill out the form to get a quote:

Click >>> HERE <<< or on the link below

https://surveyheart.com/form/60777a6d4eb504459288b22d

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your network. Please use #MarriedToMOM and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Michaela Bressel

story:
Story of My Book

Half the Battle is about a young basketball player who suddenly faces the loss of her parents and must learn to navigate her new reality while in the midst of a league championship—an opportunity to continue her mothers legacy and escape from the towns sorrows.

My name is Ashley Alvarez and I am the author of Half the Battle. I wrote this book because as a young athlete, I struggled with mental health and while I had a ton of people helping me optimize my physical health, nobody taught me how to be mentally healthy.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that mental health is just as important as physical health in athletes and that athletes can struggle with the same emotions everyone else does. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn alongside Thora, the protagonist, about the importance of prioritizing our well-being to reach our full potential as athletes and as people.

In this book, Thora Martinez and her family are living in a new reality after the passing of her parents. Now, grieving and amid a league championship, Thora and her family must manage their well-being but constantly face setbacks that challenge their individuality and family.

You will love this book if you are an athlete, former athlete, coach, and mental health advocate.

Half the Battle speaks to young adults and athletes who want to grapple with their mental well-being and grief.

Ultimately, I hope that Half the Battle inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

 

  • How far are athletes willing to go to achieve success? And at what cost?
  • Are there ways we can normalize and prioritize mental health through all athletic departments?
  • What are the long-term consequences of ignoring mental health?

 

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing mental health and grief will change us all for the better.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

 

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

 

And much more!

 

About the Author

A.M Alvarez is a Developmental Editor at Creator Institute. She holds a Bachelor’s Degree in English from Humboldt State University.

She is committed to educating high school and college athletes about mental health through stories. She loves watching horror films on her free time and never sleeps because of it. She currently lives in Southern California.

For more information, you can connect with A. M. Alvarez at ashmonalv@gmail.com and at @a.m.alvarez_author on Instagram.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #halfthebattle and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
A. M. Alvarez

story:
Dish Up Laughter and Hope!
Help Change Lives by Publishing The Devotional with a Bite

"Morning Manna: Wisdom Served with Humor and Heart"

We're seeking $10,000 to publish T. Faye Griffin's book this September. Your generous support will enable us to cover:

  • Printing
  • Promotional and marketing materials
  • Cover design, print layout, e-book formatting, logo
  •  Editing and proofreading
  • Library of Congress, ISBN, barcode fees 
  • Postage, shipping fees and supplies
  • Audio book recording session
  • Website construction and maintenance
  • Travel expenses for first leg of speaking/comedy tour 

What is Morning Manna?

The book contains tasty bites of Biblical wisdom in the form of no-holds barred life lessons that are relevant to the world we live in. Written with boldness and transparency, you'll find some bites to be hot and spicy, some cool and refreshing. Others will be just plain hard to swallow. But each bite provides nourishment for your soul and is served with a little humor and a whole lot of heart. The ultimate goal is to make these life affirming and life altering devotions readily available in print, e-Book, audiobook and Braille editions in order to reach as many people as possible.

Rewards

Look to the right of your screen and check out all of the yummy goodies available as  a token of appreciation for your generosity.  (Please allow 4 to 6 weeks after the end of the campaign for delivery.)

Giving Back

As a supporter you'll be giving in more ways than one. 

A portion of the proceeds from every copy sold will be donated to two outstanding non-profit organizations: UnShakeable Faith - a non-denominational ministry providing meals, clothing and hygiene supplies on the streets of Los Angeles; and Kids in the Spotlight - a volunteer-run organization that teaches children and teens in foster care group homes how to produce write, cast and star in their own short films. 

Risks & Challenges

Our team is working diligently to hit our deadline right on the nose. We all know that the unforeseen can happen, but you can rest assured that we will move heaven and earth to make certain that you receive the promised 'Thank You' gifts.  As a supporter you will always be keep informed of our progress. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • SHARE - Please share this campaign with at least 3 people. 
  • INVITE - If you'd like me speak or perform at your next event, reach out.
  • PRAY -  Ask God for His will to be done with this project.

Only family, friends and a few business associates jumped in to support  Omar's first self published book, Flyy Girl, which became a bestseller and becomes a movie in 2016 (See below!) Now you have a chance to be part of launching All Access to even greater success! From posters, autographed books to meeting Omar in person, these are the perks you can gain! 

                                                                          

<<---------- About All Access   -----------        

                                    “When our real lives become the biggest act...”

                                                       A thriller by Omar Tyree

A broadcast journalist gets pulled into the private  and criminal world of a popular entertainer.

        

When Judy Pierce, a veteran broadcast news anchor in the budding entertainment center of Atlanta, decides to join a celebrity gossip web site in addition to her cable network job, she lands a major interview with volatile superstar, Shawn Blake, and the embattled entertainer invites her into a reckless and unfiltered world that changes her life and career for the worst.

Rumored of having gang and drug affiliations, domestic violence issues, multiple child support cases and several murder charges, all while being viewed as Hollywood’s next Denzel Washington, Shawn Blake is all that he’s rumored to be—a real bad ass. However, his multiple charges have never stuck in court.

But when Judy gets too involved in his “all access” invitations, the fall-out of rumors and social media assaults begin to unravel her own household, family and job security. With a six-figure income, a dedicated husband, a solid reputation, and two children in grade school, Judy has far too much at stake to lose.

Nevertheless, once she enters Shawn’s volatile world of real crime, desperate associations and public slander, she finds herself wishing she had never met the man, while fighting to regain her sanity and protect her life and family, who find themselves in imminent danger when she’s called to testify against the star in court.

story:
Short Summary

Northern Diocese (ND) is one of the 22 dioceses of the entire Evangelical Lutheran Churches in Tanzania (ELCT). It is located in the North East of Tanzania in the slopes of mountain Kilimanjaro. The area is mountainous ranging between 900 metres and 1895 meters above the sea level.

Apart from the major purpose of establishing ND which was to proclaim the good news of salvation by grace, rooted in faith in Jesus Christ, NDenvision a Christ Centred Society that is joyful, peaceful and holistically empowered.

The mission of ND is to make people know, believe Jesus Christ and have life in its fullness by bringing to them the Good News through words and deeds based on the word of God as it is in the Bible and the teaching of the ELCT. That means to build a strong community through teaching, advocacy and provision of social economic services with integrity and love toward sustainable integral development.

Inspite of that mission a study carried out by the women department in 2009-2011 indicated that gender balance is the big problem because of cultural and taboos. Women's knowledge/understanding on gender issues is very limited. Thus why they  contribute 90% of home affairs (like food contribution, cooking, fetching water, cleanliness, caring of children, nursing and the like). This is heavy burden need to be addressed.

To address this problem, seminars on gender equality will be helpful. Though that seminar strong women groups that can support each other will be established, and later on participation of men and women in an advocating for rights of women will be issued


What We Need & What You Get

  1. Travelling cost for 3000 @8000(Tanzanian money) to and from (2,400,000 Tanzanian money/Shillings). Women will cover this amount.

  2. Accommodation for 3000@ 10,000 for one day (3,000,000 Tanzanian money/Shillings). Women’s department in Northern diocese will contribute.

  3. Meal per 2 days for 3000@30,000 and stationeries (9,500,000 Tanzanian money/shillings). This amount is equivalent to 6000USD.

    We kindle ask assistance to number 3 above.

The Impact

Desired outcome

Women to know their rights and to bring changes in the society.

Confidence among women

To get number of women who will be able make decision on various issues, particularly on their own lives.

Since women are responsible 90% in rearing children, the seminar will bring awareness on their rights as well as how to teach their children the issues of the gender balance

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

by Todd Kincannon

It's no secret that I'm presently writing "Useless Idiots: The Proper Care and Feeding of Liberals." I've gotten a number of requests to place further pre-orders after the initial round of pre-orders. Use this to pre-order an e-book for $15, an inscribed paperback for $20, or two inscribed paperbacks and an autographed Noodle picture for $40.

The book will be a comprehensive guide for fighting the Left designed for conservative activists at all levels. If you care about defeating liberals and taking our country back, pre-order this book and use it to fight the bad guys during the 2014 elections and beyond. I promise it'll be worth every penny.
