story:
Introductie:

Sterrenkijker is het relaas van het leven van een doorsnee gezin in het achterland van Rotterdam. Door de ogen van Lizzy zien we hoe de familieleden omgaan met de niet altijd alledaagse keuzes die Lizzy stilaan in haar leven maakt. Het beschrijft een bij tijd en wijle eenzame zoektocht waarin kleur bekennen onvermijdelijk leidend wordt.
Sterrenkijker is een autobiografische vertelling van Elizabeth van Driel (Brielle, 1963). Een sterrenkijker is een boreling die met het gezichtje hemelwaarts gericht ter wereld komt, de blik reikend naar wat achter de horizon ligt. 
Als Lizzy opgroeit en volwassen wordt, bepalen onverwachte ontmoetingen en onvoorspelbare wendingen keer op keer haar bestaan. Daarbij wordt zij gedreven door een nieuwsgierigheid die haar in uitzonderlijke situaties van buitenstaander tot betrokkene maakt. 
Sterrenkijker is het relaas van oneindige liefde in een gedreven bestaan. Een pleidooi om je hart te volgen en te geloven, dat opgeven geen optie is.

Mijn naam is Elizabeth van Driel, moeder van twee prachtige kinderen en werkzaam als logopedist en taalspecialist ( doelgroep: kinderen met een taalontwikkelingsstoornis en auditief beperkte kinderen. 

In 2014 vroeg mijn zoon me eens op te schrijven hoe hij ter wereld was gekomen. De gedachte dit verhaal aan het papier toe te vertrouwen lonkte en ik begon te schrijven. Zijn verhaal bleek niet in twee woorden te vangen. In de loop van de jaren kreeg het meer en meer vorm. Ik liet het aan verschillende mensen lezen. Er werd herhaaldelijk geopperd het uit te geven als boek.  Er was geen weg meer terug en nu vijf jaar later is de tijd rijp het met de wereld te delen.

Het blijkt, nu het af is, meer dan ons persoonlijke verhaal. Het werd een pleidooi je hart te volgen, kleur te bekennen en niet terug te deinzen op momenten dat weerstand van je omgeving je doet wankelen. Zwem tegen de stroom in, zo hard als je kunt en blijf streven naar het verwezenlijken van je dromen. 

Een boek schrijven, vormgeven en uitgeven is erg duur. Daar kwam ik al snel achter. Moest ik dan toch maar op zoek naar een uitgever? Hoeveel ruimte zou mij gegund zijn, mijn verhaal mijn verhaal te laten? Het manuscript lag een paar maanden op de plank en dat voelde niet ok. De gedachte dat het daar zou kunnen blijven liggen, als ik passief bleef toekijken, bracht me ertoe door te pakken. Het boek moest er links- of rechtsom komen. Aan jullie de vraag  mij te helpen dit voor elkaar te krijgen en weet dat ik alles in het werk zal stellen mijn dankbaarheid op gepaste wijze te tonen.

What We Need & What You Get:

Mijn doel is 3000 euro bij elkaar te sprokkelen om 1000 boeken te laten drukken. Voor dat geld heb ik 1000 softcover boeken. De kosten voor redigeren, opmaak en covervormgeving zijn hierbij niet inbegrepen, maar we komen er vast wel :-) 

Voor wat hoort wat, dus ik heb een aantal unieke perks aangemaakt om jullie te bedanken voor elke bijdrage; groot of klein. Wat ik ook  heel tof zou vinden, is als jullie  zoveel mogelijk mensen wijzen op deze crowdfunding. Indiegogo heeft "sharetools"die het delen met familie, vrienden en andere bekenden heel simpel maken. Dus kan je financieel niet bijdragen, geen probleem: je kunt vast goed rondbazuinen, lawaaien, propageren, rumours verspreiden, stampij maken, opschudding veroorzaken, stennis schoppen. Doe het subtiel maar met overtuiging!

De campagne loopt een maand. Alle bij de donaties behorende bedankjes komen zo snel mogelijk jullie kant op. En.....

.... komen jullie allemaal naar de boeklancering? Laat je e- mailadres/ telefoonnummer achter als je bij de boekpresentatie aanwezig wilt zijn. Ik breng je dan op de hoogte van datum en locatie. Volg ook het laatste nieuws over "Sterrenkijker" op fb:https://www.facebook.com/Sterrenkijker-41227137...

 

 

*** Heb je geen creditcard, no worries, je kunt je bijdrage ook overmaken op het volgende bankrekeningnummer: 

NL69ABNA0832447013 t.n.v. N.E. van Driel o.v.v. Sterrenkijker

story:
Story of My Book


It’s Not Right-Left. It’s Top-Down. The Truth About The Media is a book about the mainstream news media in the United States and how its structure of corporate ownership prevents them from being the objective, reputable news sources they claim to be. The book illustrates the problems with this system and how we can fix our news media by making them beholden to us and not just their corporate owners. 

My name is Owen Mageau, and I am the author of It’s Not Right-Left. It’s Top-Down. I wrote this book with hopes that it would help wake people up to the con game being played by the corporately owned mainstream media, as well as the devastating effects this has on our country. Americans are very good at discrediting news as ‘fake news’ if it comes from the other team, while blindly trusting the sources they believe to be on their side. For example, democrats lament Fox News, whereas they are cheerleaders for the hosts at MSNBC. Republicans, on the other hand, hate MSNBC and put their faith in Fox News being honest in their reporting. 

This is a serious problem, because the reality is that all of the corporately owned media outlets in our country are not providing an objective, wholesome version of what is going on in our country and around the world. This leads to a polarized public that is constantly fighting amongst each other, based on distorted views of the truth. All the while, it distracts the American people from the real root of their problems: the corporate elite of this country who own the media and shape our country’s politics to benefit them at the expense of the masses.  

It is my hope that this book educates people on this issue and helps them understand, not only that they are right to question the media’s objectivity, but why the media behaves the way it does. I also shed light on how we can fix this problem and create a media that is beholden to us, the American people, and not just a select few corporate interests. 

In this book, you’ll learn about the mainstream media outlets in our country and their respective ownership chains. You will also learn about how and why this leads to certain perspectives being overly prevalent in the mainstream media, while others are essentially completely shut out of the news. Finally, you will learn how grass roots-funded independent journalism is our ticket out of our current problems, and where you can find this type of objective reporting today. 

Throughout the many stories in this book, you will learn how well journalists in the mainstream media are treated and how they have every incentive to do what they are told, rather than report objectively. One story details how mainstream journalists fly first class and have their luggage driven across the country for them. Another story details how journalists sometimes deliberately turn away from the truth, in order to report what their bosses want and move up the ranks. 

The book also includes stories about independent media outlets that are trying to compete with the corrupt mainstream media. 

You will love this book if you’re someone who is interested in the news media, politics, and/or power in America. This book is interesting and relevant to everyone because of the real effects the media has on your life.

It’s Not Right-Left. It’s Top-Down. is a nonfiction book that speaks to all Americans who have ever wondered if they are actually getting an objective, wholesome version of the story from the mainstream news media in the United States.  

 

The Book - It’s Not Right-Left. It’s Top-Down. The Truth About The Media.


The book has an introduction, conclusion, and four parts sandwiched in between. 

The Introduction simply introduces the topic and what the book will be about.

Part 1 consists of Chapter 1 and is titled “A Free Press.” This part outlines how we do in fact have a press that is free from government influence, and how the freedom of the press is guaranteed in the first amendment of the constitution. However, it sets up the framework for the idea that just because a press is free from the government, doesn't necessarily mean it is a free and objective press that serves the people’s best interests. 

Part 2 is titled “Corporate Ownership” and consists of chapters 2-5. This part details the origins of the mainstream media, as well as the many mergers and other corporate actions that have led to where we are today. It clearly shows how these outlets are not independent, rather they are small parts of much bigger conglomerates. 

Part 3 consists of chapters 6-8 and is really the meat of the book. This section talks about the effects the structure of corporate ownership has on our news and country. There is a chapter on how it impacts what is and isn’t reported, there is a chapter on the filtration system that is in place to shut out certain perspectives, and there is a chapter on the political effects this structure has on our country. This is a very interesting and important section that is driven by many stories of people who have worked at the mainstream media outlets in the United States. 

Part 4 talks about how we can fix the problems facing our news media today. This section consists of chapters 9 and 10. In these chapters, I make the case for transitioning from corporately owned media to smaller, grass roots funded, independent media outlets. In addition to making this case, I shed light on some of the alternatives to mainstream media that are already out there, and that you can turn to for truly objective and honest reporting. 

Then finally, there is my conclusion, where I sum up the essence of the book. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author


Owen Mageau studied political science and journalism at the University of Minnesota. He is currently working as a tutor, with intents to become a teacher in the near future. Mageau has published writing before as a sports reporter for The Minnesota Daily, a contributing writer for University Of Minnesota Athletics, and as a writer for the University of Minnesota College of Pharmacy.  He hopes to build on his young writing career as well, with It’s Not Right-Left. It’s Top-Down. The Truth About The Media., being the first of many books he writes promoting positive change in the United States.  

Mageau grew up in Duluth, Minnesota, right next to Lake Superior, where he developed a passion for the outdoors. He loves being on the water, fishing, and going for hikes through the woods. In addition to his passion for the outdoors, Mageau is a sports enthusiast, having grown up playing both hockey and football. He’s a diehard Minnesota sports fan, so the current state of the mainstream news media in the United States isn’t the only thing that disappoints him regularly. 

For more information, you can connect with Owen Mageau at owenmageau@gmail.com, on linkedin at linkedin.com/in/owen-mageau-01a5b7154, and twitter at @OMage11. 
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ItsNotRightLeftItsTopDown and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Owen Mageau

story:
Story of My Book

Of Thrones and Thieves is the story of a lost, unsure princess named Elara who goes on a journey both externally and internally to find herself and discover who she is. As she is stolen from everything that she knows, she is forced to overcome her own anxiety and learn to become the queen she was meant to be against all odds.

My name is Jaelynn Hart, and I am the author of Of Thrones and Thieves. I wrote this book because, as a lesbian woman, I don’t often see myself reflected in the heroes of most stories. For example, in Percy Jackson, Harry Potter, and The Hunger Games, there are these fantastical stories of heroes and heroines—and none of them look like me. Percy falls for Annabeth, Harry has Ginny, and Katniss finds Peeta. I made this novel so that, just once, I could be the hero, because I believe representation is important. If I had picked up Harry Potter at eleven years old and Hermione had fallen in love with Luna Lovegood instead of Ron Weasley, I wouldn’t have struggled the way I did with my own identity. So my stories are for the young girls that need to see a hero that looks like them—you’re just as extraordinary as anybody else.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will find yourself between the pages. This is a story about discovering who you are and learning to love yourself along the way. I want you to see Of Thrones and Thieves as an opportunity to escape from a world of prejudice and learn alongside Elara — to find yourself and realize that it doesn’t matter who you love or what you look like. We’re all capable of being the hero in our own stories.

You’ll follow Princess Elara of Metanoia as she is kidnapped on the day of her coronation. Unsure if she is even fit to take over her mother’s place as Queen, Princess Elara finds herself completely in over her head with her new situation as pandemonium breaks out over her castle. She is whisked away from her home and everything she knows, taken aboard a ship of pirates hired to kidnap her by a mysterious third party whose identity is kept a secret. Princess Elara is unwilling to admit defeat, however, and will do whatever she can to escape her captors, even if it means battling the pirate captain, Kai, herself. As tensions rise, Elara finds herself drawn to the sudden, surprising freedom she’s been granted as a prisoner.

You will love this book if you love enemies-to-lovers stories, enjoy fantasy fiction about pirates, or want to see strong heroines conquer their stories. Of Thrones and Thieves speaks to the LGBT+ community and women who want to grapple with strong heroines and lesbian romances in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that this novel inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

Why do so many LGBT+ fiction books focus on coming out, rather than on us as people?

How does familial pressure affect your ability to believe in yourself and your position?

Is it easier to find yourself when you’re surrounded by people similar to you?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing topics such as finding your identity and learning to trust yourself will change us all for the better.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.


When I pre-sell 120 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Jaelynn Hart is a senior attending her final semester at Florida State University. She is majoring in Creative Writing and will be graduating with her Bachelor of Arts in spring 2021.

In writing this book, Hart hopes to reach out to the LGBT+ community, particularly the lesbian and bisexual community. She wants her book to allow young adults a glimpse into this world she’s created; she hopes that it will reach someone and show them that it’s okay to not know who you are just yet. Hart’s passion includes providing representation to those who need to see that they can be the hero of their story.

When she’s not writing, Hart enjoys making art in other ways; her personal favorite is painting. She also enjoys playing with her two cats, Roxie and Mason, and her dog, Patch. Hart and her fiancée enjoy cooking and traveling to new places together.

For more information, you can connect with Jaelynn Hart at jaefhart@gmail.com and at @jaehartwrites on Instagram.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #ofthronesandthieves and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jaelynn Hart

story:
Hi, my name is Anne Gwaza, I am a writer, a public speaker, and an avid reader myself. 

I am here to raise funds to help publish my first book: Cloudjumper. Cloujumper is a gift I received on an otherwise dull autumn day. Though fall is one of my favourite season with its vibrant colours, it also heralds the coming of winter, with its grey, cloudy days and depressing lack of sunshine.. When the story first came to me, it made me smile and got me excited about a season I normally only try to survive. 

My desire is to share the joy and hope it gave me with as many people as possible and your contribution will make all the difference!

I need CAD$5,000 to self-publish Cloudjumper and start getting the word out. The book has already been beautifully illustrated by a talented young woman and it is awaiting funding to go straight to press.

Should the campaign raise more than the goal, the money left over would be used for making an animatic of the book, and  to finish and publish a French version (the story has already been translated and the French version is being edited as I write this ).

Many people suffer with Seasonal Affective Disorder (S A D), and my hope is that Cloudjumper will be a tool to start discussions and bring hope and comfort to many around the world.

 

We need you to make this hope a reality so may I invite you to check out the great perks we offer to our backers? I trust that you will find them rewarding. Thank you so much for checking out my campaign and may I ask that even if you don’t feel that you can contribute financially at this point, you will be kind enough to spread the word among your friends and acquaintances on social media.

Once more, thank you for your time!

story:
They made her a monster, so she became their worst nightmare.

Cora Ravenell has survived the loss of her family, her home, her name, even her freedom. Her enemies have tried to strip away everything she cares about, but she's not giving up.

Set against the backdrop of an oppressive Empire, the Lady Raven series is a rich coming-of-age fantasy, where the damsel in distress must become the hero of her own story. Swashbuckling adventure and flying pirate ships meet ancient magic and dark secrets.

It all begins in Lady Raven, the story of a young noblewoman forced to become a pirate and an outlaw after her mother is accused of treason. Cora Ravenell seeks out allies and forbidden magic, while her former fiancee is conscripted to lead the hunt against her.

In Red Skies, Cora leads her pirate crew to join the growing Rebellion against the Empire, and must master her new powers before they consume her, while somehow helping to turn a scattered band of insurgents into an army.

In Blackened Wings, the Empire shows its might and exacts merciless revenge upon the Rebellion. Cora and her crew must embark on a desperate mission to find the last masters of the ancient magical arts, and discover a way to stop the Emperor's latest devastating weapon.

And now, in The White Raven, when all seems lost, Cora must fight harder than she ever has before. The Rebels are scattered. The Emperor is on the verge of victory. Cora is alone, and all but broken. Will she succumb to her ordeal, or find the strength to rise again and take flight one last time?

***

About:

The White Raven will be my seventh published novel. I have already released an urban fantasy trilogy, The Memory Wars, with WiDo Publishing, and I ventured into self-publishing with Lady Raven in 2014. In 2015, I released the sequel, Red Skies, and Blackened Wings came the following year. 

On my website, the first thing visitors will see under my name is the phrase "Stories to show that monsters can be beaten." This is the core foundation of all my work. I believe stories, particularly adventure stories, are important for showing us that we can be better people. When we read an adventure story, we stop thinking and start feeling. We get swept up in the excitement and emotion, forgetting about the ordinary world. In essence, we join the hero on their journey through the world fantastic. When we return, as does the hero, we bring with us what we've learned. We can take lessons from stories and apply them to our own lives.

With the Lady Raven series, I explore themes of religion and myth, and how they can be used both to oppress and to educate. The Empire Cora has grown up in is fiercely patriarchal, and treats women as little better than property. It also subjugates other nations, assured of its divine right to rule over "lesser" peoples. 

During this campaign I'll be posting updates with excerpts from the first three books in the series, as well as tidbits from the new book. The cover art above was all made by me, and while I'm proud of them, I know they make the books stand out as self-published. I want to give the series every chance it deserves, and that means accepting my own creative limitations. I have a great artist lined up, and I'm confident the new covers will blow everyone away.

What I'm asking for is your help to bring Cora's story to as many readers as possible. I've learned a lot from her over the last few years, facing my own monsters and learing my own hidden strengths. 

And for those of you who've been with me all the way, or who just prefer the original covers, don't worry. I'll be including pledge levels that let you get the complete matching set.

Monsters can be beaten

I've opted for the flexible funding option, which means that even if I don't hit my target, your contribution will still go towards the release of The White Raven and the re-launch of the series. The White Raven is currently under revisions before going to my editor, and I'm aiming for a release in July. With your help, I can bring this saga to a fitting close.

"Heroes know that things must happen when it is time for them to happen. A quest may not simply be abandoned; unicorns may go unrescued for a long time, but not forever. A happy ending cannot come in the middle of the story." - Prince Lir, The Last Unicorn

story:
Story of My Book

Mallory McClarin is one of those high-schoolers who appears to have it all together. She gets good grades, plays two sports, and has tons of friends. But she has a secret: she’s gay, and she’s done a pretty good job of hiding it for the past few years. That is, until she discovers Lacy Randolph—the most openly-gay-and-proud-of-it girl at Orange County High School.

Mallory refuses to let this one slip, and after many attempts to pursue her, everything seems to follow Mallory’s appearance of “perfect” when she eventually wins Lacy over. Mallory comes out of the closet to be with the girl of her dreams and is bombarded with support, and everything seems way too perfect to be true. As Mallory soon discovers—that’s because it is. 

My name is Michelle Lori, and I am the author of the LGBT YA novel The Head and The Heart. I wrote this book because I wanted to contribute a voice and a story to the often underrepresented or misrepresented narrative of relationship abuse in the LGBT community, specifically LGBT youth. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that relationship abuse and dating violence can happen between any two people, at any age, and that identifying it, breaking free from it, and recovering from it is a daunting task. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to see a reflection of yourself—no matter who you are—and grapple with ideas of love, loss, toxicity, and hope. 

You will love this book if you are interested in the human condition, if you wish to learn more about the topic of relationship abuse, or even if you simply love an intriguing story.

The Head and The Heart speaks to members of the young LGBT community who want to see themselves included in the conversation of what a healthy relationship looks like. Even beyond that, the book speaks to friends, parents, teachers, and supporters of LGBT youth—those who want to better understand the struggles and the intricacies of relationship abuse across a wide range of individuals. Abuse is an issue that concerns all of humanity; therefore, this book can speak to anyone who picks it up. 

Ultimately, I hope that The Head and The Heart inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • Have I been or am I currently involved in an unhealthy relationship? 
  • How is my relationship with my partner affecting my life outside of the relationship? 
  • Does society’s view of a “good” relationship reflect a healthy one? 

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing the distinction between relationship abuse and love, especially among the younger community, will change us all for the better. 

 

The Book - The Head and The Heart

The book is written in 4 parts.

Part 1: Everything Looks Different in Darkness contains the author’s note + chapters 1-11. In this section, readers will be introduced to Mallory McClarin, and they will set off alongside her in her pursuit of her crush, Lacy Randolph. They will watch the growth of Mallory’s infatuation for Lacy, and eventually they will see this relationship come to fruition and bring a plethora of problems with it.

Part 2: Let It Rain contains chapters 12-23. In this section, readers will follow Mallory as she dives deeper into the danger that comes with Lacy Randolph as the tension in their relationship grows. 

Part 3: All Lost, Quite Lost contains chapters 24-34. In this section, readers will witness the fallout and consequences of Mallory and Lacy’s relationship.  

Part 4: The Thing About Hope contains chapters 35-38. In this section, readers will learn just how much Mallory has suffered because of Lacy’s presence in her life. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April of 2021
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Michelle Lori is currently a student at Malone University in Canton, Ohio, where she is pursuing a degree in English, with a minor in Creative Writing. She will graduate in the Fall of 2021, after which she tentatively plans on pursuing a masters degree in Counseling. 

Michelle Lori is deeply fascinated by human connection and is passionate about advocating for the education of healthy relationships. She hopes to shed light on the importance of understanding dating violence and relationship abuse and how we can work together to make our world a safer place to love. 

Michelle Lori is a music lover and plays many different instruments herself (guitar, bass, ukulele, piano, and drums). She also enjoys spending time with her friends and family (whom she loves more than anything in the entire world), eating Ben & Jerry’s, and watching documentaries. 

For more information, you can connect with Michelle Lori at irolellehcim@gmail.com , on Twitter @irolellehcim , on Instagram @irolellehcim_ , or on her website www.michellelori.weebly.com. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

The cost of shipping in the United States is included in the cost of your purchases. Note that international shipping is an additional cost that will be added at check-out.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheHeadandTheHeart and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Michelle Lori

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Brittany and I'm the creator of the Sobriety and Soul Project. Soon after I decided to stop drinking, I bounced all over the internet and went to a meditation retreat trying to figure out how to navigate being sober in a drinking society. What I found is that I didn't align with services on the addiction/treatment side of the spectrum, but I also knew that I had not been living a healthy, non-attached relationship with alcohol.

Over the past couple of years, I've discovered that I'm not alone in this. There are many of us living in the "gray area" on the spectrum of relationship with alcohol. 

This campaign is important to me because I believe that community and resources for those of us wanting to change our relationship with alcohol, but not needing treatment, are minimal. With your help, I can change that.

Your contribution will help me add a depth of story to a book that I've been working on in my journey. I want to create a podcast, in which I will interview others who have also navigated sobriety. I have multiple contributors who are stoked to talk about sharing their story, for the sake of reaching others and helping them with their path toward sobriety. Interviews from the podcast will be made available to the public and will be used to add more dimension to my book.

No matter where you are with your thoughts, feelings and habits around alcohol, you can make a difference for those who need support. Not everyone is appropriate for AA or treatment, but because of how embeded alcohol is in our professional and personal lives, sometimes not drinking can be more of a challenge than it needs to be.

Leaving alcohol out of the equation has worked absolute wonders in my life. I am more present, more available to my business and family, and able to process the ups and downs of life in a more meaningful way. This world is in desperate need of more of us who are present, aware, and available. We are in a time where living your best life, driven by the soul, could change the world for the better. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I am looking to raise at least $3,000.
    • $1700 for equipment necessary for the podcast.
    • $300 to start a website
    • $1,000 for editing fees
  • If I don't reach the goal, the funds will be put toward the equipment I need to start the podcast.
  • See the perks list for more info on what you get in return!

The Impact

Your contribution will make a difference in so many ways:

  • The more people I can connect with, the more people we will be able to reach and help along the way.
  • Anyone can listen to a podcast in the privacy of their own home. We can reach those who are considering getting sober, and just not sure how to make it happen.

Risks & Challenges

As with any project, this is an adventure. For me personally and professionally, this is the first time I've ever worked on a project and am approaching it with a great deal of openness to where it will go. The only set goal is to be a contribution the lives of others who desire to change their habits around alcohol. So, the risks involved are:

  • I don't know all of the answers right now. This project will truly be lead by the people involved. I am generally a planner and I like to have a solid outline of my goal, but with this, I'm setting out to answer questions I've had about alcohol in our culture AND to contribute to others in the same situation.
  • At worst, my book could be a total flop and nobody would listen to the podcast.
  • At best, we could collectively create an entire shift in our culture where alcohol consumption isn't an assumed path for all of us and we could expand the discussion around the spectrum of alcohol use.
  • I am a writer and have been since my high school days, but podcasting is new to me. My intent is to approach all interviews with curiosity, humor, and shared-intention of answering the questions we all have when we decide to rid ourselves of habits that get in the way of our best life.

Other Ways You Can Help

Every dollar helps, but if you cannot contribute financially, there are other ways you can make an impact:

  • Share, Share, SHARE!! I have 30 days to raise funds and get this project going. The more often you share, the more likely I am to meet my goal. Share on Facebook, via email, text, etc. Indiegogo even has "share" tools to help this project get off the ground. Please use them as often as you can between now and July 1, 2018.
  • Connect me with others who could contribute to the project. Do you know someone with a fantastic story of living a sober life? Perhaps you know someone who edits videos and podcasts, takes photos, etc? Anyone you can connect me to that will help grow the project makes a huge difference. I don't have a project without funding, but more importantly, I don't have a project without the right people.
    • Email me at sobrietyandsoul@gmail.com to connect me with your people!

story:
A Horse-Riding Expedition across Central Asia

(Jamie with the horses out in Western Mongolia: October 2012) 

It was nearly a century ago that the Anglo-Irish explorer Sir Charles Howard-Bury first stepped out of his door, determined to explore the remote unknown of Kazakhstan’s Tien Shan Mountains, the 'Mountains of Heaven'. At the time of 1913 tensions in pre-war Europe were on the rise, Central Asia was still in the midst of the Great Game between Britain and Russia, and China, having recently deposed the Manchu emperors, was in a state of anarchy. However Howard-Bury loved nothing but to revel in the challenge of the inaccessible, and he set out unsupported to explore and photograph the most remote mountain valleys in little-known lands right in the heart of Central Asia.

To celebrate the life of this great explorer - who was later to lead the first expedition attempting to conquer Mount Everest in 1921 – we (Jamie Maddison and Matthew Traver) wish to recreate Howard-Bury's exact journey to the Mountains of Heaven in the same manner he travelled by in 1913, starting next May on the centenary of his departure. Our six-month expedition will involve thousands of miles of travel by trains, barges and also 1700km of horse-riding across the remote steppes of Kazakhstan. Where travelling in the same manner as Howard-Bury is impossible due to changes over time, we have committed to undertaking a human-powered alternative. For instance, we will bicycle 3000km through Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan and Turkmenistan. At no point will we use a car, bus or other means of personal mechanised transport.

 We thought of this project nearly three years ago now - when Jamie was stuck on a long, rickety truck journey back from Kyrgyzstan's section of the Tien Shan Mountains – and it has dominated the lives of both of us ever since. We've put hundreds of hours of work into researching this route and organising the very complex logistics needed to get us through over twenty countries. We even recently embarked on a six week expedition to Western Mongolia to meet and ride with the Kazkah horse-rider Alpamys, who will be accompanying us for the riding section of our trip. Everything is in place; all we need now is the funding to make the expedition possible!

We hope you will consider supporting our expedition to help honour the impressive life of Howard-Bury and the great heritage of exploration he represents.

(Matt with his horse Larry)

 Our objectives are:

  • To recreate Charles Howard-Bury’s inspiring journey around Central Asia and the Eurasian Continent, in the same manner that he travelled by, exactly one century on from when he first left.
  • To turn the game hunting aspect of Charles’ original journey on its head by making a focus of our expedition the exploration of the Tien Shan mountains for evidence of the rare argali sheep he once hunted. We want to raiseawareness about these majestic wild sheep, and hope our expedition will encourage public dialogue on how we can all help conserve such beautiful animals.
  • To document along the way the vast cultural, economic and environmental change that has transformed Central Asia over the course of the last century.

(A cold night in the Mongolian steppe, under the most brilliantly star-lit sky) 

Who we are:

Jamie Maddison, 24. Jamie is a writer, photographer and all round aspirant-explorer. He cut his teeth in the big wild world of journalism working for the British rock-climbing magazine Climber. He now works as a joint-editor of the adventure travel publication www.sidetracked.co.uk and is a founding member of The Adventure Fund, a grant programme aimed at encouraging people to get out and undertake an adventure, in whatever form that may take for them. He has written for the likes of Geographical Magazine and Hidden Europe and hopes to continue pursuing a career in expeditioning for as far as it can take him.

Web: www.faecbook.com/ExpeditionReporting Twitter: @Bunchuk

Matthew Traver, 26.  Matt is originally from Hong Kong and is a British and American national currently based in the United Kingdom. He is founder and managing director of Beast Products Ltd., a caving and outdoor equipment manufacturer established in 2007. He has organised, participated in and lead a number of expeditions around the world such as Greenland, Kyrgyzstan, Mongolia and Malaysia. He is most interested in seeking out under-explored and lesser-known destinations around the world.

Web: www.matthewtraver.com Twitter: @matthewtraver

Sir Charles Howard-Bury: Lieutenant-Colonel Charles Kenneth Howard-Bury (15 August 1881 - 20 September 1963) was originally a British soldier, who later became a noted explorer, botanist, philanthropist and Conservative politician. He is most well-known for leading the first reconnaissance expedition to Mount Everest in 1921. However, he also completed a number of trips within the Eurasian continent during the early 20th Century, his most notable being his journey through the Tien Shan mountains in 1913.

 

How the money will be used:

Over the course of the past few years we have launched several successful expeditions to various regions across the world, including Malaysia, Kyrgyzstan, Armenia, Greenland and Mongolia. However One Steppe Ahead is by far the most vast and complex journey we have both ever attempted to undertake. We have calculated that to recreate Howard-Bury's entire journey in the exact manner he undertook it will require at least £20,000 in funding. This cost is mainly due to the great expense of buying well-looked after and well-treated horses in Kazakhstan, but also encompasses other heavy expenditure such as the nine different visas we'll need to secure for the countries en route, and also the cost of taking trains for over 10,000km!

We've already pooled our entire life's savings into the project because we believe that Howard-Bury's journey is a story worth the retelling. We want to highlight and make known the man's spirit of just going out and having an adventure (aiming to give presentations to schools on the subject upon our return) and hence our total commitment to making sure the expedition goes ahead. Through struggling and scraping we can get a basic expedition off the ground, but to truly tell this inspiring story of quirky adventurism fully we really need help.

 All the money pledged will go straight into the expedition to help pay for its various costs, most specifically, the buying and well-maintaining our horses for the two-month journey across the rolling Kazakh steppe. If, on the remarkable chance, that we manage to secure well and truly above the funding needed to make this expedition run in its fullest form, then we will donate the excess proceeds to The Adventure Fund (www.theadventurefund.com), a grant system we both helped set up aimed at encouraging people to get out and undertake an adventure, in whatever form that may take for them.

 

(The empty steppe) 

What we are offering:

A large part of One Steppe Ahead is about promoting and encouraging discussions on adventures, and inspiring supporters with exciting tales from the steppe. What we are offering pledgees runs in line with this ethos of sharing our expedition as widely as possible; with perks ranging from thank-you emails from us on the road, to pictures of the meal your contribution bought, to gifts we've sourced from our time in Central Asia, onto hour-length presentations to be given at your place of work, school or even at home.

We hope you like these perks, and our expedition, and we hope you will consider helping us once again tell the story of a great explorer and the laudable spirit of quiet adventurism he embodied.

If you have any questions or queries, please do not hesitate to get in touch by emailing jamie@sidetracked.co.uk or matthewtraver@gmail.com. Or why not visit our website www.onesteppeahead.com? Thank you!

story:
"Passionate Wholeness" Book Campaign:

My name is Greta Bro. For those of you who do not know me, I am a seeker, a teacher, a shaman and sound healer, poet, singer-songwriter and writer. Over the past thirty years I have acted as a kind of spiritual midwife for hundreds of people who have looked to me to help them break free from familial and cultural dysfunction, collective madness really, and begin to build an authentic  soul filled life, over flowing with purpose, compassion, clarity and inspiration. 

I have started this Indiegogo campaign because I am entering the final stage of editing a book I have written about navigating the great evolutionary leap in consciousness now happening on Earth. In the book I have entitled, "Passionate Wholeness: The Re-evolution of Compassion and the Healing of our World." I write about what it means to move from narcissistic wounding to the wisdom, connection, compassion and wholeness of the soul. I began writing this book in early 2008 after being awakened from sleep by clear, audible guidance, that said "write a treatise of the soul." It has taken me several years of writing to complete this labor of love and I now need to take a month off to edit it.

My immediate goal for the campaign is $5,500 but my stretch goal is $12,500.  After I complete the final editing I will then move forward into print book formatting, cover design and book distribution.

In the book I write about the immense opportunities of our era, the ultimate potential being, a massive, collective quantum leap in consciousness.  I assert that humanity is  entering a new developmental stage, undergoing  a growth surge, that is enabling us to birth a more mature, compassionate, ethical and caring human being who naturally transforms human culture and seeks to restore the living earth.

I write about the vast I am-ness of the soul state which naturally reconciles opposites, heals split, re-marries masculine and feminine energies and brings peace, loving awareness and inspiration to all undertakings. People who embody soul consciousness, walk in tolerance, reverence and naturally serve all of life. They contribute great works that span art to social change to environmental and technological inventions. They contribute new paradigms  in education, medicine, spiritual development, capitalism and social movements that help make those societal structures that perpetuate trauma and split, obsolete.

Throughout the book I offer helpful tools for actualizing this new human being including a clear map I call, The Seven Gates of Awakening, that guides the reader through seven key phases of spiritual development. I write about the "infection" created by centuries of narcissistic culture. I describe this transformation as a re-evolution of compassion because it requires healing the soul wound created by narcissistic culture and re-opening the heart. Increased levels of emotional healing are essential to creating a tipping point within humanity that will naturally accelerate this collective leap in consciousness.

I discuss  the important role spiritual emergency plays in creating a crack through which Love can then flow into our lives and create personal and collective transformation. I give examples from my own healing journey through debilitating  autoimmune illness, to spontaneous shamanic healing and soul retrieval, to self forgiveness and self love, to substantial inner union and soul purpose.

In the book I describe new  holistic perspectives and techniques  and the powerful multi-dimensional and shamanic fields that are available to help more people process trauma so that they can reclaim disowned gifts and qualities and embody layer by layer, the empathy, clarity, passion, serenity and resiliency of the whole self or soul. This new whole and balanced human being is a harmonious blend of masculine and feminine energies, equally loving and passionate, awake in mind, heart and body, expanded, less defended and shut down, capable of great wisdom, generosity, connection, collaboration and reverence. 

I attribute the transformation that humanity is undergoing in part to the re-emergence and re-integration of the sacred feminine.The feminine principle or function which I describe in the book as Pure Being, helps us discover unconditional love and acceptance, awakens empathy, clarifies our inter-dependence and attunes us to Wisdom and the realms of higher consciousness so that we can receive epiphany, intuitions, discern inner guidance and grow. Increased integration of the feminine helps move us toward reverent and ethical collaboration and the just distribution of power and resources.

I also write about the gift of the balanced masculine principle, which I call Pure Awareness, and the impact that the current communication revolution is having on accelerating a collective leap in consciousness.  The rate at which knowledge is being distributed is unprecedented and new levels of transparency, radically new perceptions, technological innovations are being spread through social media and mobile devices every minute. Powerful information is no longer in the hands of the elite few. Its in the hands of everyone.

Humanity is entering this new developmental stage just at the point where we, in our immaturity and myopic-ness, have devastated much of the natural world and climate change reels forward past the eleventh hour. Mystics, healers, shamans, empaths, visionaries, contemplatives, evolutionary thinkers, change makers, teachers, social entrepreneurs, environmentalists, artists, writers, musicians, choreographers, filmmakers and scientists are already riding and documenting this wave of change. I believe as do those on my campaign team, that this book will help seekers of varied backgrounds evolve!

"Passionate Wholeness" can help seekers of all backgrounds:

  • embrace spiritual emergency and emotional healing
  • sense their soul's deeper spiritual agenda and purpose
  • deepen awareness of their own power to effect change
  • expedite the evolutionary tipping point that is needed to continue to birth the Divine Human Being, now!
  • Help shift humanity to a sustainable, generous and compassionate future and restore balance to the living Earth

My Immediate Goal and Stretch Goals

    What We Need

    My immediate Goal: $5,500

    Stretch Goal: $12,500

    All additional money beyond my initial campaign helps to cover the costs of:

    • proof reading
    • print file formatting
    • print book distribution
    • book cover design

    What You Get In Return for Your Support!

    Our Favorite Thank You Gift! $100

    Four signed copies of Passionate Wholeness (spread the Love and give them as gifts), a Podcast of Seven Gates of Awakening, Two Tickets to Book Celebration on January 24, 2015 with Greta Bro Group and Special Guests, Music and Dancing

    A Grateful Thank You Gift! $25
    Two signed copies (give one as a gift) of Passionate Wholeness!

    Passionate Thank You Gift! $50
    Two signed copies (give one as a gift), One ticket to Book Celebration on Saturday, January 24, 2015, with Greta Bro Group and Special Guests, Music and Dancing

    Blissful Thank you! $250

    Four signed copies of Passionate Wholeness (spread the love and give them as gifts), a Podcast on Seven Gates of Awakening, One Invitation to Participate in a Workshop with Greta Bro on The Seven Gates Of Awakening, Two Tickets to Book Celebration on Saturday, January 24, 2015 with Greta Bro Group and Special Guests, Music and Dancing

    Ecstatic Thank You! $500

    Five signed copies of Passionate Wholeness (spread the love and give them as gifts), a Podcast on The Seven Gates Of Awakening, and an Invitation for Two to Participate in a Workshop with Greta Bro on Seven Gate's of Awakening, Two Tickets to Book Celebration on Saturday, January 24, 2015 with Greta Bro Group and Special Guests,

    Deepest Thank you, Project Benefactor! $1000

    Eight copies of Passionate Wholeness (spread the love and give them as gifts), a Podcast on The Seven Gates of Awakening,  an Invitation for Two to Participate in a Workshop with Greta Bro on The Seven Gate's of Awakening, Four Tickets to Book Celebration with the Greta Bro Group and Special Guests on Saturday, January 24, 2015 with Music and Dancing,and Mention in the Acknowledgement Page of the Book

    Thank you for your help in furthering my purpose and deepening  this re-evolution of Love on earth. Please invite your loved ones to join us today!

    The Impact

    I believe this book has the power to help more seekers wake up to their personal potential through embracing spiritual development so that they are free to express their purpose and effect change on earth!

    • I offer a map for embodying the soul and fulfilling needed soul purpose
    • I offer a unique perspective on healing our world
    • The book carries a transformational field. Reading it can help clarify next steps and create personal and collective breakthrough!
    • This book can accelerate a tipping point within humanity and strengthen the Re-evolution of Compassion that is now happening on Earth!

    The Challenge: Other Ways You Can Help

    I need your financial help to finish this book but there are other ways you can help.

    • Get the word out about this campaign to family and friends using the Indiegogo share tools
    • Pray for me daily that I get the funding I need and that this final stage of editing is inspired!
    • If you live nearby, come play with my dog, offer to water my garden so I can stay on task
    • Offer editorial or proof reading assistance
    • Send words of encouragement via email and text

story:
Since our launch in August 2015, we have published over 220 articles from 120 authors, covering every topic from whale-hunting underwater drones to sex bias in clinical research to the chemistry of beer. Our editorial goal is to find the intersection of science and society — to explore how scientific data is filtered through the media, philosophy, law, education, history, politics, art and popular culture. If you haven’t been with us from the beginning, you can browse our archive of 200+ articles here.

In short, Lateral is a free digital science magazine, assembled by the next generation of scientific and creative minds.

The past two years have been an exciting period for us, and Lateral has gone from strength to strength. Every issue, our five editorial pillars — Life Science, Physical Science, Society & Education, History & Philosophy, and Art & Pop Culture — have explored a common theme from diverse and surprising angles.

  • Collectively, our articles have been read more than 150,000 times.
  • Our pieces Swept up in a gravitational wave (Ling Sun) and Downloadable, fully searchable you (Sophia Frentz) were featured in the Best Australian Science Writing 2016 anthology, published by NewSouth books.
  • Our piece Toxic Medicine (Ivy Shih) was featured in the Best Australian Science Writing 2017 anthology, published in October 2017.
  • Along the way, we have also forged partnerships with various academic institutions, including the Royal Society of Victoria, the Australian Society for Fish Biology, and the Australasian Society for the Study of Animal Behaviour.

"Always relevant and engaging"
"Absolutely top notch [artwork]"
"Quality content and [a] lack of sensationalism”
Feedback from our 2017 readers' survey

Lateral has been a labour of love for us. We have enjoyed receiving such positive feedback from our readers, and we want to continue bringing quality science content to your newsfeeds. 

But to keep Lateral on the net, we need your help!

Publishing a regular magazine demands a great deal of time and effort: A feature article that takes you 15 minutes to read might take dozens of hours of labour, including research and interviews, writing, subediting, and the creation of original artwork. In this current publishing climate, far too many publications expect their contributors to work for free, and we’re proud to be bucking that trend by paying our writers and artists.

At present, we pay our writers AU$50 per feature and AU$30 per general article, and our artists receive AU$50 for feature artwork. For many of our contributors, this payment — modest as it may be — is the first time that they have been remunerated for their writing, and we see Lateral as a stepping stone towards a career in science communication.

We managed to publish two years worth of content from our first crowdfunding campaign back in 2015, which was a great start. Now we need your help once more as we transition to our next phase as a not-for-profit charity. 

The funds from this campaign will also help us pay overhead costs for the magazine, including registering the magazine as a company and applying for charity status with the Australian Charities and Not-For-Profits Commission (ACNC). This will allow us to move towards more permanent funding sources and apply for grants to sustain the magazine going forward.

This year, each issue of Lateral will be accompanied by our new podcast: Collateral. Like the magazine, producing a podcast costs money. Collateral will provide an avenue to help emerging science communicators develop their podcast and radio skills alongside their written and artistic abilities.

Meanwhile, our tireless editorial team will continue to volunteer their free time every week to ensure that each issue of Lateral brings you a diverse range of high-quality, reliable science content. We don’t receive any payment, but feel free to buy us a drink if you see us around.

What do you get out of it?

In the past two years, our articles were viewed over 150,000 times — and every single one of those viewings was free! Lateral wants scientific thinking to be shared as widely as possible and, by supporting us, you will be rewarded with a swathe of original, intelligent and creative content.

Not enough incentive? If you donate to our campaign, you will also have the option to choose one of many exciting perks. Based on your contribution, you can sponsor an article or even a column for a whole year. If there’s a field of science that you’re particularly passionate about, you can even choose the theme of an entire Lateral issue.

Stretch goals

If we exceed our $10,000 goal, we will invest those funds into ensuring the long-term longevity of Lateral, and also increase the amount of original magazine content per issue.

$15,000: If we reach 150% funding, we'll pay our contributors more. They deserve it for the high quality work they produce and we want to value that as highly as we can.  

$20,000: If we receive 200% of our goal, we will organise an emerging science writers conference in Melbourne in 2018/2019. We will invite a variety of science communicators to attend, hold workshops, and create networking opportunities for writers new to science communication.

Risks? Challenges?

We’ve been on a short hiatus since September 2017 to shore up the magazine, but the next issue of Lateral magazine will be published on February 5th, and our team of editors, writers and artists are already toiling away to prepare content, which we’re sure you will love. (Hint: We can’t give too much away, but the next theme is “Waves”). While we have secured some institutional funding to help us move forward, and have enough to cover what we’ve already commissioned, we really do need your help to continue publishing Lateral.

We’ve got such a great smorgasboard of stories to tell you this year, and we’d hate for you to miss out.

Other Ways You Can Help

Light on cash, but still want to help Lateral? Whether you contribute $1 or $1000, we really appreciate every cent of support. If you'd like to help Lateral in another way, please share this crowdfunding campaign to your networks — it will make a world of difference.

We’re working on developing new funding streams that will help secure Lateral in the long-term, including forming partnerships with scientific or academic organisations. If you are involved with an organisation that might like to formally partner with Lateral, please get in touch with us.

story:
The Happy Break-up

The Happy Break-Up is a book of quotes, prompts, illustrations and wisdom nuggets that will help you regain your self-esteem and sense of purpose after a break up. It is intended to make you do some deep thinking and a little bit of hard personal work, in order to get to a place where you fully and completely love yourself.

It is not a book about bashing your ex, nor is it a book about getting your ex back. This book is all about you and making yourself the priority, moving forward.  

Why me? Why this book? Why now?

I’m Cate. I’m the author and illustrator of The Happy Break-Up. I wrote this book because I’ve been through a lot of break-ups, without any real help or guidance, and I never quite knew how to “get over it” in a happy and healthy way. I went to therapy, which was the best thing I’ve ever done in my life. And since then, I’ve moved on from my prior career in the television industry, and am currently pursuing my Masters of Counselling Psychology, in order to become a psychotherapist. I am a natural communicator and storyteller, as well as an artist, and I have an innate desire to help others.  The knowledge that I’ve gained throughout my life, both from personal experiences, and from my studies, has put me in a good position to share my wisdom with you.

About the publishing process

I have partnered with Golden Brick Road Publishing House, where a team of experts will undertake all the editing, publishing, marketing, design for The Happy Break-Up.  Ky-Lee Hanson and her team of dedicated professionals have been helping me throughout the development process of the book and will see it through beyond its completion and publication.

About the book

The Happy Break-Up is a beautiful piece of art, which will inspire you every time you pick it up. It contains a mixture of hand-drawn quotes and art, prompts, and wisdom nuggets, that when completed, should help you feel a sense of purpose and an increase in confidence. This is a book that requires active participation as well as introspection and deep thinking, in order to achieve the best possible outcome for your life. At the same time, The Happy Break-Up is also a fun and interesting experience – you’ll hardly notice that you’re doing the hard mental work, because the activities are created to make you smile.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute, but still want to help... please consider:

  • Helping me get the word out and making some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the share tools to spread the word to your social networks.
  • If you know anyone who is going through a break-up, let them know about this book!

And that's all there is to it.

Got Questions?

Shoot me an email - hello@categennaro.com :) 

Friends/Family in Toronto who want an autographed copy of the book - please ask me for a special link for your order! 

Our Team

Cate Gennaro - Author of The Happy Break-up

 

Ky-Lee Hanson - Founder & Director - Golden Brick Road Publishing House

Tania Jane Moraes-Vaz - Editor - Golden Brick Road Publishing House

story:
New God of the Asylum

The fate of Milton's Landing is in the hands of Yorick, a troubled scientist from another world, another dimension. Will he be able to open the Asylum, making Fortinbras the first of the new gods? Milton's Landing and the Asylum await...

New God of the Asylum began 18 years ago (which means I've been working on it half my life). Initially it was a poor combination of The Highlander, Twin Peaks, and The Magic Mountain. Then I had an insight into the core of what I was trying to say, which would make it into a unique, compelling book. It also meant I had to rewrite 95% of the book. Now it's time to publish New God of the Asylum, and I would appreciate any help you can provide.

What You Get

The money raised will let me get the book published and promoted, and you will:

  • Get the book sooner
  • Get it signed
  • Get your name in the book
  • Get extras not available anywhere else

How Your Donation Will Help

Reaching my goal will help me immeasurably, not just by getting my first novel published, but by validating the time I've spent on it over the years. With professional design, editng, and some promotional support, your contribution will help me make the most of the last 18 years.

Other Ways You Can Help

Know someone who like science fiction or fantasy? Please let them know!

You can use Indiegogo's "Share Tools" to help get the word out and make my first novel a success.

Thank you!

About The Author

Eric Ralph is a creative-minded person working as a finance advisor for a Fortune 100 company. In his spare time, he exhibits an astonishing lack of focus, spending time gardening, playing the trombone, reading, teaching karate, giving speeches, learning to play guitar, and, of course, writing.

Visit my blog at http://ericralph.blogspot.com/

story:
(English translation available, please read English version below)

Sjećate se prve knjige Avantura Trbe i Dugog?

E, to je napisala jedna Jelena. Ona, njen drugar Mladen, i crtač Dejan, su uz vašu pomoć napravili super knjigu! Napravili su i igračke od papira, koje je kreirao Brajan Kastelfort, dizajner iz Los Anđelesa. Za više informacija kliknite ovdje.

Na promociju  u Muzej savremene umjetnosti RS  je došlo više od 200 djece. Stotine djece su kasnije zavoljele Trbu, Dugog, Princezu i Zmaja, zato što su šašavi i dobri i smotani i drugačiji od drugih. 

Za ovu prvu knjigu, Jelena je nominovana za najveću nagradu za književnost za djecu na svijetu, Astrid Lindgren, i knjiga je gotovo u potpunosti rasprodata. Znate zašto? Zato što je super! 

 

E, sad je opet na vas red. Vrijeme je za drugu knjigu.

Jelena je napisala još bolju priču od prve. Zmaj je bolestan, drugari lete, princeza nosi gas masku, i pojavljuje se jedan naročit zec.

A ovo je Nataša. Ona je ilustrator nove epizode. Nacrtala je fenomenalne crteže, i knjiga je skoro sasvim spremna za štampu. Međutim, treba nam pomoć da se odštampa jedna ovako šarena i lijepa knjiga. Plus, ovu epizodu ćemo ubaciti u tvrdi povez, da bi knjige još duže trajale.

Tu vi uskačete. Rezervišite svoje primjerke unaprijed, na ćirilici, latinici ili engleskom jeziku, i pomozite da Jelena, Nataša i Mladen objave knjigu!

I da vam šapnemo nešto,  biće još puuuno nastavaka, Jelena je već smislila nove priče, a vi imate priliku da nam pomognete dok razvijamo serijal. Kupite knjigu, pričajte prijateljima, dijelite na društvenim mrežama.

Budite dio priče o Trbi i Dugom. I širite priču dalje. Ako i niste u prilici da kupujete preko interneta, dijelite našu priču po društvenim mrežama, to nam veoma znači, da knjiga dođe u prave ruke.

I ne zaboravite, nekad je bolje biti različit, blesav, sa dušom poput dječje.

 

Odlučili ste da nas podržite?

SJAJNO! Kad budete rezervisali vašu nagradu, obratite pažnju na jezik, koju verziju uzimate. Takođe, za sve zemlje osim BiH postoje dodatni troškovi poštarine. Minimalni, ali postoje.


 

 

 

Do you remember the first book of The Adventures of Tubby and Stretch?


Well, it was written by one mother, named Jelena. She, her friend Mladen, and illustrator Dejan made a great book with your help! They also made paper-toys, designed by Brian Catleforte, famous designer from Los Angeles. For more information, click here.

More than 200 children attended the book premiere at the Museum of Contemporary Art. Hundreds of children fell in love with Tubby, Stretch, Princess and the Dragon, because they are silly, and clumsy, and good, and different from others.

For that first book, Jelena has been nominated for the most important award for children's literature in the world, Astrid Lindgren memorial Award, and the book is almost entirely sold out. You know why? Because it's awesome!

 

Well, now it's your turn again. It's time for another book.

Jelena has written an even better story than the first. The Dragon is sick, friends are flying, the Princess wears a gas mask, and a very special rabbit appears.

This time, we have help from Nataša. She is the illustrator of the new episode. She drew fabulous drawings, the book is almost ready for printing. However, we need help to print this colorful and beautiful book. Plus, we'll put this episode in hard cover to make it last more.

That's where you all come in. Pledge your copies in advance, in Cyrillic, Latin or English, and help my mom, Nataša and Mladen publish a book!

And let us tell you something else, there will be more sequels, Jelena had already came up with a new stories, and you have the chance to help us. Buy a book, spread the word, share on social networks.

Be part of the story of Tubby and Stretch. Spread the word. If you are not able to pledge at the moment, share our story on social networks, that means a lot to us, we want our book in right hands.

And do not forget, sometimes it's better to be different, silly, with the soul like a child.

 

You have decided to support us?

GREAT! When you pledge, pay attention to the language, which version you are taking. Also, for all countries except Bosnia and Herzegovina there is additional shipping cost. Minimal, but there is one.

story:
My name is Roslyn Coleman and I’m going to produce a series of eBooks titled “Short and Sweet”.  I’m sure you’ve heard of the series “For Dummies” or the “Idiot’s Guide” my series “Short and Sweet” will cover several different topics that are trending.  The first book in the series will be “LinkedIn, Short and Sweet - Use LinkedIn for career or business development, to grow your network, to land a job, and more". The eBooks will retail for $2.99-$4.95 on Amazon and iTunes.

What will separate “Short and Sweet” from the Dummies and Idiots series? The "Short and Sweet" series will be just that short and sweet, to the point, no fluff.  It will contain more graphics and images, because a picture is worth a thousand words.

I decided to publish this book as an electronic book because eBook sales grew 177% last year and show no signs of slowing according to an article posted on May 11, 2010 by jtimothycole. Basically, creating an eBook affords me the flexibility and opportunity to provide illustrations and example videos, which wouldn't be possible with traditional publications.

What We Need & What You Get

I’m looking to raise $2,500 to aid in publishing my first eBook in the “Short and Sweet” series.  A few more topics being considered for the series are Dating - Short and Sweet, Facebook - Short and Sweet, and Pinterest - Short and Sweet.

The Impact

Funds collected will go toward the following

  • To cover the cost of expert editing
  • Software need to properly format eBook for publishing and optimal resolution
  • To cover the cost of a Graphic Artist/Illustrator
  • To cover the cost of marketing and promotions

Other Ways You Can Help - Referral Contest

You may find this a worthy project but just don’t have the funds to contribute.  Well this doesn’t mean you can’t help, you can surely help by making some noise and getting the word out about my campaign. If you are not able to make a contribution you can participate in my Referral Contest. Visit the my indiegogo.com/Short-Sweet page and share it using the Indiegogo share tools below the video. The person who's referrals generate the most contribution will win a $25 gift certificate to a local restaurant in their town (US only).

Thank you very much.

story:
A Real Presidential Poll Now!

Who will win this years Presidential Election?

Obama or Romney ??

I come from a family split on who to vote for on this election and I believe America is to. Lets find out who is going to win prior to the actual election.  I am holding the DAVE'S INDIEGOGO PRESIDENTIAL POLL, the REAL American presidential poll.  I will be adding up the donations/votes on a daily basis and on November 5, at 8:00pm will be anouncing live the next President of the United States of America one day prior to the election.  Now that will be FUN.

     A  portion of the donations will be going to the Ronald Mcdonald House for Kids.  I have a real soft spot for kids .  My son Riley Jonathon was taken from me by a driver that had been drinking in Southern California on October 10, 2002.  A piece of me was taken that day that I have never been able to get back.  He was only 6 1/2 years old and just the finest child a father could ever have. He was soo happy and innocent and anything I can do to help other children I will do.

     Donate now while playing a fun game!  Your candidate deserves to win vote for him NOW by donating to this fund.  Show the world who is going to win our Presidential Election and help kids at the same time.

Donate to Dave's Indiegogo Presidential Poll the "Real" American Presidential Poll.

Be part of the poll and be part of the fun.  Donate Now!

$5  to $500,000 your choice , your candidate  -  OBAMA OR ROMNEY who will it be?

story: They say a picture is worth a thousand words. That may be true, but it doesn't eliminate the need for words all together. The purpose of "Worth a Thousand Words" is to provide a text resource for visual artists who need to promote themselves on the Internet or in print, but struggle to communicate it effectively in the written word. Additionally, there are many artists for whom English is not their native language. My writing service may be particularly useful to them. Writing is an art too, and I understand and share an artist's passion. I'm an artist working in the medium of text. If you need effective copy to promote your project, exhibit or other artistic pursuit, I want to help you. Let me tell your story with my words.
